XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XXXX SSN : XXXX XXXX : XXXX Phone Number : XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX TX XXXX Subject : Formal Dispute for Inaccurate Reporting - Request for Immediate Investigation and Removal Account in Question : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Balance Reported : {$320.00} Status : Closed, charged off Dear Experian Dispute Department, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate and unverifiable information being reported on my credit file in relation to the above-referenced XXXX XXXX XXXX account . This dispute is submitted under my rights provided by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), which entitles me to request full verification of any account reported on my credit file. An immediate investigation into the accuracy of this account is required. 

Nature of Dispute : Fraudulent Account : I am disputing this account as fraudulent. I have never opened an account with XXXX XXXX XXXX, and this account was opened without my authorization. I have submitted an Identity Theft Report to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and filed a police report with the XXXX Police Department, both of which are enclosed with this letter. 
Failure to Verify Information : The balance, account status, and other reported information are inaccurate. The account shows a balance of {$320.00} and past-due status as of XX/XX/XXXX, yet XXXX XXXX XXXX has failed to provide proper documentation validating this debt. I demand full verification of this account, including a copy of the original contract with my wet signature. 

Legal Demands for Verification : Pursuant to FCRA Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), I demand that Experian provide me with : 1. A copy of the original contract for this account with my wet signature as proof of validation. A mere statement or computer-generated record is insufficient and does not constitute legal proof of this debt. 
2. Verification of all information reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX, including the balance, payment history, and account status. 

Failure to Provide Verification : If XXXX XXXX XXXX  can not provide the requested documentation, as required by FCRA Sections 611 and 623, you are obligated to delete this account from my credit file. Reporting unverifiable or inaccurate information is a violation of the FCRA, and I expect this to be resolved promptly. 

Supporting Documentation : A copy of my FTC Identity Theft Affidavit A copy of the XXXX Police Department Identity Theft Report A copy of my UCC-11 filing indicating no legitimate claim from XXXX XXXX XXXX Expected Resolution : If this account can not be fully verified within 30 days, I expect it to be deleted from my credit file in accordance with FCRA guidelines. Please confirm receipt of this dispute and notify me of the outcome once your investigation is complete. 

This letter has been sent via certified mail with a return receipt requested to ensure timely processing. Should this dispute remain unresolved, I will file a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and pursue further legal action if necessary. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  Enclosures : FTC Identity Theft Affidavit XXXX Police Department Identity Theft Report UCC-11 Filing Copy of Drivers License Proof of Address

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the removal of my credit history with XXXX XXXX and the inaccurate classification of a {$6.00} balance as fraud on my credit report. After contacting XXXX, I was informed that the removal of my account from my credit report was based on Experians reporting that the {$6.00} balance was fraudulent. However, I wish to clarify that this transaction was not fraudulent and should not have been reported as such. 

Background of the Dispute : Experians Misclassification of Fraud : On [ insert date ], I filed a dispute through Experian regarding a {$6.00} balance on my XXXX XXXX XXXX This dispute was intended to challenge the accuracy of the amount but not to claim it as fraudulent. However, Experian incorrectly classified this dispute as fraud, which has led to the complete removal of my XXXX account from my credit history. 

XXXX  Response : After contacting XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, I was informed that XXXX  requires a letter from Experian stating that the {$6.00} balance was not a fraudulent transaction in order to restore my credit history. XXXX has expressed that they can not reinstate the account until this matter is resolved. 

Legal Basis for My Dispute : Under federal law, specifically the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., both consumer reporting agencies like Experian and creditors like XXXX have the obligation to ensure the accuracy of the information provided on credit reports. Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ), when information is disputed and later found to be accurate or inaccurate for reasons other than fraud, the appropriate correction must be made, and the reporting agency must notify the creditor of any changes. In this case, the failure to correct this error has caused significant damage to my credit profile. 

Furthermore, under Texas state law, particularly the XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX  XXXX, and XXXX  XXXX, any consumer reporting agency or financial institution operating in Texas is required to ensure accurate information is reported and to provide prompt correction when errors are discovered. XXXX  refusal to restore my credit history without a letter from Experian violates their duty to report accurate credit information. 

Requested Resolution : Experian : I request that you promptly issue a letter to XXXX XXXX XXXX indicating that the {$6.00} balance was not fraudulent and that the previous dispute was solely about the accuracy of the balance. This letter should also state that the XXXX XXXX account was erroneously removed due to this misclassification. 

XXXX XXXX : Upon receipt of this letter from Experian, I request that you immediately reinstate my credit history with XXXX, reflecting my full and accurate account activity. 

This situation has caused significant harm to my credit profile, and I expect prompt resolution in accordance with the applicable federal and state laws. If this matter is not resolved promptly, I will have no choice but to seek legal remedies to address the damage caused by this misreporting.

Please respond to this dispute in writing within 30 days, as required by the FCRA and Texas state law, with confirmation that the issue has been resolved.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to seek your assistance regarding an urgent matter involving my Bank of America Business Checking Account. On XX/XX/XXXX, I deposited a check for {$100000.00} from my mother, which was drawn from her XXXX account. Unfortunately, Bank of America flagged this check as counterfeit and subsequently froze the funds. 

As a result, the money has been inaccessible to my business, causing significant financial losses. I have contacted Bank of Americas helpline multiple times, but they have not provided any effective solutions. Their representatives informed me that they can not proceed until the check 's maker verifies the funds. 

To resolve this, my mother traveled from XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, and we visited several Bank of America branches to verify the funds in person. Despite our efforts, the staff were unhelpful and suggested that my mother recall the funds under fraud from XXXX, despite the fact that there is no indication of fraud. 

This situation has become increasingly distressing, as my business relies heavily on these funds. I would appreciate your guidance and intervention in this matter to help expedite the resolution and restore access to my funds.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX GA, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Last 4 SSN : XXXX TODAYS DATE : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX NOTICE OF PENDING LITIGATION SEEKING RELIEF AND MONETARY COMPENSATION UNDER FCRA 15 U.S. Code 1681n Civil liability for willful noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1681o Civil liability for negligent noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1692k civil liability. 
Please accept this final written OFFER OF SETTLEMENT BEFORE LITIGATION as my attempt to amicably resolve your continued violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act regarding your refusal to delete INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated information from my consumer file. I intend to pursue litigation in accordance with the FCRA to seek relief and recover all monetary damages that I may be entitled to under Section 616 and Section 617 if the INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated items listed below are not deleted immediately. A copy of this letter as well as INACCURATE ERRONEOUS ITEMS sent to you previously will also become part of a formal complaint to the Federal Trade Commission and shall be used as evidence in pending litigation provided you fail to comply with this offer of settlement.

YOU ARE IN DIRECT VIOLATION OF THE FCRA, the unverified items listed below still remain on my credit report in violation of Federal Law. You are required under the FCRA to have a copy of the original creditors documentation on file to verify that this information is mine and is correct. In the results of your investigations, you stated in writing that you verified that these items are being reported correctly Who verified these accounts? You have NOT provided me a copy of ANY original documentation ( a consumer contract with my signature on it ) as required under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Furthermore, you have failed to provide the method of verification as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). Please be advised that under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to ... promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified. 
Its very obvious that your agency doesnt know what the FCRA is, because from the looks of my credit report and all the errors I see, heres my breakdown : 1.The Fair Credit Reporting Act is the primary federal law that governs the collection and reporting of credit information about consumers. Its rules cover how a consumer 's credit information is obtained, how long it is kept, and how it is shared with othersincluding consumers themselves.

2. What is a FCRA violation?

Creditors give reporting agencies inaccurate financial information about you. Reporting agencies mixing up one person 's information with another 's because of similar ( or same ) last name or social security number. Agencies fail to follow guidelines for handling disputes.

3. My rights under the fair credit reporting act : Verify the accuracy of my report when it is required for employment purposes. 
Receive notification if information in my file has been used against me in applying for credit or other transactions. 
Disputeand have the bureaus correct and deleteinformation in my report that is incomplete, inaccurate, and unverifiable. 
Remove outdated, negative information ( after seven years in most cases, 10 in the case of bankruptcy ). 
I demand these items be deleted immediately. I entered the items and the outcome I desire below because you are in violation and these items are not 100 % accurate. 
They are either INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated. I recently applied for extended credit and was denied I am in distress because of your mistakes. 
The law is very clear as to the Civil liability and the remedy available to me ( Section 616 & 617 ) if you fail to comply with Federal Law. I am a litigious consumer and fully intend on pursuing litigation in this matter to enforce my rights under the FCRA. 
1. Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) this account in violation not reporting 100 % accurate. The payments have been on time. 
XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Your improper procedures are highly damaging to my credit score. Please immediately UPDATE LATE PAYMENTS FROM XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  AND XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  TO PAID VIOLATION OF 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance ( a ) In general Any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00} ; or ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ; ( 2 ) such amount of punitive damages as the court may allow ; and ( 3 ) in the case of any successful action to enforce any liability under this section, the costs of the action together with reasonable attorneys fees as determined by the court. 
( b ) Civil liability for knowing noncompliance Any person who obtains a consumer report from a consumer reporting agency under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose shall be liable to the consumer reporting agency for actual damages sustained by the consumer reporting agency or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater. 
* Please remove all non-account holding inquiries Please note that you have 30 days to complete this investigation, as per the Fair Credit Reporting Act Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested as well, to be provided within ( 5 ) days of the completion of your re-investigation and I am keeping a careful record of your actions, including your Method of Verification. I do not consent to e-Oscar or any means of automated verification. 
Failure to respond satisfactorily within 30 days of receipt of this certified letter may result in a small claims action against your company, seeking {$5000.00} per violation for : 1. ) Defamation 2. ) Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3. ) Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act 4. ) Financial Injury P.S. Please be aware that dependent upon your response, I may be detailing any potential issues with your company via an online public press release, including documentation of any potential small claims action. I am also including a copy of my complaint to the organizations below : CC : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX of Enforcement Consumer Financial Protection XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Washington, D.C. XXXX : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau CC : Attorney Generals Office CC : XXXX XXXX XXXX CC : State Senate CC : Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation CC : Comptroller Of The Currency CC : Federal Reserve System CC : Credit and insurance CC : Federal Trade Commission CC : State Regulatory agency CC : California Regulatory agency Division of consumer complaints Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
This notice is to inform you that you have unlawfully reported an alleged debt to my consumer report. Under the New Rule REGULATION F which took effect XX/XX/year>, You have violated the FDCPA 1006.30a and its new rule by parking this alleged debt on my consumer reports. Cease and Desist the reporting of this alleged Debt immediately or I will escalate this matter to taking legal action. I have not given you written permission to put anything on my credit profile 15 USC 1681b2. You have no permissible purpose by law to contact third parties with my private or personal information. Your offenses amount to Aggravated Identity Theft pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 1028A. You have knowingly transferred, possessed, or used, without lawful authority, a means of identification of me, which is a felony punishable with up to 2 years of imprisonment, in addition to civil liability. I AM A LITIGIOUS CONSUMER I WILL NOT HESITATE TO TAKE LEGAL ACTION AGAINST 15 USC 1692c ( c ) Ceasing communication If a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing that the consumer refuses to pay a debt or that the consumer wishes the debt collector to cease further communication with the consumer, the debt collector shall not communicate further with the consumer with respect to such debt. Cease and Desist all collections or derogatory activity regarding the alleged debts on my credit report.

You have caused me and my family severe harm due to your negligence and inaccurate reporting. This is in violation of my consumer rights and is affecting my credit worthiness.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report.

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and may be the result of identity theft or other illegal activities. Attempting to enforce these fraudulent accounts is unlawful. I request that you expedite your investigation to prevent further harm, losses, or damages that I may suffer as a victim of identity theft. 

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I hope youre doing well! I wanted to share something that's been bothering me lately regarding my credit report. I recently checked it and found some inaccuracies that I need to address. 

There are several accounts listed that seem to be inconsistent, and its really confusing. Here are the accounts Im talking about : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX The problem is that theyre not reporting the information consistently. When I look at my credit profile, its clear that the details dont match up, which is super frustrating. This inconsistency could really affect my creditworthiness. 

I already wrote to the credit bureaus about these issues, but I havent heard back from them yet. Its been a bit of a hassle, and Im starting to get anxious about it. I just want to make sure everything is accurate!

I also referenced some sections of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) in my complaint to support my case. Specifically, I mentioned : - **Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) ** : This section requires the consumer reporting agency to provide consumers with the information in their file upon request.

- **Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) ** : This gives consumers the right to dispute inaccurate information and request an investigation.

- **Section 605 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ) ** : This limits how long negative information can be reported, ensuring that inaccuracies are corrected promptly. 

Just wanted to vent a little and keep you in the loop. Please help if possible. 

Take care

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX we noticed that my husbands card was being used out of state. We called PNC to lock the card and send a new one. I also requested a new one. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I attempted to use my card for a personal separate account at an ATM. My pin is no longer working. I tired to call PNC for assistance and they told me they could not help. However, this very same pin works just fine in accessing mobile banking and the automated system. 

Somehow, they have deactivated my cards and I no longer have access to our joint checking, or my personal checking account. 

As if XX/XX/XXXX my husbands card has not arrived, but mine has. However, I can not activate it and my personal checking account card is also not functional and on mobile banking they no longer show as valid. 

I am unable to go to a branch due to health issues and work hours, and I am locked out of my account with no way to pay bills or eat. We are forced to use a credit card to get by. PNC offers no assistance on the website, app, or over the phone. 

This needs to be fixed immediately. A new card needs to be sent overnight to my husband and PNC needs to send me new cards with the correct pin assigned overnight and help me regain access to my accounts. 

It has been over a week. We have waited long enough and tried to do things their way.

Several areas in South Florida still currently have no electricity, no landlines, no running water and very limited cell service. 

Therefore, i am requesting that you stop reporting any delinquencies and late payments from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Please also waive any minimum payments due from XXXX for at least 90 days ; waive the minimum payment up to three billing cycles. 

Do not report it as a late payment. 

Prevent and waive any late fees. 

The reason why insurers are acting so fast on this is if you remember after Katrina hit XXXX XXXX and Hurricane Wilma hit Florida ( before mobile banking ) all of the credit card companies were cooperating with the exception of one issuer. 

The media caught wind of it when they said if you can't make the minimum payment, we'll just add the late fee to your existing balance. XXXX XXXX then retracted and retroactively refunded late fees in Hurricane affected areas.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX BALANCE {$16000.00} XXXX XXXX  XXXX BALANCE {$18.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX BALANCE {$0.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX BALANCE {$41000.00} RE : Late Payment Improperly Reported- I XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX have a RIGHT TO PRIVACY under 15 USC 1681A ( 4 ) as a federally protected consumer and I know my rights presented under the Fair Credit Reporting Act clearly outlined within 15 USC 1681. The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. So, whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft. This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n and 15 USC 1681o, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent. I was reviewing my consumer reports and noticed XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on my credit report that need be immediately updated to paid as agreed. My Consumer rights have been violated by Experian, XXXX, XXXX. Experian, XXXX, XXXX, has violated my consumer rights and violated federal law. This is now multiple attempts to notify you of this erroneous error on the part of your agency. This erroneous late payment is affecting my ability to obtain a loan to save my business from crumbling and also blocking me from the housing that I so desperately need for myself and my family. Please change this to paid as agreed immediately so that I may proceed with my life, or I may be forced to seek legal damages against your agency as I already have sought legal counsel in this more than important matter. Thank you.

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Account Number : XXXX To : Attorney Generals office of XXXX  XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau FTC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  RE XXXX TD Bank XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Deceptive Mortgage Practices and Illegal Collection Tactics Dear Sir/Madam : I am writing to formally complain about TD Bank 's handling of my mortgage forbearance and subsequent attempts to collect an outstanding balance. 

Due to job loss and severe financial distress, I sought a mortgage forbearance, which TD Bank approved. Upon concluding the forbearance period, I was informed by XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/year>, that I could have the forbearance balance added to the rear of my loan. I consented and was assured that this request was submitted to underwriting. 

Despite my proactive efforts to clarify and finalize this request, including multiple communications with TD Bank representatives, I have seen no resolution. My documented interactions include : - XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX requested the loan forbearance amounts be added to my loan 's end. 
- XXXX XXXX : Two inquiries were made to underwriting regarding adding amounts from the forbearance period. 
- XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX informed me that an email had been sent for account updates, confirming the matter was pending with underwriting. 
- XXXX XXXX : I escalated the issue to supervisor XXXX ( XXXX ) due to adverse actions impacting my credit report. 

Despite being assured of no adverse actions while my loan was under review, TD Bank has reported late payments for 120 days and an outstanding balance of {$12000.00} to credit bureaus. This has resulted in my credit score plummeting from XXXX to XXXX, creating severe personal and financial hardship. 

I believe TD Bank 's practices in this situation violate ethical and possibly legal standards. I urge you to address this matter expeditiously, rectify the inaccuracies reported to the credit bureaus, and ensure fair treatment moving forward. 

If this issue remains unresolved, I will be forced to seek legal counsel and consider sharing my experience publicly to highlight these questionable practices, particularly concerning how they disproportionately affect individuals in marginalized communities. 

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to your timely response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint regarding unauthorized credit inquiries made by three financial institutions : XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX all reporting on my Experian credit report, dated XX/XX/XXXX. These banks made hard inquiries on my Experian credit report without my knowledge or consent, in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which governs permissible purposes for credit inquiries. Under the FCRA, a creditor must have a legitimate purpose, such as my explicit authorization, a credit transaction initiated by me, or a court order, to access my credit report. I have not applied for credit or had any transactions with the aforementioned banks that would justify such inquiries. Their actions are in direct violation of my consumer rights. 

The following case law is relevant to my complaint : XXXX. Pintos v. XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX  XXXX ) - in this case, the Ninth circuit ruled that the Fair Credit Reporting Act does not allow for a credit inquiry without a permissible purpose. The court held that accessing a consumers credit report without explicit authorization or a valid credit-related reason is an FCRA violation. 

XXXX v. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX Cir. XXXX ) - The XXXX XXXX ruled that companies that make unauthorized inquiries or do not have a valid reason for obtaining consumer reports can be held liable for violations of the FCRA, reinforcing the need for consent or a permissible purpose under 15 U.S.C. 1681b. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( C.D. XXXX. XXXX ) - This case reaffirmed that unauthorized inquiries into a consumers credit history violate the FCRA, and the consumer is entitled to statutory damages and other relief if the inquiry was made without consent or legitimate reason. 

These hard inquiries have negatively impacted my credit score, and I believe I am entitled to relief, including the removal of these unauthorized inquiries from my credit report and any statutory damages as provided under the FCRA. 

I am requesting that the CFPB Investigate this matter and hold these institutions accountable for their unauthorized actions and furthermore, remove and delete these inquiries off of my Experian credit report. Please provide me with updates on the investigation and let me know if any further information is needed. 

Thank you for your time and assistance in this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Final Warning Dispute Under FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) and FCRA 1681e ( b ) This letter serves as my final warning to Experian regarding the 10 inaccurate accounts listed on my credit report. I have previously disputed these accounts, yet you continue to report them despite your obligation under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) and 1681e ( b ).

It is evident that your investigation into my dispute was both lazy and inadequate. By relying on the automated e-OSCAR system to handle the investigation, you have completely failed to meet your statutory obligations to conduct a thorough and reasonable review of the disputed information. The law demands that Experian use reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy, and this reliance on an automated system is a blatant violation of FCRA 1681e ( b ).

Additionally, when you claim to have updated the information in response to my dispute, the reality is that no such update was made. The accounts remain exactly as they were, and this false representation is yet another violation of your responsibilities under the FCRA. You are required by law to remove or correct inaccurate and unverifiable information. Continuing to report these accounts in their current form is not only misleading, but also a clear demonstration of your willful disregard for federal consumer protection laws. 

If you do not delete these 10 accounts from my credit report immediately, I will have no choice but to escalate this matter further. I am prepared to file a lawsuit against Experian for willful non-compliance with the FCRA, and I will also be notifying the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) of your violations.

This is your final opportunity to correct your errors and comply with the law. I expect confirmation of the removal of the disputed accounts from my credit report within [ set a reasonable time, e.g., 10 days ]. Failure to do so will result in legal action without further notice.

This version emphasizes that Experians reliance on e-OSCAR violates their duty to conduct a proper investigation, while also addressing their failure to update or remove the incorrect information. The letter warns of legal action if the issues are not corrected promptly.

Consumer complaint narrative: RE : Late Payment Improperly Reported- I XXXX XXXX XXXX have a RIGHT TO PRIVACY under 15 USC 1681A ( 4 ) as a federally protected consumer and I know my rights presented under the Fair Credit Reporting Act clearly outlined within 15 USC 1681. The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. So, whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft. This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-XXXX. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent. I was reviewing my consumer reports and noticed XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX on my credit report that need be immediately updated to paid as agreed. My Consumer rights have been violated by Experian, XXXX, XXXX. Experian, XXXX, XXXX, has violated my consumer rights and violated federal law. This is now multiple attempts to notify you of this erroneous error on the part of your agency. This erroneous late payment is affecting my ability to obtain a loan to save my business from crumbling and also blocking me from the housing that I so desperately need for myself and my family. Please change this to paid as agreed immediately so that I may proceed with my life, or I may be forced to seek legal damages against your agency as I already have sought legal counsel in this more than important matter. Thank you.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XXXX SSN : XXXX XXXX : XXXX Phone Number : XXXX [ Date : XX/XX/year>XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX NV XXXX Phone : ( XXXX ) XXXX Subject : Formal Notice of Non-Debt and Demand for Immediate Account Deletion To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the alleged debt associated with account number XXXX purportedly owed to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I assert unequivocally that I do not owe any debt to your organization. Following a comprehensive review of the XXXX XXXX XXXX from the California Secretary of State, it is clear that no valid debts or liens exist under my name associated with XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Legal Grounds for Dispute : Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I have the unequivocal right to request validation of any alleged debt. To date, you have failed to provide sufficient evidence to substantiate your claims. Specifically, I have not received : A copy of the original contract containing my signature. 
A detailed breakdown of the alleged debt amount, including payment history. 
Documentation verifying the legal assignment of this debt, if applicable. 

Your failure to furnish these documents constitutes a violation of my rights under the FDCPA and undermines the legitimacy of your claim. Furthermore, the absence of XXXX XXXX XXXX from the lien search results substantiates that any account reported against me is fraudulent. 

Demand for Action : In light of these facts, I hereby demand the following actions be taken immediately : 1. Cease all collection activities related to the account referenced above, as required by law. 
2. Remove any and all entries related to this account from my credit report to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681. 
3. Provide written confirmation of the accounts deletion within 30 days of receiving this letter. 

Failure to comply with these requests will compel me to consider further action, including but not limited to filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), as well as seeking legal remedies for violation of my consumer rights. 

Please be advised that this letter constitutes a formal notice and demand under applicable federal and state laws. I expect your prompt attention to this matter and a resolution that reflects compliance with legal standards. 

All correspondence should be directed to my address or email provided above. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Request for Validation of Debt -XXXX XXXX XXXX I am writing in response to an alleged debt associated with account number XXXX XXXX, XXXX I am requesting validation of this debt as per my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 USC 1692g. I dispute the validity of this debt and am immediately requesting that you provide the following information : 1. The original contract binding me to this so-called debt. 2. The PAYMENT HISTORY with the original creditor and balance. 3. Copy of PROOF OF DEBT ASSIGNMENT. 4. Proof that I legally owe this debt to YOUR agency. 5. Proof that you are licensed and able to collect on this debt in my state. 6. The original PURCHASE AGREEMENT. A. THIS IS NOT ANY DEBT THAT I ORIGINATED MYSELF. I HAVE NO IDEA WHERE THIS DEBT ORIGINATED FROM. This inaccurate information needs to be re-investigated immediately by both the Credit reporting agencies and the furnishers of this information that is appearing on my consumer report. NOTE : As you can see within the screenshots that I have attached, XXXX removed this account 45 days ago. Please complete this file. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681e ( b ), A credit reporting agency must maintain accurate records at all times within the files of consumers. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681i, please perform an internal re-investigation on the validity of this account in question that is showing up on your consumer report under my name and notify me of your results within 30 days of your receipt of this letter and update my credit report accordingly to your findings. If you are unable to provide proof of my requests, then the erroneous information MUST be DELETED within 30 days of your receipt of this letter from my credit report as this erroneous account is very misleading and not mine. This account is causing me great mental anguish and I am unable to obtain a mortgage at this present time due to this inaccurate information on my credit report. Debt Collectors and Debt Buyers must furnish 100 % accurate information on consumers at all times. 15 USC 168s-2 Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION ( 1 ) PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors a person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. Please note that until the validity of this debt is verified, I demand that you CEASE all collection activities and CEASE REPORTING TO CREDIT BUREAUS IMMEDIATELY until complete and verified. Also, it is the duties of credit reporting agencies to uphold their grave responsibilities to supply 100 % accurate information ONLY on all consumer credit reports as the banking system itself hinges on accurate information. DELETE THIS ERRONEOUS INFORMATION from ALL credit bureaus immediately if the information can not be verified/validated. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Immediate Demand for Deletion and Suppression of Fraudulent Information Due to Identity Theft To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to demand the immediate deletion and suppression of fraudulent information currently present in my credit file. As a victim of identity theft, I did not authorize or make the charges associated with the items listed in the enclosed report. This false information is damaging my credit report, and I require that it be corrected without delay. 

I reported the theft of my identity to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and have enclosed copies of the FTCs Identity Theft Affidavit as supporting evidence. Despite this, it has been over 30 days, and your agency is now in VIOLATION of federal law for failing to take the necessary action to correct my credit file. 

As per 15 U.S. Code 1681c2, a consumer reporting agency must block the reporting of any fraudulent information in the file of a consumer, identified as resulting from identity theft, no later than four days after receiving notice. This legal requirement has been ignored, and I demand that the fraudulent items be deleted and suppressed immediately. 

Your agency 's failure to comply with this statute and take swift corrective action is unacceptable. I expect full compliance with federal law and that my credit report be accurately updated within the next few days. If you continue to ignore this request, I will not hesitate to seek legal recourse to enforce my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

I anticipate a prompt response and resolution of this matter. Please confirm in writing once the requested deletions and suppressions have been completed.

Issue: Problem with fraud alerts or security freezes
Consumer complaint narrative:
Since XXXX I have been dealing with XXXX XXXX XXXX, including XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  I remain XXXX XXXX  and during my XXXX, fraudulent accounts were opened in my name. Due to my XXXX I was unaware of these activities until my condition improved, at which point I began submitting disputes with both the creditors and credit bureaus. The creditors have investigated and confirmed the accounts were fraudulent, issuing deletion letters. Several creditors also confirmed that the transaction records are no longer available due to the age of the accounts and transfers to multiple parties. In other cases, creditors deleted the accounts without requiring further investigation based on the strength of the evidence. 

However, Experian continues to report these fraudulent accounts. Despite having provided the FTC Identity Theft Report, proof of identity, and creditor deletion letters multiple times, Experian refuses to delete these accounts, citing that I may have benefited from the transactions a baseless claim, especially since no transaction records have been provided to me, nor do the original creditors possess them. I have requested these transaction records from both Experian and the creditors for over a year to no avail. 

Experian 's implication that I benefited from these transactions, without providing any proof, is deeply harmful and unsupported by any evidence. Their failure to produce the transaction records or provide a detailed investigation contradicts their obligations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Furthermore, I understand that credit reporting bureaus do not generally maintain transaction records ; however, since Experian is referring to these transactions, I suspect they may have more access to this data than they are disclosing. 

Additionally, I am not interested in providing more evidence as I have already submitted more than is legally required. Every prior complaint includes the FTC Identity Theft Report, hospice certification, and the creditor deletion letters. I am also documenting all communication for a future lawsuit, as my health currently prevents me from pursuing litigation. The stress from these ongoing false accusations has XXXX my condition, resulting in multiple XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, which I have documented.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I, XXXX XXXX XXXX, a natural-born person and not a third party, am submitting this complaint regarding Experians failure to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) in relation to the deletion of fraudulent accounts, unauthorized hard inquiries, and incorrect personal information listed on my credit report. 

I have been a victim of identity theft, which has been exacerbated by the XXXX XXXX breach, along with breaches at XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX, in which my personal information was compromised. Despite my disputes, Experian has failed to act within the time frames mandated by law, violating my rights as a consumer. For your review, I have enclosed my notarized Identity Affidavit, along with an FTC Identity Theft Report and proof of identity, to substantiate my claims. 

Key Timeline : Initial Dispute : Filed on XX/XX/XXXX Follow-up Dispute : Filed on XX/XX/XXXX Despite being informed by a representative from Experian that the fraudulent accounts and unauthorized inquiries would be deleted due to my victim status in the data breach, no action has been taken, and I have not received any response to my follow-up communication. 

Key Issues : Fraudulent Accounts : The following accounts were opened fraudulently without my consent : XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) Unauthorized Hard Inquiries : The following hard inquiries were conducted without my consent XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( Inquiry dates : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Inquiry date : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ( Inquiry dates : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Inquiry date : XX/XX/XXXX ) Incorrect Personal Information : There are inaccuracies in my credit report regarding my past addresses and employment history : Incorrect address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, DE XXXX Incorrect employer : XXXX XXXX and EMPLOYED Correct employer information is XXXX XXXX and XXXX. 
XXXX Data Breach Impact : As a victim of the XXXX XXXX data breach, my personal information, including my Social Security number, was exposed and used in fraudulent activities. Despite being vigilant about protecting my identity, the data breach significantly increased my vulnerability to identity theft. My compromised information has been used to open fraudulent accounts and inquiries on my credit report, which are directly linked to the breach. 

Additionally, I have been a victim of other major data breaches, including those at XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX, further compounding the issue. These breaches have resulted in unauthorized activity on my credit report, which Experian has failed to resolve despite multiple disputes. 

Applicable Laws Violated : FCRA Section 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) : As a victim of identity theft, I am entitled to have fraudulent accounts and inaccurate information blocked within four days of reporting. Despite my detailed disputes, Experian has failed to block or remove these accounts and inquiries in violation of Section 605B.

FCRA Section 605C : The fraudulent accounts and inquiries should have been deleted within four business days of my initial dispute. This delay in removing inaccurate information is a clear violation of my rights under Section 605C.

15 U.S. Code 1681b : Experian unlawfully allowed my consumer report to be accessed without my written consent, as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681b. The fraudulent inquiries must be removed as they were conducted without my authorization. 

18 U.S.C. 1028A : The fraudulent accounts and identity theft situation also constitute aggravated identity theft, which is a federal crime. I have enclosed proof of identity theft through my notarized Identity Affidavit, FTC Identity Theft Report, and proof of identity.

Impact on My Life : This unresolved identity theft and Experians failure to remove fraudulent items have caused severe financial hardship. My creditworthiness is significantly impacted, preventing me from obtaining a mortgage for my family. I am also XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and this has added unnecessary stress during this critical time.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the bankruptcy being reported on my credit report. The credit report states that this bankruptcy is furnished by the U.S. Bankruptcy Court of Alabama, but after contacting the court, they confirmed that they do not furnish or report any information to credit bureaus. Therefore, the bankruptcy information currently being reported by your agency is unverifiable, false, and misleading.

This bankruptcy has been incorrectly listed on my credit report for several years, despite my consistent disputes claiming that it is not mine. I am requesting immediate removal of this inaccurate information from my credit report, as it is causing unnecessary harm to my credit profile.

Please investigate this matter AND STOP USING OCR ( IF I AM TELLING YOU ITS WRONG PLEASE COMPLETE A HAND INVESTIGATION OR JUST REMOVE IT ) and provide me with confirmation that the false information has been removed. I appreciate your prompt attention to correcting this error.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, my XXXX XXXX card was charged {$24.00} by XXXX ( dba Experian ). The charged indicated it was a membership fee. I do not have and have never signed up for an Experian membership. I disputed the charge, but XXXX XXXX denied the dispute, stating it was a valid fee. 

When this did not work, I attempted to sign in to my Experian account and was not able to do so. My password was not recognized, I was unable to reset my password and I was directed to call the company. When I called the number provided, I was not able to reach a person. The system took me in circles and redirected me back to the webpage. 

Finally, I found a number that connected me to an agent. This person checked my accounts and confirmed that I have no memberships active. They opened a case, which remains open and unresolved. I have called back to check on it multiple times, and no movement has happened.

Consumer complaint narrative: According to FCRA 15 usc 1681 section 602 says there is a need to insure that the reporting agencies exercise their responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumer right to privacy. The reporting agencXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Experian and I am the consumer. I have the right to make sure my information stays private and isn't shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states " It is the policy of Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of it customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. XXXX XXXX XXXX is a financial institution by definition under that title 15 USC 1681 section 604a section 2 states that in general subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates too. XXXX XXXX XXXX the financial institution and the consumer reporting agencies Experian, XXXX XXXX do not have my written consent or any permisson to furnish any information. Any and all consent to XXXX Experian and XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX  whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written or implied is now revoked. Also 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) says that a financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a non-affiliated unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise his right to that nondisclosure option. XXXX XXXX XXXX Never informed me of that right. Also 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 5 ) says " except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer reports containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. This account is an adverse item that they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. Lastly 15 USC 1681e states " every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title.

According to Section 604 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports 15 U.S. Code 1681b In general. Consumer complaint narrative:
My account with XXXX EXPERIAN XXXX was never late! I have had exceptional payment history all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment.

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family!

I demand the late payment to be updated.

They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 


XXXX EXPERIAN XXXX Never Sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. 


This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! 


Update the late payments from my consumer reports

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against Experian Information Services LLC for their failure to respond within the legally mandated 30-day timeframe and for their non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) in handling my dispute regarding inaccurate information on my credit report. 

Details of the Complaint : Dispute Filed with Experian : On XX/XX/year>, I submitted a formal dispute to Experian ( Dispute ID : XXXX ), requesting the removal of inaccurate accounts, late payments, charge-offs, and inquiries from my credit report. My dispute explicitly stated that Experian must exclude third-party data sources, such as XXXX, and verify the information directly with the original creditors, as required under FCRA 609 and 611.

Failure to Respond within 30 Days : As of today, more than 30 days have passed since Experian received my dispute on XX/XX/year>, and I have not received any formal response or documentation from Experian regarding the investigation of the disputed items. This failure to respond violates FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ), which mandates that consumer reporting agencies complete their investigation and provide a response within 30 days.

Failure to Remove Inaccurate Accounts : In my dispute, I identified multiple inaccurate items, including late payments, charge-offs, and hard inquiries that should be removed from my credit report. I have attached a list of the disputed items for reference. Despite the clear inaccuracies, Experian has failed to take any corrective action, and these accounts continue to negatively affect my credit. 

List of Disputed Items ( Previously Submitted to Experian ) : Late Payments : Accounts from XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and the Office of the Attorney General ( Child Support ). 
Charge-offs : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Hard Inquiries : Multiple inquiries, including XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX : I request that the CFPB take immediate action to ensure that Experian : Deletes all inaccurate and unverifiable accounts from my credit report as per my dispute. 
Complies with the FCRAs 30-day timeframe for responding to disputes.

Provides detailed documentation of the investigation, including verification with original creditors, as required by FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ).

Enclosed are copies of the dispute letter I sent to Experian, my 15-day follow-up letter, and relevant credit report documentation showing the inaccurate items that remain on my credit report.

I trust the CFPB will take prompt action to ensure Experian complies with the Fair Credit Reporting Act and provides the necessary corrections to my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Request for Validation of Debt - XXXX XXXXXXXX I am writing in response to an alleged debt associated with account number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX I am requesting validation of this debt as per my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 USC 1692g. I dispute the validity of this debt and am immediately requesting that you provide the following information : 1. The original contract binding me to this so-called debt. 2. The PAYMENT HISTORY with the original creditor and balance. 3. Copy of PROOF OF DEBT ASSIGNMENT. 4. Proof that I legally owe this debt to YOUR agency. 5. Proof that you are licensed and able to collect on this debt in my state. 6. The original PURCHASE AGREEMENT. A. THIS IS NOT ANY DEBT THAT I ORIGINATED MYSELF. I HAVE NO IDEA WHERE THIS DEBT ORIGINATED FROM. This inaccurate information needs to be re-investigated immediately by both the Credit reporting agencies and the furnishers of this information that is appearing on my consumer report. NOTE : As you can see within the screenshots that I have attached, XXXX removed this account 45 days ago. Please complete this file. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681e ( b ), A credit reporting agency must maintain accurate records at all times within the files of consumers. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681i, please perform an internal re-investigation on the validity of this account in question that is showing up on your consumer report under my name and notify me of your results within 30 days of your receipt of this letter and update my credit report accordingly to your findings. If you are unable to provide proof of my requests, then the erroneous information MUST be DELETED within 30 days of your receipt of this letter from my credit report as this erroneous account is very misleading and not mine. This account is causing me great mental anguish and I am unable to obtain a mortgage at this present time due to this inaccurate information on my credit report. Debt Collectors and Debt Buyers must furnish 100 % accurate information on consumers at all times. 15 USC 168s-2 Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION ( 1 ) PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors a person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. Please note that until the validity of this debt is verified, I demand that you CEASE all collection activities and CEASE REPORTING TO CREDIT BUREAUS IMMEDIATELY until complete and verified. Also, it is the duties of credit reporting agencies to uphold their grave responsibilities to supply 100 % accurate information ONLY on all consumer credit reports as the banking system itself hinges on accurate information. DELETE THIS ERRONEOUS INFORMATION from ALL credit bureaus immediately if the information can not be verified/validated. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against Experian Information Services LLC for their failure to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) in relation to my dispute regarding the removal of inaccurate information from my credit report. Despite submitting a detailed dispute on XX/XX/year>, Experian has failed to respond within the legally mandated 30-day timeframe. 

Details of the Complaint : Dispute Filed with Experian : On XX/XX/year>, I submitted a formal dispute ( Dispute ID : XXXX ) to Experian, detailing multiple inaccuracies in my credit report, including incorrect names, addresses, phone numbers, and employers. I provided my correct identifying information which is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX my address is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Tx XXXX, my phone number is XXXX, and no employer I requested that all inaccurate personal information be removed from my report in compliance with FCRA 607 ( b ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) and 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ).

Failure to Respond within 30 Days : As of today, more than 30 days have passed, and Experian has not responded to my dispute or taken any corrective action. Under FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ), consumer reporting agencies are required to complete their investigation and provide a response within 30 days, which Experian has failed to do.

Inaccuracies in My Credit Report : In my dispute, I identified 46 inaccuracies, including incorrect names, addresses, phone numbers, and employers. These inaccuracies are seriously impacting my credit, and Experians failure to correct them is in direct violation of FCRA requirements to maintain maximum possible accuracy in credit reports.

List of Disputed Items ( Previously Submitted to Experian ) : Incorrect Names : Multiple variations of my name, including " XXXX XXXX XXXX, '' " XXXX XXXX, '' and others. 
Incorrect Addresses : Several addresses I have never lived at, including " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, CA '' and " XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX. '' Incorrect Phone Numbers : Incorrect phone numbers that do not belong to me, such as " ( XXXX ) XXXX. '' Incorrect Employers : Listed employers such as " XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX '' and " XXXXXXXX XXXX '' where I have never worked. 
Resolution Sought : I request that the CFPB take the following actions to ensure Experian complies with the FCRA : Immediately delete all inaccurate information from my credit report, including the incorrect names, addresses, phone numbers, and employers I have disputed.

Provide a full and documented response to my dispute, detailing the investigation conducted and the methods used to verify the information.

Ensure Experian adheres to the FCRAs 30-day requirement for responding to disputes and corrects the inaccuracies in my report without further delay. 
Enclosed are copies of my original dispute letter to Experian and supporting documentation showing the inaccuracies that remain on my credit report. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I trust the CFPB will take the necessary action to ensure Experian complies with the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to address the lack of response to my previous notice, dated XX/XX/year>, regarding the request for a copy of the 1099-C filed for the charged-off debt. XXXX XXXX XXXX failure to provide a response leaves me no choice but to assume that you have neglected to comply with FEDERAL law by not filing a 1099-C as mandated. Consequently, I am compelled to inform you that I will report XXXX  XXXX XXXX to the XXXX  for potential tax fraud using Form XXXX if prompt action is not taken. 

Furthermore, it is imperative that you notify Experian, XXXX, and XXXX to delete this information from my credit report immediately. The account in question is detailed as follows : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX per IRS regulations, a canceled debt of {$600.00} or more necessitates the filing of a 1099-C form by federal or government agencies, or applicable financial entities. Failure to comply with this requirement constitutes tax fraud, a serious offense that I will not hesitate to report to the IRS. 

It is essential to understand that a canceled debt is considered ordinary income by the IRS. Consequently, any failure to file a 1099-C form, or any attempt to conceal such actions, constitutes inaccurate reporting. Income is not to be included on a credit report, and any such inclusion violates consumer laws and regulations.

Your company 's actions are in clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 USC 1681s-2, which outlines the responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies. Under this statute, it is prohibited to furnish inaccurate information knowingly or with reasonable cause to believe it is inaccurate. 

It is evident from my previous communication and this notice that there is reasonable cause to believe the information provided is inaccurate. Therefore, it is imperative that you take immediate steps to rectify this situation by deleting the inaccurate information from all consumer reporting agencies. 

Failure to comply will result in legal action being pursued, including holding the Creditor XXXX  XXXX XXXX, accountable for willful noncompliance under 15 USC 1681n ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). This statute stipulates that any person who willfully fails to comply with FCRA requirements may be liable for damages sustained by the consumer. 

I am currently in the process of securing housing, and the inaccurate information on my credit report is hindering my progress. I urge you to act swiftly and cease reporting this item to avoid further complications. 

I am currently in the process of securing housing, and the inaccurate information on my credit report is hindering my progress. I urge you to act swiftly and cease reporting this item to avoid further complications. Kindly delete this off my report immediately.

Consumer complaint narrative: RE : Late Payment Improperly Reported- I XXXX XXXX have a RIGHT TO PRIVACY under 15 USC 1681A ( 4 ) as a federally protected consumer and I know my rights presented under the Fair Credit Reporting Act clearly outlined within 15 USC 1681. The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. So, whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft. This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n and 15 USC 1681o, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent. I was reviewing my consumer reports and noticed XXXX XXXX on my credit report that need be immediately updated to paid as agreed. My Consumer rights have been violated by Experian, XXXX, XXXX. Experian, XXXX, XXXX has violated my consumer rights and violated federal law. This is now multiple attempts to notify you of this erroneous error on the part of your agency. This erroneous late payment is affecting my ability to obtain a loan to save my business from crumbling and also blocking me from the housing that I so desperately need for myself and my family. Please change this to paid as agreed immediately so that I may proceed with my life, or I may be forced to seek legal damages against your agency as I already have sought legal counsel in this more than important matter. Thank you.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I, XXXX XXXX XXXX, a natural-born person and not a third party, am submitting this complaint regarding Experians failure to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) in relation to the deletion of fraudulent accounts, unauthorized hard inquiries, and incorrect personal information listed on my credit report. 

I have been a victim of identity theft, which has been exacerbated by the XXXX data breach, along with breaches at XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX, in which my personal information was compromised. Despite my disputes, Experian has failed to act within the time frames mandated by law, violating my rights as a consumer. For your review, I have enclosed my notarized Identity Affidavit, along with an FTC Identity Theft Report and proof of identity, to substantiate my claims. 

Key Timeline : Initial Dispute : Filed on XX/XX/XXXX Follow-up Dispute : Filed on XX/XX/XXXX Despite being informed by a representative from Experian that the fraudulent accounts and unauthorized inquiries would be deleted due to my victim status in the data breach, no action has been taken, and I have not received any response to my follow-up communication. 

Key Issues : Fraudulent Accounts : The following accounts were opened fraudulently without my consent : XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) Unauthorized Hard Inquiries : The following hard inquiries were conducted without my consent : XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( Inquiry dates : XX/XX/XXXX & XX/XX/XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Inquiry date : XX/XX/XXXX ) XXXX XXXX  XXXX ( Inquiry dates : XX/XX/XXXX & XX/XX/XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Inquiry date : XX/XX/XXXX ) Incorrect Personal Information : There are inaccuracies in my credit report regarding my past addresses and employment history : Incorrect address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, DE XXXX Incorrect employer : XXXX XXXX and EMPLOYED Correct employer information is XXXX XXXX and XXXX. 
XXXX Data Breach Impact : As a victim of the XXXX XXXX data breach, my personal information, including my Social Security number, was exposed and used in fraudulent activities. Despite being vigilant about protecting my identity, the data breach significantly increased my vulnerability to identity theft. My compromised information has been used to open fraudulent accounts and inquiries on my credit report, which are directly linked to the breach. 

Additionally, I have been a victim of other major data breaches, including those at XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX, further compounding the issue. These breaches have resulted in unauthorized activity on my credit report, which Experian has failed to resolve despite multiple disputes. 

Applicable Laws Violated : FCRA Section 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) : As a victim of identity theft, I am entitled to have fraudulent accounts and inaccurate information blocked within four days of reporting. Despite my detailed disputes, Experian has failed to block or remove these accounts and inquiries in violation of Section 605B.

FCRA Section 605C : The fraudulent accounts and inquiries should have been deleted within four business days of my initial dispute. This delay in removing inaccurate information is a clear violation of my rights under Section 605C.

15 U.S. Code 1681b : Experian unlawfully allowed my consumer report to be accessed without my written consent, as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681b. The fraudulent inquiries must be removed as they were conducted without my authorization.

18 U.S.C. 1028A : The fraudulent accounts and identity theft situation also constitute aggravated identity theft, which is a federal crime. I have enclosed proof of identity theft through my notarized Identity Affidavit, FTC Identity Theft Report, and proof of identity. 

Impact on My Life : This unresolved identity theft and Experians failure to remove fraudulent items have caused severe financial hardship. My creditworthiness is significantly impacted, preventing me from obtaining a mortgage for my family. I am also preparing for XXXX overseas, and this has added unnecessary stress during this critical time.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against XXXX XXXX for reporting a late payment on my credit report without providing proper documentation to substantiate the alleged delinquency. Despite my written request for proof, the company has failed to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) requirements. Below is a summary of my issue : Request for Proof of Late Payment : I requested that the student loan company provide specific documentation showing : The due date of the payment in question.

The actual payment date or proof that no payment was made.

Any notices or warnings they claim to have issued regarding the alleged late payment.

Proof that I receive the biling statement by providing mail tracking documents Inadequate Response : Instead of providing the requested documentation, the company sent a response containing only general loan documents and references to the original loan terms. This response did not address my specific request for proof of the late payment or the timing of any missed payment, nor did it include any billing records or payment history.

Violation of FCRA Requirements : Under the FCRA, furnishers of credit information are required to verify and provide accurate records when a consumer disputes the accuracy of information reported to credit bureaus. In this case, the company has failed to meet these requirements. Since they have not provided proof of my delinquency, they are obligated to remove the inaccurate late payment from my credit report.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
RE Account Numbers- XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX and XXXX Navy Federal Credit Union, This letter is a formal complaint that you are reporting my nonpublic and personal information without my written consent. Please show me the proof you sent me giving me options on how I could opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and proof showing you gave me the option to not disclose my transaction history each month with a third party. 

The law states a consumer must give written consent to opt out of sharing their nonpublic information to the financial institution. I did this and you stated I did not have that right to opt out. It is a violation to report my transactions or experiences between you and I with a third party or consumer reporting agency without my written consent. It is the policy stated by Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers to insure the security and confidentiality of their customer records and information. This includes protecting against unauthorized access to or use of such records or information which could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to any customer. 

I the consumer should have been given the opportunity, before such information was to be reported which gives me the option to direct you that such information should not be reported. I also should have been explained how I could exercise that nondisclosure option, which I was never advised. I have written multiple times, and you have continued to ignore my written request. 

Your failure to comply with the law and my written request has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Again, I am requesting to opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and for you to remove all my transaction history from all nonaffiliated third parties such as XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX immediately. Otherwise, I will pursue legal actions for every month my nonpublic information has been reported which could be a fine of {$1000.00} per violation. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX, BENEFICIARY Without Recourse, All Rights Reserved
