Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
My federal student loans are handled by EdFinancial Services. On XX/XX/XXXX, I canceled my existing autopay with EdFinancial because I had transferred to a new checking account, and wanted to set up auto pay with the new checking account. For the month of XXXX, I simply made a manual payment to cover my student loan payment. 

After setting up auto pay with my new checking account, I received a confirmation email and I assumed I was all set. I had set up my autopay to clear on the XXXX of every month. On XX/XX/XXXX, I receive a delinquency notice because my auto pay had not gone through on XX/XX/XXXX. I thought this was strange since I had set it up with my new bank account on XX/XX/XXXX, so I re-submitted my autopay request, and made another manual payment. 

The same exact thing happens after XX/XX/XXXX ... no auto payment had gone through. I reach out to EdFinancial and the only feedback I receive is that it takes XXXX billing cycles for my autopay to be confirmed by them. It's been over 2 months now since XX/XX/XXXX when I enrolled in my new auto pay, and I still have not heard back from them with a confirmation that it works. 

I find this unacceptable given that with autopay, you receive a 0.25 % interest reduction. By not being clear about the auto pay process, and relying on outdated technology that can not handle starting auto payment the same day you enroll, borrowers must wait months to receive their promised interest rate reductions.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Sub-issue: Confusing or misleading advertising or marketing
Consumer complaint narrative: Im a long time BoA consumer and appalled by their recent handling of my auto loan application as they completely false advertised their loan rates and deceived me into applying for their loan. On XX/XX/year>2024 I was researching rates for an auto loan and BoA presented me with an offer for an APR of 5.09 %. This rate was presented to me on my logged in BoA portal ( i.e., they knew who I was based on my existing accounts and my 40 year history as their consumer ). Based on this advertisement, I applied for the loan and allowed BoA to run my credit report, which of course negatively impacts my credit score. After being quickly approved, they presented me with my approved loan rate of 5.99 %, 90 basis points higher than they quoted. I called BoA and expressed my frustration. The agent I spoke with said, of course, different variables impact the rate. As we walked through each variable ( e.g., I have excellent credit which BoA just ran and confirmed, I was getting a Gold tier relationship benefit, etc, ) he acknowledged that hes not sure why I didnt get the advertised 5.09 % it was a complete bait and switch scenario. Based on BoAs shady practice, Ive been harmed with a lower credit score and a much higher rate.

Once I told her my info she then asked me why I would like to open an account. I said because I need an account to put money in. I believe she asked me why I would like to open an account after I told her my occupation. She then gets up and says Ill be right back I have to speak to my manager. She comes back and said my application was denied because the address on my DL isnt in XXXX where I applied and also where I work. My address has never been an issue when I open bank accounts at physical locations. Frost Bank is not based in XXXX and only in XXXX, I just wanted to apply in person. I know because I then went to go apply for an account online in the Frost Bank app and provided the same information I gave them at the bank. I got instantly approved with no issues. Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
When I attempted to cash in my CHASE Bank XXXX, at my CHASE bank, both the manager and another " account specialist '' at that CHASE bank ( in the cubicle directly next to him ) decided they were going to play a mean-spirted trick on me. 

I went into the CHASE bank to cash-in mXXXX XXXX, instead of renewing. And was issued a check for the balance, plus interest, of {$120000.00}. 
For the next few days, I mulled over what I should do with the money ; cash it, cash part of it, invest it back into another XXXX  with a bit higher rate... I then decided to cash it, deposit it, and give myself time to think. I went to an even more nearby XXXX XXXX. The teller at that XXXXXXXX XXXX informed me " This is a paper, " dummy '' check. It looks like a XXXX XXXXopy. We can not cash it. '' Just about beside myself with a case of shock, I walked to the CHASE bank where the manager had issued me that check, and stood in line to cash the check. The teller told me the same thing the teller at XXXX had told me, " This is a dummy check, I can't cash it. '' So there I stood, dumbfounded. I asked to speak to the manager who had issued me the check. He came over, and with a sly grin, said " Sorry sir, that is a fake check, it is just a " XXXX XXXX  check. '' And that account is closed. There is nothing we can do. Again, I'm sorry. '' I was livid. And described in detail, and very audibly, for all to hear, that I was was just in this bank, days before in your cubicle. You issued me this check! And I'm not leaving until I get my {$120000.00}! The manager insisted on playing his trick out further, even though the line behind me was getting longer, and everybody was now listening intently. He said " You are getting too loud, I am going to ask you to leave ''. I said " Are you accusing me of theft? Of copying a check on a copying machine, and asking you to cash it? I'm not going anywhere. And besides, you know if this check had been cashed, and when, and where, and by whom. '' He relented. And issued me a " real '' check. I then walked back to XXXX and deposited it. 

This trick was beyond anything XXXX, or anyone, should ever have to put up with. It was a horrific experience. And worse of all, was done for amusement. 

Here are the details : XX/XX/year> CHASE BANK XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX, Ca. XXXX XXXX and issuer of the " XXXXXXXX '' check for {$120000.00} : XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally file a complaint against Portfolio Recovery Associates. I am utterly fed up with their tactics and the apparent lack of oversight from the credit bureausXXXX XXXXXXXX, and XXXX. 

Despite my ongoing dispute, Portfolio Recovery continues to manipulate my credit report, adding information as they see fit. Its as if they have been given XXXX  XXXX to disregard my rights. I have requested debt validation, yet they responded with nothing more than a vague statement from XXXX XXXX, which does not constitute proof of debt. I now demand an Assignment letter to review the purchase agreement related to this alleged debt, as I deserve to know the details of this transaction. 

Moreover, XXXX previously stated that Portfolio Recovery would be removed from my credit report. However, I have provided evidence that they have not only remained on my report but are actively making updates across all three bureaus. This behavior is unacceptable. 

During my attempts to resolve this, I encountered a representative who dismissively stated, " If we say you owe this debt, then you owe this debt. '' This encounter made it painfully clear that I am dealing with a bully, not a legitimate creditor. Their tactics have left me feeling victimized, and I refuse to engage with them any further. 

The harassment I have endured through my credit reports is not only insane but also deeply disrespectful. I will not stand for it any longer, and I am prepared to escalate this matter to court if necessary. 

I urge the CFPB to investigate Portfolio Recovery Associates and their practices. No one should have to endure such treatment. 

Attached are pictures of the different balances Portfolio Recovery initially reported to the 3 credit bureaus ( {$300.00} and {$300.00} ). I've also attached photos of the corrections Portfolio Recovery has made to all 3 credit bureaus to reflect a balance of {$300.00} across all 3 bureaus. This is shady practices at it's finest!

Summary : [ Section 242 Of Title 18 ] makes it a crime for a person acting under color of any law to willfully deprive a person of a right or privilege protected by the Constitution or laws of the United States of America.

To wit : " A national Bank can not lend its credit to another by becoming surety, endorser, or guarantor for him, such an act being ultra vires '' XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
For the purpose of Section 242, acts under color of law include acts not only done by federal, state, or local officials within their lawful authority, but also acts done beyond the bounds of that official 's lawful authority, if the acts are done while the official is purporting to, or pretending to, act in the performance of his/her official duties. Persons acting under color of law within the meaning of this statute include police officers, prison guards and other law enforcement officials, as wel as judges, lawyers, care providers in public health facilities, and others who are acting as public officials. It is not necessary that the crime be motivated by animus toward the race, color, religion, sex, handicap, familial status or national origin of the victim.

The offense is punishable by range of fines up to {$25000.00}, imprisonment up to a life term, or the death penalty, depending upon the circumstances of the crime, and the resulting injury, if any.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I looked at my XXXX credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
RE Account Numbers XXXX  System & Services Technologies, This letter is a formal complaint that you are reporting my nonpublic and personal information without my written consent. Please show me the proof you sent me giving me options on how I could opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and proof showing you gave me the option to not disclose my transaction history each month with a third party. 
The law states a consumer must give written consent to opt out of sharing their nonpublic information to the financial institution. I did this and you stated I did not have that right to opt out. It is a violation to report my transactions or experiences between you and I with a third party or consumer reporting agency without my written consent. It is the policy stated by Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers to insure the security and confidentiality of their customer records and information. This includes protecting against unauthorized access to or use of such records or information which could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to any customer. 

I the consumer should have been given the opportunity, before such information was to be reported which gives me the option to direct you that such information should not be reported. I also should have been explained how I could exercise that nondisclosure option, which I was never advised. I have written multiple times, and you have continued to ignore my written request. 

Your failure to comply with the law and my written request has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Again, I am requesting to opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and for you to remove all my transaction history from all nonaffiliated third parties such as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX immediately. Otherwise, I will pursue legal actions for every month my nonpublic information has been reported which could be a fine of {$1000.00} per violation. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX, BENEFICIARY Without Recourse, All Rights Reserved

XXXX last report XX/XX/year> for {$1300.00} 15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States that I have a right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 604 A Section 2 : It is also states that a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 6802- ( a ) Notice requirements Except as otherwise provided in this subchapter, a financial institution may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information, unless such financial institution provides or has provided to the consumer a notice that complies with section 6803 of this title.

( b ) Opt out ( 1 ) In general A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless ( A ) such financial institution clearly and conspicuously discloses to the consumer, in writing or in electronic form or other form permitted by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, that such information may be disclosed to such third party ; ( B ) the consumer is given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and ( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Bank of America stopped my automatic bill pay for several months and then restarted it but not until after the amount do was higher that the automated payment amount on several account. 

It cause several account to be sent to collecttions. Bank of America sent my Bank of America Credit Card to collections when i had perfect payment history. I have been with the bank for 20 years.

They blamed a third part vendor who maintained the bill pay, bill pay blamed the bank. No one was held accountable. And the funds wher not completely refunded and the damage was not undone.

I was on the phone for months trying to repair their misstake. 6 months into it they claimed they could only look back 30 days when the mistake had happen a year before and i had been on the claims and fraud protection for montsh about it but becaue i would not except their misstake they just simple said we can only go back 30 days.

That one error cause all my automatic bill payment accounts to be sent to collections. Which dropped my XXXX XXXX down to a XXXX. I lost all my other credit card, my loans all went into default. I did not catch the error unitll several months after it occured when i recieved a credit report and all my accounts where sent to collections. 

I contacted the credit company and they claimed they did a investigation and could not do anything becuse the accounts whe confirmed. I contacted them repeatedly, I contacted the bank repeatedly. Several months into it the bank confirmed they mistake. 

The XXXX XXXX claimed they investigation was done when it was not. If you looked at my payment history alone it would be obvious there was a mistake becaue I have perfect payment history becaue all by bills where on automatic bill pay for years. 

I have tried repeatedly to get my credit card returned and reactivated but my credit report is so ugly wont even my own back reissue the card they fraudulently sent to collections. I was told the algorithm kept kicking my application back and that i have to subbmitte a request in writeing which i did. 

I requested my account be looked at, that a supperior card be issued and a increase in my credit limit and repayment of the fees and charges and lose and damages. I have not heard anything in 8 months. 

They finally issured a retraction to the credit companies that proved they were lying about looking in to all my claims. When Bank of America retracted theirs it validated that all the other account that were sent to collections was their fault which had them all removed, but the damage was already done.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> I visited a Capital One branch located on XXXX XXXX XXXX, with a total cash amount of {$760.00}. I deposited my money into an ATM XXXX, transaction ID XXXX at XXXX XXXX and the ATM restarted mid process, rebooted, & printed out a receipt stating only {$160.00} was credited to the account. I spoke with the branch ambassador XXXX XXXX who told me to call Capital One to report it. Capital One told me id have to call back in XXXX hours because they were waiting to empty the ATM as the money shouldve gone into a rejection box. I waited until the next day and called again, they proceeded to escalate it to a supervisor who then called the branch directly and merged me into a XXXX way phone call with the XXXX XXXX. They expressed this isnt the first time this has happened with that specific ATM i used that day, and that an investigation would be launched into the missing funds. On XX/XX/year> I was credited the remaining {$600.00} in my account while the investigation was proceeding. As of today XX/XX/year> I checked my account to see they reversed the credit they gave me, and told me in a case letter dated XX/XX/year> that We have received your case # XXXX. Unfortunately, we must deny it because our ATM records do not show an error or a completed transaction for the dollar amount or date you indicated. I promptly called them at XXXX XXXX and after being escalated to a supervisor, was told that a complaint would be filed but that the investigation was closed and final. Im basically now expected to pay a bill from an ATM error and my credit card is now maxed out.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently did an investigation on my credit report and I am verifying that these NEGATIVE accounts are not mines. 
Under the United States Code Law 15 U.S Code 1681 a ( 4 ) Consumer Right to privacy. You are reporting fraudulent accounts that are not mine, which is infringement of my privacy. Congress says I have a right to decide what I deem private. I deem that these NEGATIVE accounts to be private and I DO NOT WANT THIS INFORMATION SHARED ON MY CREDIT REPORT. FDCPA 807 states that these NEGATIVE accounts are misleading false reporting.

Under 15 USC 1681b - permissible purpose of consumer reports. THE LAW STATES ( a ) In general subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

Under 15 U.S. Code 6802 - I have the right to opt out of any information shared to a financial institution, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information, unless such financial institution provides or has provided to the consumer a notice, which I have not received.

******IMPORTANT****** PLEASE DON'T RESPOND TO MY REQUEST SAYING THAT THESE ACCOUNTS ARE VERIFIED BY THE INFORMATION PROVIDER, SEND ME COPIES OF THE DOCUMENTS THAT YOU HAVE RETAINED IN YOUR FILES THAT YOUR COMPANY USED TO VERIFY THE ACCURACY OF THESE DISPUTED ACCOUNTS

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I hereby request that you investigate and remove these items from my credit report. It is my understanding that you are obligated to verify these items with the creditor responsible for reporting them. Please eliminate any information that can not be verified by the creditor. I am aware that under 15 U.S.C. Sec. 1681i ( a ), you are required to complete this investigation within 30 days of receiving this letter.

Please send an updated copy of my credit report to the address provided above. As stipulated by the act, there should be no charge for this updated report. Additionally, I kindly ask that you notify any parties who have accessed my credit report in the past six months regarding the corrections made.

Thank you for your attention and assistance in resolving this matter.

.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
CFPB Dispute Submission : Unauthorized Account Reporting Complainant Information : Name : XXXX XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, AZ XXXX Email : XXXX Phone : ( XXXX ) XXXX Disputed Account Information : Account Number : XXXX Credit Card Issuer : XXXX XXXX Credit Bureaus Involved : XXXX , XXXX, Equifax Type of Account : Revolving Credit ( Credit Card ) Account Status : Closed Nature of Dispute and Request for Removal : Account Ownership : I have never opened or authorized the creation of this account, nor am I aware of its existence. This account has been erroneously attributed to me.

Request : Immediate removal of this account from my credit report due to it being unauthorized and inaccurate.

Credit Bureau Code : Authorized User : I have never been an authorized user on this account. Any reference to me being associated as such is false.

Request : Remove this account from my credit report as I am not affiliated with it.

Account Status : Closed : The account is reported as closed, yet I have no knowledge or ownership of this account, making this information irrelevant and inaccurate.

Request : Remove this erroneous account from my credit file immediately.

High Credit and Balance Discrepancies : XXXX reports a high credit of {$2000.00}, while Equifax reports {$800.00}. Both of these amounts are unrecognized and do not pertain to me. 
Request : Remove this account due to inaccurate reporting of balances and unauthorized account ownership. 
Credit Limit Discrepancies : XXXX lists a credit limit of {$800.00}, while Equifax lists {$0.00}. I have no connection to this account, and both figures are inaccurate. 
Request : Remove this account from my credit report. 
Date of Last Payment Discrepancies : XXXX reports a last payment date of XX/XX/XXXX, while Equifax reports XX/XX/XXXX. Since I have never made any payments on this account, these dates are false. 
Request : Remove this account due to inaccuracies in payment reporting.

Payment Status : Late 120 Days : The account is incorrectly reported as being late for 120 days. I am not responsible for any payments on this account as it is not mine.

Request : Immediate removal of this account from my credit report due to this inaccurate payment status.

Inconsistencies in Payment History : The payment history across reporting agencies contains discrepancies, further proving that this account is inaccurately associated with me.

Request : Remove this account from my credit report due to inconsistent and inaccurate payment history.

Legal Grounds for Dispute : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 : Credit reporting agencies are required by law to ensure that the information reported is accurate. Reporting an account that does not belong to me is a direct violation of the FCRA. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX ) : This case established that credit reporting agencies must conduct a reasonable investigation when a consumer disputes the accuracy of information. As the information provided by this account is inaccurate, I request immediate removal.

I kindly request that this unauthorized and inaccurate account be removed from my credit report as soon as possible. Please confirm the results of your investigation and provide me with documentation of the removal.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
RE Account Numbers- XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, This letter is a formal complaint that you are reporting my nonpublic and personal information without my written consent. Please show me the proof you sent me giving me options on how I could opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and proof showing you gave me the option to not disclose my transaction history each month with a third party. 

The law states a consumer must give written consent to opt out of sharing their nonpublic information to the financial institution. I did this and you stated I did not have that right to opt out. It is a violation to report my transactions or experiences between you and I with a third party or consumer reporting agency without my written consent. It is the policy stated by Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers to insure the security and confidentiality of their customer records and information. This includes protecting against unauthorized access to or use of such records or information which could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to any customer. 

I the consumer should have been given the opportunity, before such information was to be reported which gives me the option to direct you that such information should not be reported. I also should have been explained how I could exercise that nondisclosure option, which I was never advised. I have written multiple times, and you have continued to ignore my written request. 

Your failure to comply with the law and my written request has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Again, I am requesting to opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and for you to remove all my transaction history from all nonaffiliated third parties such as XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX XXXX immediately. Otherwise, I will pursue legal actions for every month my nonpublic information has been reported which could be a fine of {$1000.00} per violation. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX, BENEFICIARY Without Recourse, All Rights Reserved

Consumer complaint narrative:
I looked at my XXXX credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a victim of identity Theft. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 
XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, has violated my rights. 
The identity theft also resulted in multiple inquires that I did Not approve at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I looked at my EXQUIFAX credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ). 

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

States I have the right to privacy. 15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my hand written instructions. 15 U.S.C 1681i Section a : states that if the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumers file at a consumer reporting agency is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the agency directly, or indirectly through a reseller of such dispute, the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from the file if no documentary evidence is found in accordance with FCRA, before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or reseller.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX GA, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Last 4 SSN : XXXX TODAYS DATE : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX NOTICE OF PENDING LITIGATION SEEKING RELIEF AND MONETARY COMPENSATION UNDER FCRA 15 U.S. Code 1681n Civil liability for willful noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1681o Civil liability for negligent noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1692k civil liability. 
Please accept this final written OFFER OF SETTLEMENT BEFORE LITIGATION as my attempt to amicably resolve your continued violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act regarding your refusal to delete INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated information from my consumer file. I intend to pursue litigation in accordance with the FCRA to seek relief and recover all monetary damages that I may be entitled to under Section 616 and Section 617 if the INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated items listed below are not deleted immediately. A copy of this letter as well as INACCURATE ERRONEOUS ITEMS sent to you previously will also become part of a formal complaint to the Federal Trade Commission and shall be used as evidence in pending litigation provided you fail to comply with this offer of settlement. 
YOU ARE IN DIRECT VIOLATION OF THE FCRA, the unverified items listed below still remain on my credit report in violation of Federal Law. You are required under the FCRA to have a copy of the original creditors documentation on file to verify that this information is mine and is correct. In the results of your investigations, you stated in writing that you verified that these items are being reported correctly Who verified these accounts? You have NOT provided me a copy of ANY original documentation ( a consumer contract with my signature on it ) as required under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Furthermore, you have failed to provide the method of verification as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). Please be advised that under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to ... promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified. 
Its very obvious that your agency doesnt know what the FCRA is, because from the looks of my credit report and all the errors I see, heres my breakdown : 1.The Fair Credit Reporting Act is the primary federal law that governs the collection and reporting of credit information about consumers. Its rules cover how a consumer 's credit information is obtained, how long it is kept, and how it is shared with othersincluding consumers themselves.

2. What is a FCRA violation?

Creditors give reporting agencies inaccurate financial information about you. Reporting agencies mixing up one person 's information with another 's because of similar ( or same ) last name or social security number. Agencies fail to follow guidelines for handling disputes.

3. My rights under the fair credit reporting act : Verify the accuracy of my report when it is required for employment purposes. 
Receive notification if information in my file has been used against me in applying for credit or other transactions. 
Disputeand have the bureaus correct and deleteinformation in my report that is incomplete, inaccurate, and unverifiable. 
Remove outdated, negative information ( after seven years in most cases, 10 in the case of bankruptcy ). 
I demand these items be deleted immediately. I entered the items and the outcome I desire below because you are in violation and these items are not 100 % accurate. 
They are either INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated. I recently applied for extended credit and was denied I am in distress because of your mistakes. 
The law is very clear as to the Civil liability and the remedy available to me ( Section 616 & 617 ) if you fail to comply with Federal Law. I am a litigious consumer and fully intend on pursuing litigation in this matter to enforce my rights under the FCRA. 
1. Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) this account in violation not reporting 100 % accurate. The payments have been on time. 
XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Your improper procedures are highly damaging to my credit score. Please immediately UPDATE LATE PAYMENTS FROM XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  AND XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  TO PAID VIOLATION OF 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance ( a ) In general Any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00} ; or ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ; ( 2 ) such amount of punitive damages as the court may allow ; and ( 3 ) in the case of any successful action to enforce any liability under this section, the costs of the action together with reasonable attorneys fees as determined by the court. 
( b ) Civil liability for knowing noncompliance Any person who obtains a consumer report from a consumer reporting agency under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose shall be liable to the consumer reporting agency for actual damages sustained by the consumer reporting agency or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater. 
* Please remove all non-account holding inquiries Please note that you have 30 days to complete this investigation, as per the Fair Credit Reporting Act Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested as well, to be provided within ( 5 ) days of the completion of your re-investigation and I am keeping a careful record of your actions, including your Method of Verification. I do not consent to e-Oscar or any means of automated verification. 
Failure to respond satisfactorily within 30 days of receipt of this certified letter may result in a small claims action against your company, seeking {$5000.00} per violation for : 1. ) Defamation 2. ) Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3. ) Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act 4. ) Financial Injury P.S. Please be aware that dependent upon your response, I may be detailing any potential issues with your company via an online public press release, including documentation of any potential small claims action. I am also including a copy of my complaint to the organizations below : CC : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX Director of Enforcement Consumer Financial Protection XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Washington, D.C. XXXX : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau CC : Attorney Generals Office CC : XXXX XXXX XXXX  CC : State Senate CC : Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation XXXX : Comptroller Of The Currency CC : Federal Reserve System CC : Credit and insurance CC : Federal Trade Commission CC : State Regulatory agency CC : California Regulatory agency Division of consumer complaints Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

This fraudulent, inaccurate, and false information consists of a personal credit card accounts opened aXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX under the account number ( XXXX ). Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : When reviewing my credit report, I found several accounts listed in my name that do not belong to me. According to the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act 611 ( a ) [ 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ], these disputed items must be investigated or deleted from my credit record within 30 days. The items I am disputing must be removed from my credit report as the mere reporting of items prior to debt validation constitutes collection activity. I have contacted the Federal Trade Commission and filed a police report. I am demanding that you remove all inaccurate accounts from my credit profile in the next five ( 5 ) days or I will have no other recourse but to file an injunction against your agency under 617a1 which makes you financially liable for each inaccurate account. Also, under 616 Section A liability for willful non-compliance, your agency has yet to respond to my questions and statements of the Law.

AFFIDAVITS OF LAW 1. Are you the original creditor?

2. Have you given the debtor the opportunity to review the original contract?

3. Have you validated the home address for the debtor?

4. Have you complied with all FRCA, FDCP and FDCPA laws?

5. Have you reported to the consumer who has reviewed the original contract information with his/her original signature?

6. Have you provided the names of all creditors that have provided the names and addresses of the person who has reviewed consumer relations? 

Accounts : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX If the above has not been completed, please Delete these accounts from my credit report and stop all contact with me. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 U.S.C. Section 805., you are hereby notified to CEASE AND DESIST all further communication with me regarding the referenced debt. Failure to abide by this law will result in a complaint being filed against you with the Federal Trade Commission, the Attorney General of both your state and mine, and also your company management. I also have the right to file suit against you for any future violations of this law.

I have filed an FTC report and Police Report

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the bankruptcy being reported on my credit report. The credit report states that this bankruptcy is furnished by the U.S. Bankruptcy Court of Alabama, but after contacting the court, they confirmed that they do not furnish or report any information to credit bureaus. Therefore, the bankruptcy information currently being reported by your agency is unverifiable, false, and misleading.

This bankruptcy has been incorrectly listed on my credit report for several years, despite my consistent disputes claiming that it is not mine. I am requesting immediate removal of this inaccurate information from my credit report, as it is causing unnecessary harm to my credit profile. 

Please investigate this matter AND STOP USING OCR ( IF I AM TELLING YOU ITS WRONG PLEASE COMPLETE A HAND INVESTIGATION OR JUST REMOVE IT ) and provide me with confirmation that the false information has been removed. I appreciate your prompt attention to correcting this error.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act this account has violated my rights. 

XXXX last reported XX/XX/2024 15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States that I have a right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 604 A Section 2 : It is also states that a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 6802- ( a ) Notice requirements Except as otherwise provided in this subchapter, a financial institution may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information, unless such financial institution provides or has provided to the consumer a notice that complies with section 6803 of this title.

( b ) Opt out ( 1 ) In general A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless ( A ) such financial institution clearly and conspicuously discloses to the consumer, in writing or in electronic form or other form permitted by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, that such information may be disclosed to such third party ; ( B ) the consumer is given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and ( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
This notice is to inform you that you have unlawfully reported an alleged debt to my consumer report. Under the New Rule REGULATION F which took effect 11/03/2021, You have violated the FDCPA 1006.30a and its new rule by parking this alleged debt on my consumer reports. Cease and Desist the reporting of this alleged Debt immediately or I will escalate this matter to taking legal action. I have not given you written permission to put anything on my credit profile 15 USC 1681b2. You have no permissible purpose by law to contact third parties with my private or personal information. Your offenses amount to Aggravated Identity Theft pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 1028A. You have knowingly transferred, possessed, or used, without lawful authority, a means of identification of me, which is a felony punishable with up to 2 years of imprisonment, in addition to civil liability. I AM A LITIGIOUS CONSUMER I WILL NOT HESITATE TO TAKE LEGAL ACTION AGAINST 15 USC 1692c ( c ) Ceasing communication If a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing that the consumer refuses to pay a debt or that the consumer wishes the debt collector to cease further communication with the consumer, the debt collector shall not communicate further with the consumer with respect to such debt. Cease and Desist all collections or derogatory activity regarding the alleged debts on my credit report.

You have caused me and my family severe harm due to your negligence and inaccurate reporting. This is in violation of my consumer rights and is affecting my credit worthiness.

All of the aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and XXXX  fraud. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report. 

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and may be the result of identity theft or other illegal activities. Attempting to enforce these fraudulent accounts is unlawful. I request that you expedite your investigation to prevent further harm, losses, or damages that I may suffer as a victim of identity theft.

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

Consumer complaint narrative: All prior credit card statements were sent to me. I asked for these documents to show proof that I was illegally charged on my account by XXXX XXXX XXXX  for a service that I never agreed to. They have no signature physical or electronic for that service and I have asked them to supply me a copy of the signature that says I signed up for it and they can't because I never did. I paid this credit card off in full. A month later XXXX XXXX XXXX called me trying to sell me a service called XXXX  XXXX. I declined these services. XXXX XXXX XXXX  then charged my account anyways for a {$0.00} charge labeled XXXX XXXX per the credit card statement. Because of this {$0.00} charge it triggered a minimum interest charge of {$2.00} causing my account to have a balance of {$2.00} after I paid it all off which racked up late fees over time. I tried to tell XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and now Midland Credit Management that this is because of illegal charges on my account. You can not charge someone for credit card insurance that they never agreed to. Noone will listen to me or help me even though they provided me the statement with the proof that clearly says this charge was not for any previous interest, previous purchase, or interest from current billing cycles..Meaning this is not leftover interest from the previous billing cycle which is what they tried to tell me until I showed them the proof. The account was paid off on XX/XX/year>. The illegal charge for the {$0.00} XXXX XXXX insurance was put on my account on XX/XX/year>. Again, I have asked for Midland and XXXX to supply me with an electronic or physical signature that says I signed up for this to cause this charge and they can't. I paid it off with no intention of ever using it again so there is no reason I would need account insurance. They have to supply proof of this and they can't because I never agreed. XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and Midland should all be held legally liable for the damage they have done and for seeing the proof of what I'm saying is true and pretending they don't. A woman at Midland even agreed with me that this was illegal then I never heard from her again. They keep trying to come after me for payment anyways. This is all highly illegal.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX GA, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Last XXXX SSN : XXXX TODAYS DATE : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX NOTICE OF PENDING LITIGATION SEEKING RELIEF AND MONETARY COMPENSATION UNDER FCRA 15 U.S. Code 1681n Civil liability for willful noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1681o Civil liability for negligent noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1692k civil liability. 
Please accept this final written OFFER OF SETTLEMENT BEFORE LITIGATION as my attempt to amicably resolve your continued violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act regarding your refusal to delete INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated information from my consumer file. I intend to pursue litigation in accordance with the FCRA to seek relief and recover all monetary damages that I may be entitled to under Section 616 and Section 617 if the INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated items listed below are not deleted immediately. A copy of this letter as well as INACCURATE ERRONEOUS ITEMS sent to you previously will also become part of a formal complaint to the Federal Trade Commission and shall be used as evidence in pending litigation provided you fail to comply with this offer of settlement. 
YOU ARE IN DIRECT VIOLATION OF THE FCRA, the unverified items listed below still remain on my credit report in violation of Federal Law. You are required under the FCRA to have a copy of the original creditors documentation on file to verify that this information is mine and is correct. In the results of your investigations, you stated in writing that you verified that these items are being reported correctly Who verified these accounts? You have NOT provided me a copy of ANY original documentation ( a consumer contract with my signature on it ) as required under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Furthermore, you have failed to provide the method of verification as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). Please be advised that under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to ... promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified. 
Its very obvious that your agency doesnt know what the FCRA XXXX, because from the looks of my credit report and all the errors I see, heres my breakdown : 1.The Fair Credit Reporting Act is the primary federal law that governs the collection and reporting of credit information about consumers. Its rules cover how a consumer 's credit information is obtained, how long it is kept, and how it is shared with othersincluding consumers themselves.

2. What is a FCRA violation? 
Creditors give reporting agencies inaccurate financial information about you. Reporting agencies mixing up XXXX person 's information with another 's because of similar ( or same ) last name or social security number. Agencies fail to follow guidelines for handling disputes. 
XXXX. My rights under the fair credit reporting act : Verify the accuracy of my report when it is required for employment purposes. 
Receive notification if information in my file has been used against me in applying for credit or other transactions. 
XXXX have the bureaus correct and deleteinformation in my report that is incomplete, inaccurate, and unverifiable. 
Remove outdated, negative information ( after XXXX years in most cases, XXXX in the case of bankruptcy ). 
I demand these items be deleted immediately. I entered the items and the outcome I desire below because you are in violation and these items are not 100 % accurate. 
They are either INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated. I recently applied for extended credit and was denied I am in distress because of your mistakes. 
The law is very clear as to the Civil liability and the remedy available to me ( Section 616 & 617 ) if you fail to comply with Federal Law. I am a litigious consumer and fully intend on pursuing litigation in this matter to enforce my rights under the FCRA. 
1. Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) this account in violation not reporting 100 % accurate. 

XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Your improper procedures are highly damaging to my credit score. Please immediately DELETE VIOLATION OF 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance ( a ) In general Any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( XXXX ) ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00} ; or ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ; ( XXXX ) such amount of punitive damages as the court XXXX allow ; and ( XXXX ) in the case of any successful action to enforce any liability under this section, the costs of the action together with reasonable attorneys fees as determined by the court. 
( b ) Civil liability for knowing noncompliance Any person who obtains a consumer report from a consumer reporting agency under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose shall be liable to the consumer reporting agency for actual damages sustained by the consumer reporting agency or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater. 
* Please remove all non-account holding inquiries Please note that you have 30 days to complete this investigation, as per the Fair Credit Reporting Act Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested as well, to be provided within ( 5 ) days of the completion of your re-investigation and I am keeping a careful record of your actions, including your Method of Verification. I do not consent to e-Oscar or any means of automated verification. 
Failure to respond satisfactorily within 30 days of receipt of this certified letter may result in a small claims action against your company, seeking {$5000.00} per violation for : 1. ) Defamation 2. ) Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3. ) Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act 4. ) Financial Injury P.S. Please be aware that dependent upon your response, I may be detailing any potential issues with your company via an online public press release, including documentation of any potential small claims action. I am also including a copy of my complaint to the organizations below : CC : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX Assistant Director of Enforcement Consumer Financial Protection Bureau1700 XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau CC : Attorney Generals Office CC : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : State Senate CC : Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation CC : Comptroller Of The Currency CC : Federal Reserve System CC : Credit and insurance CC : Federal Trade Commission CC : State Regulatory agency CC : California Regulatory agency Division of consumer complaints Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Request for Validation of Debt XXXX XXXX, XXXX I am writing in response to an alleged debt associated with account number XXXX XXXX, XXXX I am requesting validation of this debt as per my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 USC 1692g. I dispute the validity of this debt and am immediately requesting that you provide the following information : 1. The original contract binding me to this so-called debt. 2. The PAYMENT HISTORY with the original creditor and balance. 3. Copy of PROOF OF DEBT ASSIGNMENT. 4. Proof that I legally owe this debt to YOUR agency. 5. Proof that you are licensed and able to collect on this debt in my state. 6. The original PURCHASE AGREEMENT. A. THIS IS NOT ANY DEBT THAT I ORIGINATED MYSELF. I HAVE NO IDEA WHERE THIS DEBT ORIGINATED FROM. This inaccurate information needs to be re-investigated immediately by both the Credit reporting agencies and the furnishers of this information that is appearing on my consumer report. NOTE : As you can see within the screenshots that I have attached, Equifax removed this account 45 days ago. Please complete this file. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681e ( b ), A credit reporting agency must maintain accurate records at all times within the files of consumers. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681i, please perform an internal re-investigation on the validity of this account in question that is showing up on your consumer report under my name and notify me of your results within 30 days of your receipt of this letter and update my credit report accordingly to your findings. If you are unable to provide proof of my requests, then the erroneous information MUST be DELETED within 30 days of your receipt of this letter from my credit report as this erroneous account is very misleading and not mine. This account is causing me great mental anguish and I am unable to obtain a mortgage at this present time due to this inaccurate information on my credit report. Debt Collectors and Debt Buyers must furnish 100 % accurate information on consumers at all times. 15 USC 168s-2 Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION ( 1 ) PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors a person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. Please note that until the validity of this debt is verified, I demand that you CEASE all collection activities and CEASE REPORTING TO CREDIT BUREAUS IMMEDIATELY until complete and verified. Also, it is the duties of credit reporting agencies to uphold their grave responsibilities to supply 100 % accurate information ONLY on all consumer credit reports as the banking system itself hinges on accurate information. DELETE THIS ERRONEOUS INFORMATION from ALL credit bureaus immediately if the information can not be verified/validated. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I reviewed my consumer report and noticed adverse items being furnished by Genesis Credit Management LLC for alleged debts in the amounts of {$3800.00} & {$1100.00}. As of XX/XX/XXXX, Genesis Credit Management LLC has been notified at the address specified in Exhibit ( A ) of ; the misleading and inaccurate information, my right to refuse to pay such alleged debts and to cease all further communication conveying the inaccurate information. This included but not limited to ; telephone calls, emails or any furnishing of information to the consumer reporting agencies. 

Genesis Credit Management LLC never notified me prior to furnishing the alleged debts or ANY correspondence/communication in regards to the alleged debts. pursuant to sections 814 ( d ) and 817 of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA or Act ), 15 U.S.C. 1692l ( d ), 1692o ; title X of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act ( Dodd-Frank Act ) Genesis Credit Management LLC must cease ANY and ALL collection attempts in regards to the alleged debts mentioned within until Genesis Credit Management LLC sends a copy of verification of the debt or of a judgment to the consumer in writing or electronically in the manner required by 1006.42 ; Congress finds there is abundant evidence of the use of abusive, deceptive and unfair debt collection practices pursuant to 15 U.S.Code 1692. It has been well over 30 days and Genesis Credit Management LLC has strict liability and must comply with all statutes and regulations set forth. Genesis Credit Management LLC has failed to comply and respond to such notice and correspondence. Negligence of the law is no excuse. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and the Fair Credit Reporting Act, XXXX XXXX XXXX shall be held liable due to Non-compliance. ( 15 usc 1692k ( c ) ) XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) - Proof of Claim
Company: Rowland Avenue Management, Inc. A/KA Columbia Debt Recovery, LLC d/b/a Genesis

I am writing to formally dispute the bankruptcy being reported on my credit report. The credit report states that this bankruptcy is furnished by the U.S. Bankruptcy Court of Alabama, but after contacting the court, they confirmed that they do not furnish or report any information to credit bureaus. Therefore, the bankruptcy information currently being reported by your agency is unverifiable, false, and misleading.

This bankruptcy has been incorrectly listed on my credit report for several years, despite my consistent disputes claiming that it is not mine. I am requesting immediate removal of this inaccurate information from my credit report, as it is causing unnecessary harm to my credit profile.

Please investigate this matter AND STOP USING OCR ( IF I AM TELLING YOU ITS WRONG PLEASE COMPLETE A HAND INVESTIGATION OR JUST REMOVE IT ) and provide me with confirmation that the false information has been removed. I appreciate your prompt attention to correcting this error.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
RE Account Numbers XXXX XXXX, This letter is a formal complaint that you are reporting my nonpublic and personal information without my written consent. Please show me the proof you sent me giving me options on how I could opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and proof showing you gave me the option to not disclose my transaction history each month with a third party.

The law states a consumer must give written consent to opt out of sharing their nonpublic information to the financial institution. I did this and you stated I did not have that right to opt out. It is a violation to report my transactions or experiences between you and I with a third party or consumer reporting agency without my written consent. It is the policy stated by Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers to insure the security and confidentiality of their customer records and information. This includes protecting against unauthorized access to or use of such records or information which could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to any customer.

I the consumer should have been given the opportunity, before such information was to be reported which gives me the option to direct you that such information should not be reported. I also should have been explained how I could exercise that nondisclosure option, which I was never advised. I have written multiple times, and you have continued to ignore my written request.

Your failure to comply with the law and my written request has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Again, I am requesting to opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and for you to remove all my transaction history from all nonaffiliated third parties such as XXXX, XXXX, and Trans Union immediately. Otherwise, I will pursue legal actions for every month my nonpublic information has been reported which could be a fine of {$1000.00} per violation. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX, BENEFICIARY Without Recourse, All Rights Reserved

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, VA XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX Washington , DC XXXX Subject : Complaint Against TransUnion for Violating FCRA Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally file a complaint against TransUnion for violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). My complaint is based on their failure to report accurate information in my consumer report. 

On XX/XX/year>, I mailed my dispute to TransUnion regarding inaccurate reporting of my car loan with XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX  ). As of today, XX/XX/year>, it has been over 30 days, and I have yet to receive a satisfactory resolution. This inaccurate information has been present in my consumer report for over a year. 

I have maintained communication with XXXX  about the status of this account and possess all supporting documentation to substantiate my claims. Additionally, I have a transcript of my conversation with XXXX  confirming that my account was never reported as a charge-off. 

I would like to draw your attention to the following provisions of the FCRA that support my request : - **15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ** states that A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 
- **15 U.S. Code 1681e** mandates that Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title.

It is my belief that TransUnion and other credit bureaus are not maintaining reasonable procedures as required by law. 

I kindly request your assistance in ensuring that this inaccurate account is removed from my consumer report. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely,

Consumer complaint narrative:
RE Account NumberXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, This letter is a formal complaint that you are reporting my nonpublic and personal information without my written consent. Please show me the proof you sent me giving me options on how I could opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and proof showing you gave me the option to not disclose my transaction history each month with a third party. 
The law states a consumer must give written consent to opt out of sharing their nonpublic information to the financial institution. I did this and you stated I did not have that right to opt out. It is a violation to report my transactions or experiences between you and I with a third party or consumer reporting agency without my written consent. It is the policy stated by Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers to insure the security and confidentiality of their customer records and information. This includes protecting against unauthorized access to or use of such records or information which could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to any customer. 

I the consumer should have been given the opportunity, before such information was to be reported which gives me the option to direct you that such information should not be reported. I also should have been explained how I could exercise that nondisclosure option, which I was never advised. I have written multiple times, and you have continued to ignore my written request. 

Your failure to comply with the law and my written request has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Again, I am requesting to opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and for you to remove all my transaction history from all nonaffiliated third parties such as XXXX, XXXX, and Trans Union immediately. Otherwise, I will pursue legal actions for every month my nonpublic information has been reported which could be a fine of {$1000.00} per violation. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX, BENEFICIARY Without Recourse, All Rights Reserved

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX **Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) ** XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX **Experian Information Solutions , Inc.** XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX **Subject XXXX Formal Complaint and Notice of Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) ** To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint and to provide notice of violation concerning my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) due to the actions taken by Experian regarding my credit report. 

**Details of the Complaint : ** 1. **Dispute Closure** : On [ XXXX, XXXX ], I submitted a dispute regarding certain inaccuracies found in my credit report. On XXXX ], I received notice from Experian that my dispute was closed, and the information was verified as correct. 

2. **Subsequent Modifications** : However, I have recently observed that numerous modifications have been made to the disputed information in my credit report since it was closed. These modifications appear to be an attempt by Experian to contest its previous verification and to evade responsibility for the resulting harm and negligence that I have suffered due to the inaccuracies in my report.

3. **Investigative Requirements** : During this investigation, I stipulate that any continuing investigation into these items must include the disclosure of wet signatures and contracts associated with the accounts in question. If these documents can not be provided, I request that the account be removed from my credit report entirely as mandated by applicable regulations. 

4. **FCRA Violations** : The actions taken by Experian constitute violations of the FCRA, specifically in relation to the accuracy of information reported and the obligations surrounding the dispute process. The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies maintain accurate records, and the changes made following the closure of my dispute suggest a failure to uphold that standard.

5. **FDCPA Violations** : Additionally, these actions may also reflect violations of the FDCPA, as they may be construed as unfair practices that impact my personal and financial well-being. I believe that the modifications made in an attempt to mitigate liability for your previous negligence exhibit behavior contradictory to the ethical standards mandated by the FDCPA.

**Resolution Requested** : I request that Experian : - Immediately cease all modifications to my credit report that have been made post-dispute closure.

- Provide me with a comprehensive explanation for the alterations made to my credit report while noting the basis for their legitimacy.

- Conduct a thorough investigation that includes the disclosure of wet signatures and contracts associated with the accounts in question ; if these can not be provided, the account should be removed from my credit report.

- Provide correction of the inaccurate information, ensuring full compliance with both the FCRA and FDCPA.

- Compensate me for any damages incurred due to these violations.

Please treat this complaint with urgency and the seriousness it warrants. I expect acknowledgment of this letter within 15 days and a detailed response regarding the actions that will be taken to rectify this situation. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, [ XXXX XXXX ]

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
CFPB Dispute Submission : Unauthorized Account Reporting Complainant Information : Name : XXXX XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, AZ XXXX Email : XXXX Phone : ( XXXX ) XXXX Disputed Account Information : Account Number : XXXX Credit Card Issuer : XXXX XXXX  Credit Bureaus Involved : TransUnion , XXXX, XXXX Type of Account : Revolving Credit ( Credit Card ) Account Status : Closed Nature of Dispute and Request for Removal : Account Ownership : I have never opened or authorized the creation of this account, nor am I aware of its existence. This account has been erroneously attributed to me.

Request : Immediate removal of this account from my credit report due to it being unauthorized and inaccurate.

Credit Bureau Code : Authorized User : I have never been an authorized user on this account. Any reference to me being associated as such is false.

Request : Remove this account from my credit report as I am not affiliated with it.

Account Status : Closed : The account is reported as closed, yet I have no knowledge or ownership of this account, making this information irrelevant and inaccurate.

Request : Remove this erroneous account from my credit file immediately.

High Credit and Balance Discrepancies : TransUnion reports a high credit of {$2000.00}, while XXXX reports {$800.00}. Both of these amounts are unrecognized and do not pertain to me.

Request : Remove this account due to inaccurate reporting of balances and unauthorized account ownership.

Credit Limit Discrepancies : TransUnion lists a credit limit of {$800.00}, while XXXX lists {$0.00}. I have no connection to this account, and both figures are inaccurate.

Request : Remove this account from my credit report.

Date of Last Payment Discrepancies : TransUnion reports a last payment date of XX/XX/XXXX, while XXXX reports XX/XX/XXXX. Since I have never made any payments on this account, these dates are false.

Request : Remove this account due to inaccuracies in payment reporting.

Payment Status : Late 120 Days : The account is incorrectly reported as being late for 120 days. I am not responsible for any payments on this account as it is not mine.

Request : Immediate removal of this account from my credit report due to this inaccurate payment status.

Inconsistencies in Payment History : The payment history across reporting agencies contains discrepancies, further proving that this account is inaccurately associated with me.

Request : Remove this account from my credit report due to inconsistent and inaccurate payment history.

Legal Grounds for Dispute : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 : Credit reporting agencies are required by law to ensure that the information reported is accurate. Reporting an account that does not belong to me is a direct violation of the FCRA. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) : This case established that credit reporting agencies must conduct a reasonable investigation when a consumer disputes the accuracy of information. As the information provided by this account is inaccurate, I request immediate removal.

I kindly request that this unauthorized and inaccurate account be removed from my credit report as soon as possible. Please confirm the results of your investigation and provide me with documentation of the removal.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
