Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I would like to file a formal complaint against Equifax and XXXX XXXX XXXX regarding their refusal to remove an inaccurate mortgage account from my credit report, despite both XXXX and XXXX having already done so. This unresolved issue has caused me significant stress and hardship, and I believe XXXX failure to remove the item is unjust and in violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

The mortgage account in question, XXXX XXXX, has been disputed for inaccuracy. Following my dispute, both XXXX and XXXX investigated the matter and promptly removed the item from my credit reports after determining it was indeed incorrect. However, despite my repeated requests and providing all necessary documentation, Equifax has yet to take the appropriate action and continues to report this erroneous information.

This prolonged inaction by Equifax has resulted in undue stress and has negatively impacted my ability to manage my credit. As an individual who has taken great care in maintaining responsible credit practices, the presence of this inaccurate item is unfairly damaging my credit profile. I believe it is only fair and reasonable that Equifax follows the same course of action as XXXX and XXXX and removes this item from my report immediately. 

I am requesting that the CFPB intervene and hold Equifax accountable for failing to resolve this dispute in a timely and fair manner. The resolution I seek is simple : the immediate removal of the XXXX XXXX  item from my Equifax credit report, as has been done by the other two credit reporting agencies.

I trust that the CFPB will investigate this matter thoroughly and ensure that Equifax complies with their obligations under federal law to provide accurate and fair reporting. Thank you for your time and attention to this important matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
RE Account Numbers- XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, This letter is a formal complaint that you are reporting my nonpublic and personal information without my written consent. Please show me the proof you sent me giving me options on how I could opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and proof showing you gave me the option to not disclose my transaction history each month with a third party. 

The law states a consumer must give written consent to opt out of sharing their nonpublic information to the financial institution. I did this and you stated I did not have that right to opt out. It is a violation to report my transactions or experiences between you and I with a third party or consumer reporting agency without my written consent. It is the policy stated by Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers to insure the security and confidentiality of their customer records and information. This includes protecting against unauthorized access to or use of such records or information which could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to any customer. 

I the consumer should have been given the opportunity, before such information was to be reported which gives me the option to direct you that such information should not be reported. I also should have been explained how I could exercise that nondisclosure option, which I was never advised. I have written multiple times, and you have continued to ignore my written request. 

Your failure to comply with the law and my written request has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Again, I am requesting to opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and for you to remove all my transaction history from all nonaffiliated third parties such as XXXX, XXXX, and Trans Union immediately. Otherwise, I will pursue legal actions for every month my nonpublic information has been reported which could be a fine of {$1000.00} per violation. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX, BENEFICIARY Without Recourse, All Rights Reserved

Consumer complaint narrative:
RE Account Numbers XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, This letter is a formal complaint that you are reporting my nonpublic and personal information without my written consent. Please show me the proof you sent me giving me options on how I could opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and proof showing you gave me the option to not disclose my transaction history each month with a third party. 
The law states a consumer must give written consent to opt out of sharing their nonpublic information to the financial institution. I did this and you stated I did not have that right to opt out. It is a violation to report my transactions or experiences between you and I with a third party or consumer reporting agency without my written consent. It is the policy stated by Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers to insure the security and confidentiality of their customer records and information. This includes protecting against unauthorized access to or use of such records or information which could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to any customer. 

I the consumer should have been given the opportunity, before such information was to be reported which gives me the option to direct you that such information should not be reported. I also should have been explained how I could exercise that nondisclosure option, which I was never advised. I have written multiple times, and you have continued to ignore my written request. 

Your failure to comply with the law and my written request has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Again, I am requesting to opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and for you to remove all my transaction history from all nonaffiliated third parties such as XXXX, XXXX, and Trans Union immediately. Otherwise, I will pursue legal actions for every month my nonpublic information has been reported which could be a fine of {$1000.00} per violation. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX, BENEFICIARY Without Recourse, All Rights Reserved

Consumer complaint narrative:
I looked at my XXXX credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against XXXX XXXX for reporting a late payment on my credit report without providing proper documentation to substantiate the alleged delinquency. Despite my written request for proof, the company has failed to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) requirements. Below is a summary of my issue : Request for XXXX of XXXX XXXX : I requested that the student loan company provide specific documentation showing : The due date of the payment in question. 
The actual payment date or proof that no payment was made. 
Any notices or warnings they claim to have issued regarding the alleged late payment. 
Proof that I receive the biling statement by providing mail tracking documents Inadequate Response : Instead of providing the requested documentation, the company sent a response containing only general loan documents and references to the original loan terms. This response did not address my specific request for proof of the late payment or the timing of any missed payment, nor did it include any billing records or payment history. 

Violation of FCRA Requirements : Under the FCRA, furnishers of credit information are required to verify and provide accurate records when a consumer disputes the accuracy of information reported to credit bureaus. In this case, the company has failed to meet these requirements. Since they have not provided proof of my delinquency, they are obligated to remove the inaccurate late payment from my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
This notice is to inform you that you have unlawfully reported an alleged debt to my consumer report. Under the New Rule REGULATION F which took effect XX/XX/2021, You have violated the FDCPA 1006.30a and its new rule by parking this alleged debt on my consumer reports. Cease and Desist the reporting of this alleged Debt immediately or I will escalate this matter to taking legal action. I have not given you written permission to put anything on my credit profile 15 USC 1681b2. You have no permissible purpose by law to contact third parties with my private or personal information. Your offenses amount to Aggravated Identity Theft pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 1028A. You have knowingly transferred, possessed, or used, without lawful authority, a means of identification of me, which is a felony punishable with up to 2 years of imprisonment, in addition to civil liability. I AM A LITIGIOUS CONSUMER I WILL NOT HESITATE TO TAKE LEGAL ACTION AGAINST 15 USC 1692c ( c ) Ceasing communication If a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing that the consumer refuses to pay a debt or that the consumer wishes the debt collector to cease further communication with the consumer, the debt collector shall not communicate further with the consumer with respect to such debt. Cease and Desist all collections or derogatory activity regarding the alleged debts on my credit report.

You have caused me and my family severe harm due to your negligence and inaccurate reporting. This is in violation of my consumer rights and is affecting my credit worthiness.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
RE Account Numbers XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, This letter is a formal complaint that you are reporting my nonpublic and personal information without my written consent. Please show me the proof you sent me giving me options on how I could opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and proof showing you gave me the option to not disclose my transaction history each month with a third party. 
The law states a consumer must give written consent to opt out of sharing their nonpublic information to the financial institution. I did this and you stated I did not have that right to opt out. It is a violation to report my transactions or experiences between you and I with a third party or consumer reporting agency without my written consent. It is the policy stated by Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers to insure the security and confidentiality of their customer records and information. This includes protecting against unauthorized access to or use of such records or information which could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to any customer. 

I the consumer should have been given the opportunity, before such information was to be reported which gives me the option to direct you that such information should not be reported. I also should have been explained how I could exercise that nondisclosure option, which I was never advised. I have written multiple times, and you have continued to ignore my written request. 

Your failure to comply with the law and my written request has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Again, I am requesting to opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and for you to remove all my transaction history from all nonaffiliated third parties such as XXXX, XXXX, and Trans Union immediately. Otherwise, I will pursue legal actions for every month my nonpublic information has been reported which could be a fine of {$1000.00} per violation. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX, BENEFICIARY Without Recourse, All Rights Reserved

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to address the lack of response to my previous notice, dated XX/XX/year>, regarding the request for a copy of the 1099-C filed for the charged-off debt. XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX failure to provide a response leaves me no choice but to assume that you have neglected to comply with FEDERAL law by not filing a 1099-C as mandated. Consequently, I am compelled to inform you that I will report XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX to the IRS for potential tax fraud using Form 3949-A if prompt action is not taken. 

Furthermore, it is imperative that you notify XXXX, TransUnion, and XXXX to delete this information from my credit report immediately. The account in question is detailed as follows : XXXX XXXXXXXX As per IRS regulations, a canceled debt of {$600.00} or more necessitates the filing of a 1099-C form by federal or government agencies, or applicable financial entities. Failure to comply with this requirement constitutes tax fraud, a serious offense that I will not hesitate to report to the IRS. 

It is essential to understand that a canceled debt is considered ordinary income by the IRS. Consequently, any failure to file a 1099-C form, or any attempt to conceal such actions, constitutes inaccurate reporting. Income is not to be included on a credit report, and any such inclusion violates consumer laws and regulations. 

Your company 's actions are in clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 USC 1681s-2, which outlines the responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies. Under this statute, it is prohibited to furnish inaccurate information knowingly or with reasonable cause to believe it is inaccurate. 

It is evident from my previous communication and this notice that there is reasonable cause to believe the information provided is inaccurate. Therefore, it is imperative that you take immediate steps to rectify this situation by deleting the inaccurate information from all consumer reporting agencies. 

Failure to comply will result in legal action being pursued, including holding the XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, accountable for willful noncompliance under 15 USC 1681n ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). This statute stipulates that any person who willfully fails to comply with FCRA requirements may be liable for damages sustained by the consumer. 

I am currently in the process of securing housing, and the inaccurate information on my credit report is hindering my progress. I urge you to act swiftly and cease reporting this item to avoid further complications. 

I am currently in the process of securing housing, and the inaccurate information on my credit report is hindering my progress. I urge you to act swiftly and cease reporting this item to avoid further complications. Kindly delete this off my report immediately.

Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Request for Validation of Debt - XXXX  XXXX I am writing in response to an alleged debt associated with account number XXXX  XXXX I am requesting validation of this debt as per my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 USC 1692g . I dispute the validity of this debt and am immediately requesting that you provide the following information : 1. The original contract binding me to this so-called debt. 2. The PAYMENT HISTORY with the original creditor and balance. 3. Copy of PROOF OF DEBT ASSIGNMENT. 4. Proof that I legally owe this debt to YOUR agency. 5. Proof that you are licensed and able to collect on this debt in my state. 6. The original PURCHASE AGREEMENT. A. THIS IS NOT ANY DEBT THAT I ORIGINATED MYSELF. I HAVE NO IDEA WHERE THIS DEBT ORIGINATED FROM. This inaccurate information needs to be re-investigated immediately by both the Credit reporting agencies and the furnishers of this information that is appearing on my consumer report. NOTE : As you can see within the screenshots that I have attached, XXXX removed this account 45 days ago. Please complete this file. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681e ( b ), A credit reporting agency must maintain accurate records at all times within the files of consumers. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681i, please perform an internal re-investigation on the validity of this account in question that is showing up on your consumer report under my name and notify me of your results within 30 days of your receipt of this letter and update my credit report accordingly to your findings. If you are unable to provide proof of my requests, then the erroneous information MUST be DELETED within 30 days of your receipt of this letter from my credit report as this erroneous account is very misleading and not mine. This account is causing me great mental anguish and I am unable to obtain a mortgage at this present time due to this inaccurate information on my credit report. Debt Collectors and Debt Buyers must furnish 100 % accurate information on consumers at all times. 15 USC 168s-2 Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION ( 1 ) PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors a person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. Please note that until the validity of this debt is verified, I demand that you CEASE all collection activities and CEASE REPORTING TO CREDIT BUREAUS IMMEDIATELY until complete and verified. Also, it is the duties of credit reporting agencies to uphold their grave responsibilities to supply 100 % accurate information ONLY on all consumer credit reports as the banking system itself hinges on accurate information. DELETE THIS ERRONEOUS INFORMATION from ALL credit bureaus immediately if the information can not be verified/validated. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative: RE : Late Payment Improperly Reported- I XXXX XXXX have a RIGHT TO PRIVACY under 15 USC 1681A ( 4 ) as a federally protected consumer and I know my rights presented under the Fair Credit Reporting Act clearly outlined within 15 USC 1681. The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. So, whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft. This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n and 15 USC 1681o, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent. I was reviewing my consumer reports and noticed XXXX XXXX on my credit report that need be immediately updated to paid as agreed. My Consumer rights have been violated by XXXX, XXXX, TransUnion. XXXX, XXXX, TransUnion has violated my consumer rights and violated federal law. This is now multiple attempts to notify you of this erroneous error on the part of your agency. This erroneous late payment is affecting my ability to obtain a loan to save my business from crumbling and also blocking me from the housing that I so desperately need for myself and my family. Please change this to paid as agreed immediately so that I may proceed with my life, or I may be forced to seek legal damages against your agency as I already have sought legal counsel in this more than important matter. Thank you.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This is a follow-up to other complaints filed against XXXX XXXX for deceptive and fraudulent business practices and contains new information. 

Because of years of confusion, being bounced around to numerous people with XXXX XXXX, fabricated statements they made by me and more, I will put the most critical information in this complaint which will hopefully be my last one. 

As a result of errors by Bank of America and violations found, my loan modification ( from a previously predatory negative hybrid loan ) took XXXX  years to be rejected or approved. The loan modification was approved and went into effect on XX/XX/XXXX. 
During that time, in XXXX, my home was destroyed XXXX XXXX XXXX. The money that was paid out on the XXXX  was enough to rebuild in XXXX and has been sitting in an escrow account with XXXX XXXX and or Bank of America since the XXXX. But because of violations, errors and delays, the work did not start until XXXX, immediately after the loan modification was approved. XXXX XXXX XXXX of dollars of arrearages were tacked on to my loan modification as a result of years of their own violations, errors and delays. I was not given any other option if I wanted to keep my property. 

After the XXXX  inspection occurred in XXXX, XXXX XXXX stated only 3 % of the work was done. My contractor and I knew this was an error, disputed it but XXXX XXXX was again delaying, stalling and not communicating. Years later they changed that amount of work done to 10 %. In another inspection that percentage of work was then adjusted to 15 % and then ultimately on an inspection done on XX/XX/XXXX, with the added and corrected information which included the asbestos removal which was omitted in previous reports, the amount of work that was recorded ( which had been done in XXXX ) was actually 30 %. That inspection report was signed by the inspector and the witness who acknowledged all of this information and saw the actual inspection report that XXXX XXXX has withheld. This correct percentage of work was enough money to release more rebuild money which should have been done in XXXX. Because this did not occur, I had to stop making payments as there was no certificate of occupancy and no permanent power on the property. 

In a response to the Department of Financial Protection and Innovation by XXXX XXXX in XXXX, they falsely stated that I did not agree with that 30 % report. They falsely stated I contacted their loss draft department and scheduled a new inspection that occurred on XX/XX/XXXX. This call and inspection never occurred. XXXX XXXX then falsified documents stating that an inspection occurred on XX/XX/XXXX bringing the amount of work done back down to 10 %. There are security cameras on the property and all inspections are done with a witness. There was no witness, there was no signed report and the security cameras showed no one on the property on that date. 

Because XXXX XXXX refused to provide the information requested about that alleged phone call and the signed inspection reports, in XXXX of XXXX I engaged an attorney to secure that information and those documents. XXXX XXXX bombarded my attorney with other documents that had nothing to do with what was requested including sending a decrypted email that had no valid wording on it the day before the last foreclosure sale date was scheduled for XX/XX/XXXX. My attorney sent an email advising of this and instructing them to not foreclose under these circumstances. My attorney was ignored and XXXX XXXX stated they proceeded with the Foreclosure auction. On XX/XX/XXXX, security cameras revealed people entering the locked gated property, climbing through the window of the studio which is occupied, rummaging through items and the mail and changing the locks on both the studio and the front gate. 

In the most recent communications to my attorney, XXXX XXXX stated the property is now bank owned and, over a year later, states that they are not required to provide the information we have requested and I have been requesting since last year. 

It is no secret that XXXX XXXX has a long reputation of deceptive and fraudulent business practices and this is among the worst. Another Law Firm asked if I would be willing to be the class action representative in one of the many lawsuits against XXXX XXXX and I did sign the retainer but after many discussions with the firm, discovered they do not handle individual matters which is why I retained another attorney to assist me. 

I trust this will finally be resolved and the fraud against me that has gone on for over 10 years will finally come to an end with restitution and a resolution making up for the damage done to my finances, my credit, my livelihood and my health.

Consumer complaint narrative:
My account with XXXX XXXX TRANSUNION was never late! I have had exceptional payment history all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment.

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family!

I demand the late payment to be updated.

They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 


XXXX XXXX TRANSUNION Never Sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided.

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! 


Update the late payments from my consumer reports

Consumer complaint narrative: RE : Late Payment Improperly Reported- I XXXX XXXX have a RIGHT TO PRIVACY under 15 USC 1681A ( 4 ) as a federally protected consumer and I know my rights presented under the Fair Credit Reporting Act clearly outlined within 15 USC 1681. The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. So, whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft. This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n and 15 USC 1681o, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent. I was reviewing my consumer reports and noticed XXXX XXXX on my credit report that need be immediately updated to paid as agreed. My Consumer rights have been violated by XXXX, TransUnion, XXXX. XXXX, TransUnion, XXXX, has violated my consumer rights and violated federal law. This is now multiple attempts to notify you of this erroneous error on the part of your agency. This erroneous late payment is affecting my ability to obtain a loan to save my business from crumbling and also blocking me from the housing that I so desperately need for myself and my family. Please change this to paid as agreed immediately so that I may proceed with my life, or I may be forced to seek legal damages against your agency as I already have sought legal counsel in this more than important matter. Thank you.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I hope youre doing well! I wanted to share something that's been bothering me lately regarding my credit report. I recently checked it and found some inaccuracies that I need to address. 

There are several accounts listed that seem to be inconsistent, and its really confusing. Here are the accounts Im talking about : XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX The problem is that theyre not reporting the information consistently. When I look at my credit profile, its clear that the details dont match up, which is super frustrating. This inconsistency could really affect my creditworthiness. 

I already wrote to the credit bureaus about these issues, but I havent heard back from them yet. Its been a bit of a hassle, and Im starting to get anxious about it. I just want to make sure everything is accurate!

I also referenced some sections of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) in my complaint to support my case. Specifically, I mentioned : - **Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) ** : This section requires the consumer reporting agency to provide consumers with the information in their file upon request.

- **Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) ** : This gives consumers the right to dispute inaccurate information and request an investigation.

- **Section 605 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ) ** : This limits how long negative information can be reported, ensuring that inaccuracies are corrected promptly. 

Just wanted to vent a little and keep you in the loop. Please help if possible. 

Take care

Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Request for Validation of Debt -XXXX XXXX, XXXX I am writing in response to an alleged debt associated with account number XXXX XXXX, XXXX I am requesting validation of this debt as per my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 USC 1692g. I dispute the validity of this debt and am immediately requesting that you provide the following information : 1. The original contract binding me to this so-called debt. 2. The PAYMENT HISTORY with the original creditor and balance. 3. Copy of PROOF OF DEBT ASSIGNMENT. 4. Proof that I legally owe this debt to YOUR agency. 5. Proof that you are licensed and able to collect on this debt in my state. 6. The original PURCHASE AGREEMENT. A. THIS IS NOT ANY DEBT THAT I ORIGINATED MYSELF. I HAVE NO IDEA WHERE THIS DEBT ORIGINATED FROM. This inaccurate information needs to be re-investigated immediately by both the Credit reporting agencies and the furnishers of this information that is appearing on my consumer report. NOTE : As you can see within the screenshots that I have attached, XXXX removed this account 45 days ago. Please complete this file. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681e ( b ), A credit reporting agency must maintain accurate records at all times within the files of consumers. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681i, please perform an internal re-investigation on the validity of this account in question that is showing up on your consumer report under my name and notify me of your results within 30 days of your receipt of this letter and update my credit report accordingly to your findings. If you are unable to provide proof of my requests, then the erroneous information MUST be DELETED within 30 days of your receipt of this letter from my credit report as this erroneous account is very misleading and not mine. This account is causing me great mental anguish and I am unable to obtain a mortgage at this present time due to this inaccurate information on my credit report. Debt Collectors and Debt Buyers must furnish 100 % accurate information on consumers at all times. 15 USC 168s-2 Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION ( XXXX ) PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors a person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. Please note that until the validity of this debt is verified, I demand that you CEASE all collection activities and CEASE REPORTING TO CREDIT BUREAUS IMMEDIATELY until complete and verified. Also, it is the duties of credit reporting agencies to uphold their grave responsibilities to supply 100 % accurate information ONLY on all consumer credit reports as the banking system itself hinges on accurate information. DELETE THIS ERRONEOUS INFORMATION from ALL credit bureaus immediately if the information can not be verified/validated. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Request for Validation of Debt - XXXX XXXXXXXX I am writing in response to an alleged debt associated with account number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX I am requesting validation of this debt as per my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 USC 1692g. I dispute the validity of this debt and am immediately requesting that you provide the following information : 1. The original contract binding me to this so-called debt. 2. The PAYMENT HISTORY with the original creditor and balance. 3. Copy of PROOF OF DEBT ASSIGNMENT. 4. Proof that I legally owe this debt to YOUR agency. 5. Proof that you are licensed and able to collect on this debt in my state. 6. The original PURCHASE AGREEMENT. A. THIS IS NOT ANY DEBT THAT I ORIGINATED MYSELF. I HAVE NO IDEA WHERE THIS DEBT ORIGINATED FROM. This inaccurate information needs to be re-investigated immediately by both the Credit reporting agencies and the furnishers of this information that is appearing on my consumer report. NOTE : As you can see within the screenshots that I have attached, XXXX removed this account 45 days ago. Please complete this file. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681e ( b ), A credit reporting agency must maintain accurate records at all times within the files of consumers. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681i, please perform an internal re-investigation on the validity of this account in question that is showing up on your consumer report under my name and notify me of your results within 30 days of your receipt of this letter and update my credit report accordingly to your findings. If you are unable to provide proof of my requests, then the erroneous information MUST be DELETED within 30 days of your receipt of this letter from my credit report as this erroneous account is very misleading and not mine. This account is causing me great mental anguish and I am unable to obtain a mortgage at this present time due to this inaccurate information on my credit report. Debt Collectors and Debt Buyers must furnish 100 % accurate information on consumers at all times. 15 USC 168s-2 Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION ( 1 ) PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors a person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. Please note that until the validity of this debt is verified, I demand that you CEASE all collection activities and CEASE REPORTING TO CREDIT BUREAUS IMMEDIATELY until complete and verified. Also, it is the duties of credit reporting agencies to uphold their grave responsibilities to supply 100 % accurate information ONLY on all consumer credit reports as the banking system itself hinges on accurate information. DELETE THIS ERRONEOUS INFORMATION from ALL credit bureaus immediately if the information can not be verified/validated. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX BALANCE {$16000.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX BALANCE {$18.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX BALANCE {$0.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX BALANCE {$41000.00} RE : Late Payment Improperly Reported- I XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX have a RIGHT TO PRIVACY under 15 USC 1681A ( 4 ) as a federally protected consumer and I know my rights presented under the Fair Credit Reporting Act clearly outlined within 15 USC 1681. The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. So, whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft. This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n and 15 USC 1681o, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent. I was reviewing my consumer reports and noticed XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on my credit report that need be immediately updated to paid as agreed. My Consumer rights have been violated by XXXX, TransUnion, XXXX. XXXX, TransUnion, XXXX, has violated my consumer rights and violated federal law. This is now multiple attempts to notify you of this erroneous error on the part of your agency. This erroneous late payment is affecting my ability to obtain a loan to save my business from crumbling and also blocking me from the housing that I so desperately need for myself and my family. Please change this to paid as agreed immediately so that I may proceed with my life, or I may be forced to seek legal damages against your agency as I already have sought legal counsel in this more than important matter. Thank you.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Since XXXX I have been dealing with XXXX XXXX XXXX, including XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I remain XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, fraudulent accounts were opened in my name. Due to my health, I was unaware of these activities until my condition improved, at which point I began submitting disputes with both the creditors and credit bureaus. The creditors have investigated and confirmed the accounts were fraudulent, issuing deletion letters. Several creditors also confirmed that the transaction records are no longer available due to the age of the accounts and transfers to multiple parties. In other cases, creditors deleted the accounts without requiring further investigation based on the strength of the evidence. 

However, XXXX continues to report these fraudulent accounts. Despite having provided the FTC Identity Theft Report, proof of identity, and creditor deletion letters multiple times, XXXX refuses to delete these accounts, citing that I may have benefited from the transactions a baseless claim, especially since no transaction records have been provided to me, nor do the original creditors possess them. I have requested these transaction records from both XXXX and the creditors for over a year to no avail. 

XXXX 's implication that I benefited from these transactions, without providing any proof, is deeply harmful and unsupported by any evidence. Their failure to produce the transaction records or provide a detailed investigation contradicts their obligations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Furthermore, I understand that credit reporting bureaus do not generally maintain transaction records ; however, since XXXX is referring to these transactions, I suspect they may have more access to this data than they are disclosing. 

Additionally, I am not interested in providing more evidence as I have already submitted more than is legally required. Every prior complaint includes the FTC Identity Theft Report, hospice certification, and the creditor deletion letters. I am also documenting all communication for a future lawsuit, as my health currently prevents me from pursuing litigation. The stress from these ongoing false accusations has XXXX my condition, resulting in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX which I have documented.

Consumer complaint narrative: According to FCRA XXXX XXXX XXXX section XXXX says there is a need to insure that the reporting agencies exercise their responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumer right to privacy. The reporting agency Equifax, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and I am the consumer. I have the right to make sure my information stays private and isn't shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states " It is the policy of Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of it customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. XXXX XXXX XXXX is a financial institution by definition under that title 15 USC 1681 section 604a section 2 states that in general subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates too. XXXX XXXX XXXX the financial institution and the consumer reporting agencies XXXX, equifax XXXX do not have my written consent or any permisson to furnish any information. Any and all consent to Equifax XXXX and XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX  whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written or implied is now revoked. Also 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) says that a financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a non-affiliated unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise his right to that nondisclosure option. XXXX XXXX XXXX Never informed me of that right. Also 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 5 ) says " except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer reports containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. This account is an adverse item that they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. Lastly 15 USC 1681e states " every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title.

Consumer complaint narrative:
S

ubject : Immediate Demand for Deletion and Suppression of Fraudulent Information Due to Identity Theft To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to demand the immediate deletion and suppression of fraudulent information currently present in my credit file. As a victim of identity theft, I did not authorize or make the charges associated with the items listed in the enclosed report. This false information is damaging my credit report, and I require that it be corrected without delay. I reported the theft of my identity to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and have enclosed copies of the FTCs Identity Theft Affidavit as supporting evidence. Despite this, it has been over 30 days, and your agency is now in VIOLATION of federal law for failing to take the necessary action to correct my credit file. As per 15 U.S. Code 1681c2, a consumer reporting agency must block the reporting of any fraudulent information in the file of a consumer, identified as resulting from identity theft, no later than four days after receiving notice. This legal requirement has been ignored, and I demand that the fraudulent items be deleted and suppressed immediately. Your agency 's failure to comply with this statute and take swift corrective action is unacceptable. I expect full compliance with federal law and that my credit report be accurately updated within the next few days. If you continue to ignore this request, I will not hesitate to seek legal recourse to enforce my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I anticipate a prompt response and resolution of this matter. Please confirm in writing once the requested deletions and suppressions have been completed.

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( 4 minutes ago ) to me I am filing this complaint regarding both my personal loan and auto loan with XXXX. On XX/XX/year>, I requested that XXXX re-age both loans after experiencing financial hardship due to a layoff. While XXXX supervisor approved the re-aging of both loans on that date, they continued to report both accounts as delinquent from XX/XX/year> through XX/XX/year>. Additionally, XXXX inaccurately reported my personal loan as late in XX/XX/year>, despite my timely payments. This continued inaccurate reporting has caused significant damage to my credit and has not been resolved despite my numerous efforts to address the situation. The re-aging process, once approved, is supposed to bring delinquent loans completely current, effectively moves delinquent payments to the end of the loan per XXXX website and restoring the loan to good standing. These are the word verbatim from XXXX website " Re-Age This program is designed for members that are already delinquent on their loan more than 180 days. A Re-Age allows a member to bring the loan completely current by adding the delinquent payments to the end of the loan, extending the maturity date by the number of payments missed. " Therefore, once my loans were re-aged on XX/XX/year>, both should have been reported as current moving forward. I was told to make XXXX on time payments and then XXXX would adjust my reporting and balance once those payments were made. The phrase " on-time payments '' is ground enough to provide I made those payments on time before the due date. By continuing to report both loans as late from XXXX to XX/XX/year>, XXXX failed to properly follow its own re-aging policy and further harmed my credit during a period when my accounts should have been listed as current. Furthermore, despite complying with the re-aging process of making sure the loans were XXXX delinquent and making timely payments, XXXX reported my personal loan as late for XX/XX/year>. This report is not only inaccurate but also adds another layer of damage to my credit report, even though I fulfilled all necessary obligations under the re-aging terms. Throughout this process, I also encountered difficulties with XXXX representatives who were initially unaware of their own re-aging program. XXXX XXXX was very combative and is always argumentative. He refused to re age my loan which I had to escalate to a supervisor who was also unaware of the re age program and made me provide proof from DCUs own website to move forward. This all occurred on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX you can listen to the call. While the issue with my auto loan has since been partially corrected, the inaccurate reporting on both loans remains unresolved, particularly regarding the XX/XX/year> late report on the personal loan. I have attached proof of my payments from my bank account overview and from XXXX sent from XXXX XXXX. I will also attached URL for XXXX re age program ( XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX % XXXX. ) and screenshot of the section that applies, and I request that XXXX reviews all relevant information, including the phone calls regarding this matter. If this issue can not be resolved at this level, please provide contact information for higher-level management or escalation teams who can assist further, such as CEO. P.S. Upon further review, I discovered that all my payments were applied to interest only, which I was not made aware of at the time. This was never disclosed to me and further contributed to the issues with my accounts.

The re-aging process, once approved, is supposed to bring delinquent loans completely current, effectively moves delinquent payments to the end of the loan per XXXX website and restoring the loan to good standing. These are the word verbatim from XXXX website " Re-Age This program is designed for members that are already delinquent on their loan more than 180 days. A Re-Age allows a member to bring the loan completely current by adding the delinquent payments to the end of the loan, extending the maturity date by the number of payments missed. " Therefore, once my loans were re-aged on XX/XX/year>, both should have been reported as current moving forward. I was told to make 6 on time payments and then XXXX would adjust my reporting and balance once those payments were made. The phrase " on-time payments '' is ground enough to provide I made those payments on time before the due date. By continuing to report both loans as late from XXXX to XX/XX/year>, XXXX failed to properly follow its own re-aging policy and further harmed my credit during a period when my accounts should have been listed as current. Furthermore, despite complying with the re-aging process of making sure the loans were XXXX delinquent and making timely payments, XXXX reported my personal loan as late for XX/XX/year>. This report is not only inaccurate but also adds another layer of damage to my credit report, even though I fulfilled all necessary obligations under the re-aging terms. Throughout this process, I also encountered difficulties with XXXX representatives who were initially unaware of their own re-aging program. XXXX XXXX was very combative and is always argumentative. He refused to re age my loan which I had to escalate to a supervisor who was also unaware of the re age program and made me provide proof from DCUs own website to move forward. This all occurred on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX you can listen to the call. While the issue with my auto loan has since been partially corrected, the inaccurate reporting on both loans remains unresolved, particularly regarding the XX/XX/year> late report on the personal loan. I have attached proof of my payments from my bank account overview and from XXXX sent from XXXX XXXX. I will also attached URL for XXXX re age program ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  : ~ : XXXX % XXXX % XXXX % XXXX % XXXX, wellness % XXXX % XXXX % XXXX % XXXX. ) and screenshot of the section that applies, and I request that XXXX reviews all relevant information, including the phone calls regarding this matter. If this issue can not be resolved at this level, please provide contact information for higher-level management or escalation teams who can assist further, such as CEO. P.S. Upon further review, I discovered that all my payments were applied to interest only, which I was not made aware of at the time. This was never disclosed to me and further contributed to the issues with my accounts.

Consumer complaint narrative:
My account with XXXX XXXX TRANSUNION was never late! I have had exceptional payment history all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. 


This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family!

I demand the late payment to be updated.

They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 


XXXX XXXX TRANSUNION Never Sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. 


This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! 


Update the late payments from my consumer reports

Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I am a victim of identity theft. I recently learned that my personal information was used to open an account. I did not open or authorize this account at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and I therefore request that it be closed immediately. I also request that they absolve me of all charges on the account, and that you take all appropriate steps to remove information about this account from my credit files. Enclosed is a copy of my Identity Theft Report supporting my position, and a copy of my credit report showing the fraudulent items related to your company that are the result of identity theft. Also enclosed is a copy of the FTC Notice to Furnishers of Information, which details your responsibilities as an information furnisher to credit reporting agencies ( CRAs ). As a furnisher, upon receipt of a consumers written request that encloses an Identity Theft Report, you are required to cease furnishing the information resulting from identity theft to any CRA. The Notice also specifies your responsibilities when you receive notice from a CRA, under section 605B of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, that information you provided to the CRA may be the result of identity theft. Those responsibilities include ceasing to provide the inaccurate information to any CRAs and ensuring that you do not attempt to sell or transfer the fraudulent debts to another party for collection. Please investigate this matter, close the account and absolve me of all charges, take the steps required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, and send me a letter explaining your findings and actions. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX Enclosures : Account applications made on paper, online, or by telephone Account statements or invoices Records of payment or charge slips Delivery addresses associated with the account Records of phone numbers used to activate or access the account Signatures on applications and accounts Investigators report Please send me a letter explaining what you have done to : Inform XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, debt is the result of identity theft Stop collection proceedings against me Stop reporting information about the debt to credit reporting companies Provide me with the records I request Thank you for your cooperation. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX All furnishers of consumer reports must comply with all applicable regulations, including regulations promulgated after this notice was rst prescribed in 2004. Information about applicable regulations currently in e ect can be found at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau 's website, consumer nance.gov/learnmore. NOTICE TO FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION : OBLIGATIONS OF FURNISHERS UNDER THE FCRA The federal Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681-1681y, imposes responsibilities on all persons who furnish information to consumer reporting agencies ( CRAs ). These responsibilities are found in Section 623 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2. State law may impose additional requirements on furnishers. All furnishers of information to CRAs should become familiar with the applicable laws and may want to consult with their counsel to ensure that they are in compliance. The text of the FCRA is set forth in full at the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection 's website at consumer nance.gov/learnmore. A list of the sections of the FCRA cross-referenced to the U.S. Code is at the end of this document. Section 623 imposes the following duties : Accuracy Guidelines The banking and credit union regulators and the CFPB will promulgate guidelines and regulations dealing with the accuracy of information provided to CRAs by furnishers. The regulations and guidelines issued by the CFPB will be available at consumer nance.gov/learnmore when they are issued. Section 623 ( e ). General Prohibition on Reporting Inaccurate Information The FCRA prohibits information furnishers from providing information to a CRA that they know or have reasonable cause to believe is inaccurate. However, the furnisher is not subject to this general prohibition if it clearly and conspicuously speci es an address to which consumers may write to notify the furnisher that certain information is inaccurate. Sections 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) and ( a ) ( 1 ) ( C ). Duty to Correct and Update Information If at any time a person who regularly and in the ordinary course of business furnishes information to one or more CRAs determines that the information provided is not complete or accurate, the furnisher must promptly provide complete and accurate information to the CRA. In addition, the furnisher must notify all CRAs that received the information of any corrections, and must thereafter report only the complete and accurate information. Section 623 ( a ) ( 2 ). Duties After Notice of Dispute from Consumer If a consumer noti es a furnisher, at an address speci ed by the furnisher for such notices, that speci c information is inaccurate, and the information is, in fact, inaccurate, the furnisher must thereafter report the correct information to CRAs. Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ). If a consumer noti es a furnisher that the consumer disputes the completeness or accuracy of any information reported by the furnisher, the furnisher may not subsequently report that information to a CRA without providing notice of the dispute. Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ). The federal banking and credit union regulators and the CFPB will issue regulations that will identify when an information furnisher must investigate a dispute made directly to the furnisher by a consumer. Once these regulations are issued, furnishers must comply with them and complete an investigation within 30 days ( or 45 days, if the consumer later provides relevant additional information ) unless the dispute is frivolous or irrelevant or comes from a credit repair organization. The CFPB regulations will be available at consumer nance.gov. Section 623 ( a ) ( 8 ). Duties After Notice of Dispute from Consumer Reporting Agency If a CRA noti es a furnisher that a consumer disputes the completeness or accuracy of information provided by the furnisher, the furnisher has a duty to follow certain procedures. The furnisher must : Conduct an investigation and review all relevant information provided by the CRA, including information given to the CRA by the consumer. Sections 623 ( b ) ( 1 ) ( A ) and ( b ) ( 1 ) ( B ). Report the results to the CRA that referred the dispute, and, if the investigation establishes that the information was, in fact, incomplete or inaccurate, report the results to all CRAs to which the furnisher provided the information that compile and maintain les on a nationwide basis. Sections 623 ( b ) ( 1 ) ( C ) and ( b ) ( 1 ) ( D ). Complete the above steps within 30 days from the date the CRA receives the dispute ( or 45 days, if the consumer later provides relevant additional information to the CRA ). Section 623 ( b ) ( 2 ). Promptly modify or delete the information, or block its reporting. Section 623 ( b ) ( 1 ) ( E ). Duty to Report Voluntary Closing of Credit Accounts If a consumer voluntarily closes a credit account, any person who regularly and in the ordinary course of business furnishes information to one or more CRAs must report this fact when it provides information to CRAs for the time period in which the account was closed. Section 623 ( a ) ( 4 ). Duty to Report Dates of Delinquencies If a furnisher reports information concerning a delinquent account placed for collection, charged to pro t or loss, or subject to any similar action, the furnisher must, within 90 days after reporting the information, provide the CRA with the month and the year of the commencement of the delinquency that immediately preceded the action, so that the agency will know how long to keep the information in the consumer 's le. Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ). Any person, such as a debt collector, that has acquired or is responsible for collecting delinquent accounts and that reports information to CRAs may comply with the requirements of Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( until there is a consumer dispute ) by reporting the same delinquency date previously reported by the creditor. If the creditor did not report this date, they may comply with the FCRA by establishing reasonable procedures to obtain and report delinquency dates, or, if a delinquency date can not be reasonably obtained, by following reasonable procedures to ensure that the date reported precedes the date when the account was placed for collection, charged to pro t or loss, or subjected to any similar action. Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ). Duties of Financial Institutions When Reporting Negative Information Financial institutions that furnish information to nationwide consumer reporting agencies, as de ned in Section 603 ( p ), must notify consumers in writing if they may furnish or have furnished negative information to a CRA. Section 623 ( a ) ( 7 ). The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has prescribed model disclosures, 12 CFR Part 1022, App. B. Duties When Furnishing Medical Information A furnisher whose primary business is providing medical services, products, or devices ( and such furnisher 's agents or assignees ) is a medical information furnisher for the purposes of the FCRA and must notify all CRAs to which it reports of this fact. Section 623 ( a ) ( 9 ). This notice will enable CRAs to comply with their duties under Section 604 ( g ) when reporting medical information. Duties when ID Theft Occurs All furnishers must have in place reasonable procedures to respond to noti cations from CRAs that information furnished is the result of identity theft, and to prevent refurnishing the information in the future. A furnisher may not furnish information that a consumer has identi ed as resulting from identity theft unless the furnisher subsequently knows or is informed by the consumer that the information is correct. Section 623 ( a ) ( 6 ). If a furnisher learns that it has furnished inaccurate information due to identity theft, it must notify each consumer reporting agency of the correct information and must thereafter report only complete and accurate information. Section 623 ( a ) ( 2 ). When any furnisher of information is noti ed pursuant to the procedures set forth in Section 605B that a debt has resulted from identity theft, the furnisher may not sell, transfer, or place for collection the debt except in certain limited circumstances. Section 615 ( f ). The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau website, consumer nance.gov/learnmore, has more information about the FCRA. Citations for FCRA sections in the U.S. Code, 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. : Section 603 Section 604 Section 605 Section 605A Section 605B Section 606 Section 607 Section 608 Section 609 Section 610 Section 611 Section 612 Section 613 Section 614 15 U.S.C. 1681 15 U.S.C. 1681a 15 U.S.C. 1681b 15 U.S.C. 1681c 15 U.S.C. 1681c-1 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 15 U.S.C. 1681d 15 U.S.C. 1681e 15 U.S.C. 1681f 15 U.S.C. 1681g 15 U.S.C. 1681h 15 U.S.C. 1681i 15 U.S.C. 1681j 15 U.S.C. 1681k 15 U.S.C. 1681l Section 615 Section 616 Section 617 Section 618 Section 619 Section 620 Section 621 Section 622 Section 623 Section 624 Section 625 Section 626 Section 627 Section 628 Section 629

Consumer complaint narrative:
My account with EQUIFAX XXXX XXXX was never late! I have had exceptional payment history all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. 


This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family! 


I demand the late payment to be updated. 
They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 


EQUIFAX XXXX XXXX Never Sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ). 


I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided.

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! 


Update the late payments from my consumer reports

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against Equifax for their failure to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) regarding the investigation and verification of disputed items on my credit report. 

Details of the Complaint : Dispute Process Timeline : On XXXX XXXX XXXX I sent a formal dispute letter to Equifax demanding an investigation into several inaccurate accounts reported on my credit file ( Dispute ID : XXXX ). In this letter, I explicitly requested that Equifax exclude the use of third-party data sources and verify the information directly with the original creditors. 

Request for Identification and Delayed Response : After initially requesting that I provide identification ( which I promptly submitted ), Equifax delayed their response. The statutory investigation period expired without receiving any meaningful communication from them. 

Improper Verification of Accounts : On [ insert date of receipt ], I finally received a response from Equifax claiming that the accounts had been verified. However, Equifax has failed to provide adequate documentation or explain how they verified these accounts, as required under FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ). No details on the methods or individuals involved in the verification process were disclosed. 

Violation of FCRA and Inaccurate Reporting : Equifax has continuously reported inaccurate and incomplete information on my credit report, including a charge-off for a XXXX XXXX XXXX account XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) which I had previously disputed as inaccurate. Their failure to remove this incorrect account after multiple disputes constitutes a violation of my rights under FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) and 609 ( a ) ( 2 ). Furthermore, their use of third-party aggregators, instead of contacting original creditors directly, violates their statutory obligation to conduct a reasonable investigation.

Resolution Sought : I demand that Equifax : Immediately delete all inaccurate and unverifiable accounts from my credit report, including the XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX account, and any related inquiries. 
Provide a detailed audit trail of their verification process for the disputed accounts, as required by law. 
Compensate me for damages caused by their failure to comply with FCRA requirements. 
Enclosed are copies of my previous correspondence with Equifax, proof of identification provided, and the response letter from Equifax received after the statutory deadline. 

I trust the CFPB will take appropriate action to ensure Equifax complies with the FCRA and protects my rights as a consumer.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In the wake of the devastation the XXXXXXXX XXXX Florida has experienced due to recent XXXX XXXX, the several tornadoes, floods, and other Hurricanes, XXXX and several banks and creditors are working with state and federal officials to provide information on disaster relief resources and information. 

Many creditors and banks are also extending courtesy to XXXX Florida victims impacted by the XXXX disasters by furloughing/waiving Credit card XXXX credit reporting and loan payments. 

Several areas in XXXX Florida still currently have no electricity, no landlines, no running water and very limited cell service. 

Therefore, i am requesting that you stop reporting any delinquencies and late payments from XXXX XXXX XXXX xxxxx XXXX and XXXX. 

Please also waive any minimum payments due from XXXX for at least XXXX days ; waive the minimum payment up to XXXX billing cycles. 

Do not report it as a late payment. 

Prevent and waive any late fees. 

The reason why insurers are acting so fast on this is if you remember after XXXX hit XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX hit Florida ( before mobile banking ) all of the credit card companies were cooperating with the exception of XXXX issuer. 

The media caught wind of it when they said if you can't make the minimum payment, we'll just add the late fee to your existing balance. XXXX XXXX then retracted and retroactively refunded late fees in XXXX affected areas.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX of XXXX, I had multiple ( XXXX ) credit card accounts closed by Capital One. The accounts were closed due to multiple returned payments ; however, Capital One had previously, for years, provided an option to pay balances immediately using a debit card. This practice stopped in mid to late XXXX ( XXXX timeframe ). I personally contacted Capital One at this time and was informed that they no longer accepted any other form of payment aside from direct ACH from a checking account, which is not immediate and can take days to process depending on normal business hours and holidays. This change directly resulted in the loss of my ability to immediately pay outstanding debts with the instantaneous debit payment method that I had utilized for YEARS previously, which had resulted in an improved credit rating, and the ability to quickly pay down balances. Since two of the three Capital One cards were my oldest credit card accounts, they supported my credit history as my longest open accounts post-bankruptcy. After XX/XX/XXXX, and no longer being able to pay debts immediately with a debit card due to a change in Capital One policy, scheduled payments were not always processed immediately and at times resulted in a returned payment. As a result of only being allowed to submit ACH payments rather than immediate debit payments, my ability to fulfill these transactions were hindered. Additionally, although some payments were returned ( as they were more than the minimum required payment ), very importantly, I was still never late on any minimum required monthly payment for these cards. 

Regardless, without warning, Capital One abruptly closed all of my credit accounts, hindering my credit score and credit access. Insultingly, their prohibition on debit card payments seemed to have only been enforced during this difficult time from late XXXX until early XXXX, as it now seems that they are accepting debit card payments again. However, their 9 month hiatus directly negatively affected my ability to timely fulfill debt payments, and I was personally negatively affected by the impact of their decision to close my credit accounts, again without warning, after several years of a balanced relationship. 

My chief concern is that my ability to pay a debt immediately, a process that I was accustomed to for years thanks to the flexibility of their cards and debit payment system, was suddenly removed. And almost simultaneously, as all three of my credit accounts were closed by creditor without warning, XXXX of XXXX, the ability to pay via debit card suddenly reappeared. 

At the very least, the closing of the accounts after years of positive history shows a fear by the creditor, although the creditor directly removed the simplest form of payment and debt settlement. Only to months later, after filtering out customers such as myself who were credit challenged and paid religiously via debit card, bring back the simple, accessible payment method that I had used for years prior. 

It seems intentional, and it seems unfair. I would never have defaulted on any payment if it were directly deducted from my debit card, as it had been for years previously. Now, my credit rating has again been impacted, thanks to suddenly having to the door slammed in my face by a company that I once thought was an ally to extend credit to someone who was emerging from bankruptcy. They actually helped me get back on to my feet and re-establish my credit. Except for the fact that 9 years and 6 months in, they suddenly no longer had an interest in my money or business. 

I would appreciate an inquiry and explanation into Capital Ones brief hiatus of debit payments, their abrupt cancellation of extended credit, and the reemergence of the ability to pay via debit card. Im sure that they have covered their rear ends with pages of legalese that protects their rights to do so, but they have unfairly alienated groups of people by prohibiting them from fulfilling making payments in a traditional manner that was well established. 

I look forward to a response CFPB, as well as Capital One. At the very least, I would like my positive credit history and longevity accurately reflected within current credit reports. The unexpected closing of these accounts has severely impacted my length of credit history, and now negatively affects my ability to purchase a home, which was a huge possibility 6 months ago. 

Thank you.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.
