Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : When reviewing my credit report, I found several accounts listed in my name that do not belong to me. According to the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act 611 ( a ) [ 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ], these disputed items must be investigated or deleted from my credit record within 30 days. The items I am disputing must be removed from my credit report as the mere reporting of items prior to debt validation constitutes collection activity. I have contacted the Federal Trade Commission and filed a police report. I am demanding that you remove all inaccurate accounts from my credit profile in the next five ( 5 ) days or I will have no other recourse but to file an injunction against your agency under 617a1 which makes you financially liable for each inaccurate account. Also, under 616 Section A liability for willful non-compliance, your agency has yet to respond to my questions and statements of the Law.

AFFIDAVITS OF LAW 1. Are you the original creditor?

2. Have you given the debtor the opportunity to review the original contract?

3. Have you validated the home address for the debtor?

4. Have you complied with all FRCA, FDCP and FDCPA laws?

5. Have you reported to the consumer who has reviewed the original contract information with his/her original signature?

6. Have you provided the names of all creditors that have provided the names and addresses of the person who has reviewed consumer relations? 

Accounts : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX If the above has not been completed, please Delete these accounts from my credit report and stop all contact with me. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 U.S.C. Section 805., you are hereby notified to CEASE AND DESIST all further communication with me regarding the referenced debt. Failure to abide by this law will result in a complaint being filed against you with the Federal Trade Commission, the Attorney General of both your state and mine, and also your company management. I also have the right to file suit against you for any future violations of this law. 

I have filed an FTC Report and attached a copy of my XXXX  Drivers License and Social Card to verify my Identity.

Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Request for Validation of Debt - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I am writing in response to an alleged debt associated with account number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I am requesting validation of this debt as per my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 USC 1692g . I dispute the validity of this debt and am immediately requesting that you provide the following information : 1. The original contract binding me to this so-called debt. 2. The PAYMENT HISTORY with the original creditor and balance. 3. Copy of PROOF OF DEBT ASSIGNMENT. 4. Proof that I legally owe this debt to YOUR agency. 5. Proof that you are licensed and able to collect on this debt in my state. 6. The original PURCHASE AGREEMENT. A. THIS IS NOT ANY DEBT THAT I ORIGINATED MYSELF. I HAVE NO IDEA WHERE THIS DEBT ORIGINATED FROM. This inaccurate information needs to be re-investigated immediately by both the Credit reporting agencies and the furnishers of this information that is appearing on my consumer report. NOTE : As you can see within the screenshots that I have attached, XXXX removed this account 45 days ago. Please complete this file. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681e ( b ), A credit reporting agency must maintain accurate records at all times within the files of consumers. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681i, please perform an internal re-investigation on the validity of this account in question that is showing up on your consumer report under my name and notify me of your results within 30 days of your receipt of this letter and update my credit report accordingly to your findings. If you are unable to provide proof of my requests, then the erroneous information MUST be DELETED within 30 days of your receipt of this letter from my credit report as this erroneous account is very misleading and not mine. This account is causing me great mental anguish and I am unable to obtain a mortgage at this present time due to this inaccurate information on my credit report. Debt Collectors and Debt Buyers must furnish 100 % accurate information on consumers at all times. 15 USC 168s-2 Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION ( 1 ) PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors a person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. Please note that until the validity of this debt is verified, I demand that you CEASE all collection activities and CEASE REPORTING TO CREDIT BUREAUS IMMEDIATELY until complete and verified. Also, it is the duties of credit reporting agencies to uphold their grave responsibilities to supply 100 % accurate information ONLY on all consumer credit reports as the banking system itself hinges on accurate information. DELETE THIS ERRONEOUS INFORMATION from ALL credit bureaus immediately if the information can not be verified/validated. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to formally file a complaint regarding unauthorized credit inquiries made by three financial institutions : XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX  all reporting on my TransUnion credit report, dated XX/XX/XXXX. These banks made hard inquiries on my TransUnion credit report without my knowledge or consent, in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which governs permissible purposes for credit inquiries. Under the FCRA, a creditor must have a legitimate purpose, such as my explicit authorization, a credit transaction initiated by me, or a court order, to access my credit report. I have not applied for credit or had any transactions with the aforementioned banks that would justify such inquiries. Their actions are in direct violation of my consumer rights. The following case law is relevant to my complaint : XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) - in this case, the XXXX circuit ruled that the Fair Credit Reporting Act does not allow for a credit inquiry without a permissible purpose. The court held that accessing a consumers credit report without explicit authorization or a valid credit-related reason is an FCRA violation. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) - The XXXX Circuit ruled that companies that make unauthorized inquiries or do not have a valid reason for obtaining consumer reports can be held liable for violations of the FCRA, reinforcing the need for consent or a permissible purpose under 15 U.S.C. 1681b. XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) - This case reaffirmed that unauthorized inquiries into a consumers credit history violate the FCRA, and the consumer is entitled to statutory damages and other relief if the inquiry was made without consent or legitimate reason. These hard inquiries have negatively impacted my credit score, and I believe I am entitled to relief, including the removal of these unauthorized inquiries from my credit report and any statutory damages as provided under the FCRA. I am requesting that the CFPB Investigate this matter and hold these institutions accountable for their unauthorized actions and furthermore, remove and delete these inquiries off of my TransUnion credit report. Please provide me with updates on the investigation and let me know if any further information is needed. Thank you for your time and assistance in this matter. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report.

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and may be the result of identity theft or other illegal activities. Attempting to enforce these fraudulent accounts is unlawful. I request that you expedite your investigation to prevent further harm, losses, or damages that I may suffer as a victim of identity theft.

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently did an investigation on my credit report and I am verifying that these NEGATIVE accounts are not mines.

Under the United States Code Law 15 U.S Code 1681 a ( 4 ) Consumer Right to privacy. You are reporting fraudulent accounts that are not mine, which is infringement of my privacy. Congress says I have a right to decide what I deem private. I deem that these NEGATIVE accounts to be private and I DO NOT WANT THIS INFORMATION SHARED ON MY CREDIT REPORT. FDCPA 807 states that these NEGATIVE accounts are misleading false reporting.

Under 15 USC 1681b - permissible purpose of consumer reports. THE LAW STATES ( a ) In general subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

Under 15 U.S. Code 6802 - I have the right to opt out of any information shared to a financial institution, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information, unless such financial institution provides or has provided to the consumer a notice, which I have not received.

******IMPORTANT****** PLEASE DON'T RESPOND TO MY REQUEST SAYING THAT THESE ACCOUNTS ARE VERIFIED BY THE INFORMATION PROVIDER, SEND ME COPIES OF THE DOCUMENTS THAT YOU HAVE RETAINED IN YOUR FILES THAT YOUR COMPANY USED TO VERIFY THE ACCURACY OF THESE DISPUTED ACCOUNTS

Consumer complaint narrative: I am a victim of identity Theft. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. XXXX, XXXX, has violated my rights. The identity theft also resulted in multiple inquires that I did Not approve at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I looked at my transunion credit report on XX/XX/XXXX  and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ). And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to request your immediate intervention and enforcement of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Section 605C, which protects survivors of human trafficking. Despite my submission of documentation to TransUnion as a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, they have failed to block and remove adverse information from my credit file that directly resulted from my trafficking circumstances. This non-compliance violates my rights as outlined by federal law. 

I kindly urge the CFPB to take swift action to enforce the provisions of Section 605C and compel TransUnion to comply by removing all adverse information related to my trafficking experience. Additionally, I would like to highlight the following legal precedents and case laws which support my claim and further affirm TransUnions legal obligation to correct my credit file : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( Section 605C ) : This section clearly mandates that consumer reporting agencies must block adverse information in a consumers credit report when such information resulted from trafficking. 

XXXX XXXX TransUnion, LLC, XXXX. XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) : In this case, the court reaffirmed that credit reporting agencies are required to comply with the FCRA and that failure to block inaccurate or misleading information constitutes a violation of federal law. 

XXXX XXXX. TransUnion, LLC, XXXX. XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) : This case reinforced that trafficking survivors have rights to have adverse information resulting from trafficking removed or blocked from credit reports and that non-compliance with FCRA Section 605C opens the credit reporting agency to liability. 

XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) : The court held that consumer reporting agencies must investigate and block information in credit reports that is not attributable to the consumer, including instances where such adverse information resulted from illegal activities. 

TransUnions failure to remove the adverse information on my credit report is causing ongoing harm to my financial well-being, violating my rights, and perpetuating the impact of the trafficking I endured. I request that the CFPB enforces the statutory protections outlined in FCRA Section 605C, ensuring that TransUnion acts immediately to block and remove the erroneous information from my credit report.

Date : XX/XX/XXXX TransUnion Consumer Solutions XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX Re : Notice of Inaccurate Reporting Request for Investigation and Removal under FCRA To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to dispute inaccurate information that is currently being reported on my credit report. This incorrect information is adversely affecting my credit score, standing, and reputation. Under my rights outlined in the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) [ 15 U.S.C. 1681 ], I request that you conduct a reasonable investigation into this error and remove the following account from my credit report as it does not meet the standards of accuracy required by law : Account Name : XXXX XXXX  ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) The FCRA requires that you assure maximum possible accuracy of information in consumer reports [ 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ]. This account, as listed, is inaccurately reported as a Collection/Chargeoff and contains erroneous information about the original creditor. Additionally, the account details indicate that this issue negatively impacts my creditworthiness, thereby causing undue harm in my efforts to secure financial stability and build my familys legacy.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S.C. 1681c, any account involving collections must meet specific reporting standards, which I believe this account does not satisfy. 
If your investigation does not confirm the accuracy of this item, you are required to delete it from my file. I also request that any necessary changes be reported to all credit reporting agencies, including XXXX and XXXX, to reflect accurate data across all platforms. 
If the investigation does not result in deletion, I reserve the right to include a statement of dispute on my credit file, per 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( b ), and to pursue additional remedies under the FCRA, including potential civil liability for willful noncompliance [ 15 U.S.C. 1681n ] and negligent noncompliance [ 15 U.S.C. 1681o ]. 
Please forward any written communication or updates regarding this matter to my address listed below. 
Thank you for your time and prompt attention to this dispute. I look forward to your resolution within the statutory XXXX window. 
Sincerely,

Consumer complaint narrative: FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) ( a ) Block. Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer ; ( 2 ) a copy of an identity theft report ; ( 3 ) the identification of such information by the consumer; and ( 4 ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer. ( b ) Notification. A consumer reporting agency shall promptly notify the furnisher of information identified by the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section ( 1 ) that the information may be a result of identity theft ; ( 2 ) that an identity theft report has been filed ; ( 3 ) that a block has been requested under this section; and ( 4 ) of the effective dates of the block. ( c ) Authority to decline or rescind. ( 1 ) In general. A consumer reporting agency may decline to block, or may rescind any block, of information relating to a consumer under this section, if the consumer reporting agency reasonably determines that ( A ) the information was blocked in error or a block was requested by the consumer in error ; ( B ) the information was blocked, or a block was requested by the consumer, on the basis of a material misrepresentation of fact by the consumer relevant to the request to block ; or ( C ) the consumer obtained possession of goods, services, or money as a result of the blocked transaction or transactions. ( 2 ) Notification to consumer. If a block of information is declined or rescinded under this subsection, the affected consumer shall be notified promptly, in the same manner as consumers are notified of the reinsertion of information under section 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) of this title. ( 3 ) Significance of block. For purposes of this subsection, if a consumer reporting agency rescinds a block, the presence of information in the file of a consumer prior to the blocking of such information is not evidence of whether the consumer knew or should have known that the consumer obtained possession of any goods, services, or money as a result of the block. ( d ) Exception for resellers. ( 1 ) No reseller file. This section shall not apply to a consumer reporting agency, if the consumer reporting agency ( A ) is a reseller ; ( B ) is not, at the time of the request of the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section, otherwise furnishing or reselling a consumer report concerning the information identified by the consumer ; and ( C ) informs the consyumer, by any means, that the consumer may report the identity theft to the Bureau to obtain consumer information regarding identity theft. ( 2 ) Reseller with file. The sole obligation of the consumer reporting agency under this section, with regard to any request of a consumer under this section, shall be to block the consumer report maintained by the consumer reporting agency from any subsequent use, if ( A ) the consumer, in accordance with the provisions of subsection ( a ) of this section, identifies, to a consumer reporting agency, information in the file of the consumer that resulted from identity theft ; and ( B ) the consumer reporting agency is a reseller of the identified information. ( 3 ) Notice. In carrying out its obligation under paragraph ( 2 ), the reseller shall promptly provide a notice to the consumer of the decision to block the file. Such notice shall contain the name, address, and telephone number of each consumer reporting agency from which the consumer information was obtained for resale. ( e ) Exception for verification companies. The provisions of this section do not apply to a check services company, acting as such, which issues authorizations for the purpose of approving or processing negotiable instruments, electronic fund transfers, or similar methods of payments, except that, beginning 4 business days after receipt of information described in paragraphs ( 1 ) through ( 3 ) of subsection ( a ) of this section, a check services company shall not report to a national consumer reporting agency described in section 1681a ( p ) of this title, any information identified in the subject identity theft report as resulting from identity theft. ( f ) Access to blocked information by law enforcement agencies. No provision of this section shall be construed as requiring a consumer reporting agency to prevent a Federal, State, or local law enforcement agency from accessing blocked information in a consumer file to which the agency could otherwise obtain access under this subchapter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I hope youre doing well! I wanted to share something that's been bothering me lately regarding my credit report. I recently checked it and found some inaccuracies that I need to address. 

There are several accounts listed that seem to be inconsistent, and its really confusing. Here are the accounts Im talking about : XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX The problem is that theyre not reporting the information consistently. When I look at my credit profile, its clear that the details dont match up, which is super frustrating. This inconsistency could really affect my creditworthiness. 

I already wrote to the credit bureaus about these issues, but I havent heard back from them yet. Its been a bit of a hassle, and Im starting to get anxious about it. I just want to make sure everything is accurate!

I also referenced some sections of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) in my complaint to support my case. Specifically, I mentioned : - **Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) ** : This section requires the consumer reporting agency to provide consumers with the information in their file upon request.

- **Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) ** : This gives consumers the right to dispute inaccurate information and request an investigation.

- **Section 605 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ) ** : This limits how long negative information can be reported, ensuring that inaccuracies are corrected promptly. 

Just wanted to vent a little and keep you in the loop. Please help if possible. 

Take care

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX GA, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Last 4 SSN : XXXX TODAYS DATE : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX NOTICE OF PENDING LITIGATION SEEKING RELIEF AND MONETARY COMPENSATION UNDER FCRA 15 U.S. Code 1681n Civil liability for willful noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1681o Civil liability for negligent noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1692k civil liability.

Please accept this final written OFFER OF SETTLEMENT BEFORE LITIGATION as my attempt to amicably resolve your continued violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act regarding your refusal to delete INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated information from my consumer file. I intend to pursue litigation in accordance with the FCRA to seek relief and recover all monetary damages that I may be entitled to under Section 616 and Section 617 if the INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated items listed below are not deleted immediately. A copy of this letter as well as INACCURATE ERRONEOUS ITEMS sent to you previously will also become part of a formal complaint to the Federal Trade Commission and shall be used as evidence in pending litigation provided you fail to comply with this offer of settlement. 
YOU ARE IN DIRECT VIOLATION OF THE FCRA, the unverified items listed below still remain on my credit report in violation of Federal Law. You are required under the FCRA to have a copy of the original creditors documentation on file to verify that this information is mine and is correct. In the results of your investigations, you stated in writing that you verified that these items are being reported correctly Who verified these accounts? You have NOT provided me a copy of ANY original documentation ( a consumer contract with my signature on it ) as required under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Furthermore, you have failed to provide the method of verification as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). Please be advised that under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to ... promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified. 
Its very obvious that your agency doesnt know what the FCRA is, because from the looks of my credit report and all the errors I see, heres my breakdown : 1.The Fair Credit Reporting Act is the primary federal law that governs the collection and reporting of credit information about consumers. Its rules cover how a consumer 's credit information is obtained, how long it is kept, and how it is shared with othersincluding consumers themselves.

2. What is a FCRA violation?

Creditors give reporting agencies inaccurate financial information about you. Reporting agencies mixing up one person 's information with another 's because of similar ( or same ) last name or social security number. Agencies fail to follow guidelines for handling disputes.

3. My rights under the fair credit reporting act : Verify the accuracy of my report when it is required for employment purposes.

Receive notification if information in my file has been used against me in applying for credit or other transactions.

Disputeand have the bureaus correct and deleteinformation in my report that is incomplete, inaccurate, and unverifiable. Remove outdated, negative information ( after seven
years in most cases, 10 in the case of bankruptcy ).

I demand these items be deleted immediately. I entered the items and the outcome I desire below because you are in violation and these items are not 100 % accurate.

They are either INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated. I recently applied for extended credit and was denied I am in distress because of your mistakes.

The law is very clear as to the Civil liability and the remedy available to me ( Section 616 & 617 ) if you fail to comply with Federal Law. I am a litigious consumer and fully intend on pursuing litigation in this matter to enforce my rights under the FCRA.

1. Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) this account in violation not reporting 100 % accurate. The payments have been on time. 
XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Your improper procedures are highly damaging to my credit score. Please immediately UPDATE LATE PAYMENTS FROM XX/XX/XXXX AND XX/XX/XXXX TO PAID VIOLATION OF 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance ( a ) In general Any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00} ; or ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ; ( 2 ) such amount of punitive damages as the court may allow ; and ( 3 ) in the case of any successful action to enforce any liability under this section, the costs of the action together with reasonable attorneys fees as determined by the court.

( b ) Civil liability for knowing noncompliance Any person who obtains a consumer report from a consumer reporting agency under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose shall be liable to the consumer reporting agency for actual damages sustained by the consumer reporting agency or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater. 
* Please remove all non-account holding inquiries Please note that you have 30 days to complete this investigation, as per the Fair Credit Reporting Act Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested as well, to be provided within ( 5 ) days of the completion of your re-investigation and I am keeping a careful record of your actions, including your Method of Verification. I do not consent to e-Oscar or any means of automated verification.

Failure to respond satisfactorily within 30 days of receipt of this certified letter may result in a small claims action against your company, seeking {$5000.00} per violation for : 1. ) Defamation 2. ) Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3. ) Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act 4. ) Financial Injury P.S. Please be aware that dependent upon your response, I may be detailing any potential issues with your company via an online public press release, including documentation of any potential small claims action. I am also including a copy of my complaint to the organizations below : CC : Law Firm XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX of Enforcement Consumer Financial Protection XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau CC : Attorney Generals Office CC : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX : State Senate CC : Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation CC : Comptroller Of The Currency CC : Federal Reserve System CC : Credit and insurance CC : Federal Trade Commission CC : State Regulatory agency CC : California Regulatory agency Division of consumer complaints Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against TransUnion for their failure to conduct a proper investigation of the items I disputed on my credit report and for not complying with my specific demands under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). TransUnion responded to my dispute claiming that the accounts in question had been verified, but they failed to provide any documentation or details about how the verification was conducted. 

Details of the Complaint : Dispute Filed with TransUnion : On XX/XX/year>, I submitted a formal dispute ( Dispute ID : XXXX ) regarding multiple inaccuracies on my credit report, including late payments, charge-offs, and a collection account. I requested that TransUnion provide a comprehensive reinvestigation, including direct documentation of the verification process from the original creditors, as required by FCRA 609 ( a ) and 611 ( a ). I also specifically requested that no third-party aggregators, such as XXXX, be used during the reinvestigation. 

Inadequate Response from TransUnion : TransUnion responded to my dispute by stating that the accounts had been verified but did not provide any information on how the verification was conducted, as required under FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ). I explicitly asked for documentation showing how each account was verified, including : The name and contact information of the original sources. 
The method used to verify each item. 
A detailed explanation of how TransUnion determined the accuracy of the reported information. 
TransUnion did not provide any of this information and instead gave a generic response stating the accounts were verified, which is insufficient under FCRA standards. 

Continued Inaccuracies in My Credit Report : The accounts I disputed, which include late payments, charge-offs, and a collection account, remain inaccurately reported on my credit report. I am requesting that these items be deleted immediately since TransUnion has failed to properly verify them in compliance with the FCRA. 

List of Disputed Items ( Previously Submitted to TransUnion ) : Late Payments : Accounts from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Charge-Offs : Accounts from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Collections : A collection account from XXXX XXXX related to XXXX XXXX. 
Violations of FCRA : TransUnion has violated t

he following provisions of the FCRA : 611 ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ) : Failing to provide me with the specific method of verification for the disputed accounts. 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Failing to conduct a reason
able investigation and verify the accuracy of the disputed information directly with the original creditors. 
Resolution Sought : I request that the CFPB take the following actions to ensure that TransUnion complies with the FCRA : Delete all inaccurate and unverifiable information from my credit report, including the disputed late payments, charge-offs, and collection accounts. 
Provide documentation of how each item was verified, including the original sources and methods used for verification. 
Ensure that TransUnion adheres to the FCRA 's standards for conducting a reasonable reinvestigation in all future disputes. 
Enclosed are copies of the dispute letters I sent to TransUnion, their inadequate response, and supporting documentation showing the inaccuracies that remain on my credit report. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I trust the CFPB will take appropriate action to ensure TransUnion complies with the Fair Credit Reporting Act and protects my rights as a consumer.

Consumer complaint narrative: I have student loans from about 15 years ago. They were set to go back into repayment in XXXX. I called Mohela in XXXX and explained that I am a full-time student enrolled at XXXX XXXX XXXX They stated they needed that information from my school to confirm my enrollment. My school updates student enrollment information to the XXXX XXXX XXXX every month. Mohela received that information at least twice between the time of that contact and XX/XX/XXXX when the first payment was due. On XX/XX/XXXX, I realized that my account showed I still owed the payment. I attempted to call Mohela and opted to receive a callback from their customer service. When they called back, my phone rang for exactly two seconds and went to voicemail before I could answer it. I went to their website and sent a message about the issue and also uploaded a document I received from my registrar confirming my enrollment. I never heard back from them. I am still getting communications from Mohela requesting payment and stating that my account is past due. They are currently servicing an additional loan for this semester in which I am currently enrolled but can't understand that I am a student who is currently enrolled. I don't even have the words to express how absurd this all is.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this complaint regarding Mohelas mishandling of my student loan account. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received official notification that I was enrolled in the SAVE Plan and placed in forbearance until my payment amount could be calculated. Under this plan, I should not have been required to make payments or accrue interest during the forbearance period.

However, without any notification via email or mail, Mohela moved me to a standard payment plan on XX/XX/XXXX, requiring payments that were four times higher than my estimated SAVE Plan amount. I was not informed of this change in advance or given the opportunity to address the issue. I was also not able to sign online to review my account for months ; now that the website is working, I see that my account is past-due, and I've made several attempts to contact MOHELA via phone.

I should still be under SAVE Plan forbearance without accruing interest or being required to make payments until my repayment amount is properly determined.

I am requesting : Immediate reinstatement of my SAVE Plan forbearance status.

Correction of any accrued interest or past-due status caused by this error.

Confirmation of my correct plan enrollment and communication going forward.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Please let me know if further information is required.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX XXXX XXXX I made Trans union aware of the misleading and inaccurate collection account alleging a debt in the amount of {$320.00} they are reporting on my credit report. Ive requested Trans union and the collection company to verify I owe such alleged debt, the date of first delinquency and that the debt is indeed valid. 

Ive disputed this account, and it has been well over 30 days for Trans union to investigate the disputed information and they have failed to verify the information. Per the law, 15 USC 1681i 5 ( A ) if the information can not be verified it MUST be deleted from my credit file immediately. 

By the law it is the consumer reporting agencies responsibility when preparing a credit report to assure maximum possible accuracy. Transunion has failed to maintain reasonable procedures and maintain 100 % accuracy in the information their reporting. Per 15 USC 1681e ( b ) Transunion Is in violation of FCRA and if they fail to comply and delete this information from my credit file, they must be held liable per 15 USC 1681n.

Consumer complaint narrative: I CONSUMER XXXX XXXX DISCOVERED I WAS A VICTIM OF IDENTITY THEFT XX/XX/2024. SINCE THEN NUMEROUS OF COLLECTION ACCOUNTS HAVE APPEARED ON MY CREDIT PROFILES. HERE IS ANOTHER ACCOUNT FROM XXXX XXXX SOLD TO LVNV FUNDING. THIS ACCOUNT IS FRAUD AND NOT VALID. I HAVE NEVER DID ANY BUSINESS OR APPLIED FOR A XXXX XXXX CARD IN MY LIFE. IVE ASKED THIS COMPANY LVNV TO PROVIDE ME WITH A ORIGINAL CONTRACT WITH MY SIGNATURE WITH XXXX  XXXX, NO RESPONSE. SECOND THIS COMPANY NEVER CONTACTED TO ME TO VALIDATE THIS DEBT BEFORE PLACING IT ON MY CREDIT REPORT 1682C-2. IM WELL AWARE THAT I HAVE THE RIGHT TO DISPUTE A DEBT PRIOR TO COLLECTION. THIS COMPANY IS IN VIOLATION OD FCRA 615 ( F ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681M PROHIBITION ON SALE OR TRANSFER OF DEBT CAUSED BY IDENTITY THEFT. UNDER THE FCRA THIS ITEM IS NOT VALID AND CAN NOT APPEAR ON MY CREDIT REPORT WITHOUT SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS OF VALIDATION OR PROOF A LETTER WAS SENT TO ME 30 DAYS PRIOR TO THIS REPORTING ON MY CREDIT ASKING FOR VALIDATION. LASTLY A DEBT THAT IS IDENTITY THEFT CAN NOT BE SOLD OR PURCHASED.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX at approximately three in the morning, my phone and debit card were stolen from XXXX XXXX and Bank of America. Numerous acts of fraud took place on both accounts totaling around {$17000.00}. Immediately, I had to go buy a new phone and call my bank to report fraud and have my accounts locked. So far all the fraud and all of the reports were in my favor of the XXXX  XXXX and I got the {$15000.00} back. However, there were two Zelle payments were made on Bank of America. There were two transactions each one was {$1000.00} totaling {$2000.00}. There were credit card charges that were refunded As well. 
However, the {$2000.00} sent on Zelle has still not been returned to me. When I called to check up, they say theres no new information. The claim reversed and took a debit out of my account. The reason they cant claim is, they cant prove that my phone was actually stolen. But they saying that they were sent from a trusted device, and the verification codes were sent to trusted device. It was sent to my device and she knew my phone pin. So as of right now, its been about two months and I still haven't got the money back. Please help me. If you need more information, just let me know.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against sallie mae for reporting a late payment on my credit report without providing proper documentation to substantiate the alleged delinquency. Despite my written request for proof, the company has failed to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) requirements. Below is a summary of my issue : Request for Proof of Late Payment : I requested that the student loan company provide specific documentation showing : The due date of the payment in question.

The actual payment date or proof that no payment was made.

Any notices or warnings they claim to have issued regarding the alleged late payment.

Proof that I receive the biling statement by providing mail tracking documents Inadequate Response : Instead of providing the requested documentation, the company sent a response containing only general loan documents and references to the original loan terms. This response did not address my specific request for proof of the late payment or the timing of any missed payment, nor did it include any billing records or payment history. 

Violation of FCRA Requirements : Under the FCRA, furnishers of credit information are required to verify and provide accurate records when a consumer disputes the accuracy of information reported to credit bureaus. In this case, the company has failed to meet these requirements. Since they have not provided proof of my delinquency, they are obligated to remove the inaccurate late payment from my credit report.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

I was told that BOA was going to take the 180 days to look int the problem and find their conclusion to this fraud issue. I never heard back from anyone until XXXX of XXXX when we got a certified letter from XXXX telling us what we owed with principle, late fees and interest charges. 
We sent a letter back to XXXX and told them this was not our debt and we never authorized any wire transfers to these banks or anyone else. In fact we did not know the account even had this option on it. 
After they got our letter, in XX/XX/XXXX they sent another certified letter saying if we did not make any payments before XX/XX/XXXX they would start with foreclosure proceedings. 
We have filed a State Police report with the state of Indian in XX/XX/XXXX and filed a complaint with the Indiana Attorney General.

I am a certified victim of identity theft and I have been working with XXXX XXXX since XX/XX/XXXX to recover my identity. I believe the fraudulent activity started in the spring of XXXX when a criminal used my information to report that " their '' Sam 's Club card ( Synchrony Bank ) had been stolen. These individuals changed the mailing from my address in XXXX, CO to an address in XXXX, TX. I was born and raised in XXXX, CO, and have never lived in Texas. Synchrony Bank mailed the new card to XXXX without notifying me and the criminals began to make numerous charges daily. I opened my Sam 's Club card in XXXX and only used it at Sam 's Club as I thought it was a store-specific card. I would accrue only {$700.00} at most before paying it off. The criminals began using a card issued under my name on XX/XX/XXXX, and within two days, spent {$2400.00}. I was unaware that there were any issues with my card until I tried to use it at Sam 's Club in XXXX XXXX XXXX and was told that it had been reported stolen. I made no such report and had the card canceled. I had not received billing statements from Synchrony Bank as the mailing address had been changed without my knowledge. Synchrony ignored the obvious signs of fraudulent activity ; sudden and unusual changes in spending behavior, and address changes. Synchrony has refused to accept that this was not my spending and has now sold the debt to XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. I am disputing this debt now with XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. 
I have attached statements and payments dating back to XXXX showing my spending behavior. You will see that I only made purchases at Sam 's Club and on XX/XX/XXXX of XXXX charges were made at numerous locations in XXXX, TX and XXXX charges out of California. The criminals also made payments on the card on different occasions, most likely to extend the time that they could use the card. The XXXX credit report shows the criminals attempted to open different accounts under my name, as well as multiple addresses and misspellings of my name.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was attempting to make a purchase of {$3000.00} but was being prevented from doing so, even though I had {$3200.00} in my account at the time.

Their in-app chat customer service agent told me that I was trying to purchase from a suspicious merchant. This was odd to me, considering that they had already done their due diligence by reaching out to me at the time of the initial attempt to confirm that the transaction was legitimate.

I took them at their word and waited a few hours before retrying as suggested. Upon retrying, the transaction still failed so I contacted their customer service department via phone. This time, I was given a completely different excuse. The customer service agent said that I was attempting to make a purchase which exceeded my daily limit. This prompted me to inquire about my daily limit, which the agent told me was {$2000.00}. I found this SHOCKING
. Ally 's own FAQ section has a question and answer that reads as follows : " Question : Will my Ally debit card have limits?

Answer : Yes. During the first 30 days, you can use your debit card to make up to {$2000.00} in purchases and {$1000.00} in ATM withdrawals per day. After 30 days, your daily spending limit will be {$5000.00}, and {$1000.00} for an ATM withdrawal. If you have special circumstances and know you'll exceed this amount, call us
in advance at XXXX to set up a one-time, extended limit. '' I have been an Ally customer for well in excess of the 30-day timeframe mentioned in the excerpt above. I brought this up to the customer service agent who then placed me on hold while he allegedly " tried to solve the issue ''. In hindsight, I believe that his intention was for me to grow impatient and hang up the phone.

The agent later came back on the phone and expressed that he reviewed my information with his supervisor and realized that my daily spending limit is actually {$5000.00}.

I persistently remained on the line, only to be told at the end of this hour-long phone call that I was not able to use the funds in my account to make the purchase that I was trying to make, but I should wait for " a while '' before retrying again.

The agent returned with yet another alternate explanation. " It wasn't Ally 's fault that the transaction is being blocked. It is XXXX. They have identified security risks with the merchant. '' At the time of making this complaint, I am still on hold, waiting to be connected to the aforementioned agent 's supervisor.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I originally took out a 25-year, fixed-rate loan with GoodLeap ( GL ) for the purchase of our solar panels. The loan originated in XXXX  with our first monthly installment auto-deducted on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  ( all term payments are auto-deducted ). 

The monthly payments were fixed at {$82.00}, contingent on us as the borrowers reaching our 'target loan balance ' by the scheduled due date. My wife and I met the target loan balance several months ahead of schedule. The target loan balance was an accelerated paydown balance reached by applying the anticipated government-issued solar panel tax subsidy towards the outstanding principal loan balance. This Target Loan Balance and date can be seen on the Account Summary Page attached. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received our new billing statement from GL ( for our XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  payment ) and noticed the term payment increased to {$84.00} ( an increase of {$2.00} ). This was a large increase, but I called GL to understand what caused the increase as we are on a fixed-rate loan and we were well under our target loan balance. The rep agreed my payment should have increase due to those factors, but had no explanation for the increase. The rep took my contact info and stated they would have someone get a hold of me to explain the change and/or correct it. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, GL management got involved and XXXX XXXX ( Loan Servicing Supervisor ) has sent me periodic emails stating they are working with their Investigations team to identify the issue - no results provided. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX stated they believe their Engineering team has identified the problem for the different payment amounts and are working on a solutions to resolve all loans affected - no results provided. The last email received from XXXX ( GL management ) was on XX/XX/XXXX stating they are still reviewing my account and expect a resolution shortly. 

This issue is not the increased amount itself, as it is marginal. The issue is GoodLeap management notated there is an issue, it has potentially affected more loans than mine, and there has been no resolution or explanation of the issue for over six months now.

If the extra {$2.00} being charge to my account every month is going towards our outstanding principal amount, that's fine. However, if the extra {$2.00} is some random glitch, or worse yet- some insidious scheme, and hundreds or thousands of borrowers are being overcharged, then there's a serious issue. 

I have billing statements, documented emails, and a communications log created to track our emails with GL to show a timeline.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Re : Synchrony Claim # XXXX On XX/XX/XXXX, I paid {$1300.00} on my PayPal Credit account to booking.com through PayPal Credit / Synchrony Bank for a three-day reservation at the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for a stay beginning on XX/XX/XXXX. 
The vacation date was planned for the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  event during that week. This was a short vacation for us, to pick up our XXXX XXXX from storage in XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX to drive to the museum. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, while on our way to the hotel we received a phone call from the hotel " manager '' XXXX, who said the hotel had been closed for XXXX months and he was busy making cancellation calls to guests on their way in. He said we would have to call XXXX to get a refund as the " merchant never gets the funds until the guest checks in. '' I contacted XXXX on several occasions [ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ]. Typically, one will be on hold for up to an hour before anyone answers. When I did get through, I was told they would " resolve the issue within XXXX days. '' I have had several comments like that since the initial call and they have only called back once ; to leave a message saying I would get a refund to the credit card used for the transaction. 
As of today ( XX/XX/XXXX ) I have received no refund. 
Synchrony reopened the transaction dispute and then closed it today, stating " we have received no proof that a credit is due on the account for you and or the merchant. '' The hotel was closed and out of business when we arrived. I sent photos taken of the hotel to Synchrony bank to validate the dispute. We had to stay at the XXXX XXXX for XXXX days instead of the XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. 
At first, PayPal Credit said I had no recourse because all disputes must be handled within 180 days of payment. The reservation was made for the hotel XXXX MONTHS IN ADVANCE ; therefore, we would never know about any discrepancies until XX/XX/XXXX, the day we arrived in XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
We have called the hotel at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. They never answer. We leave voicemails when the mailbox is not " full '' and they have never returned any call since the first day we heard from them, again, XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX  has not returned any calls nor sent any communication to me. 
PayPal Credit sent the funds to XXXX but XXXX said to call PayPal for the refund request. 
It appears because the credit card company can not get through to the XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, they feel they do not have to refund my reservation amount.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Request for Reinvestigation and Removal of Charge-Off Account # [ XXXX XXXX ] To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to dispute the accuracy of a charge-off listed on my credit report under the account # [ XXXX XXXX ]. I have received a 1099-C form for this account, indicating that the debt was canceled. According to the Internal Revenue Code ( IRC ) 6050P, a 1099-C form is issued when a creditor cancels a debt of {$600.00} or more. This means the debt has been legally forgiven and should no longer be reported as a charge-off. 
Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 611 ( a ), I have the right to dispute any information on my credit report that I believe is inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable. As the debt has been canceled and a 1099-C form has been issued, the reporting of this charge-off is both inaccurate and misleading. 
I request that you conduct a reinvestigation of this matter under FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) and remove the charge-off from my credit report. If the information can not be verified, it must be deleted from my credit file according to FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ). 
Please provide me with written confirmation that this item has been corrected and removed. If you are unable to verify the accuracy of this information, it must be deleted from my credit report as required by law.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am petitioning once again for the crediting of {$2600.00} from XXXX XXXX XXXX and BarclayXXXX  XXXX to XXXX XXXX XXXX, since there is new information included. 
BarclayXXXX XXXX is very deficient in resolving issues for their clients. They allowed XXXX XXXX XXXX to rebill an outstanding disputed charge on my card without my knowledge. I proved where the company had inappropriately billed me twice for {$2600.00}. The person at XXXX XXXX XXXX was supposed to get this credited, but left the company whose name is XXXX XXXX I had worked with XXXX XXXX to get my site up after the second time it was taken down. We agreed to {$2600.00} for " bandwidth '' issues ( I have proof of this ). The company double-billed me. XXXX was going to resolve but ended up leaving the company. I called one day to try again to resolve the situation, and someone answered as XXXX. I knew it wasn't him - mannerisms and voice tone were different. I asked to be transferred to Accounts Pay to retrieve my money that was double-billed. XXXX ( whom i find later is the XXXX  ) answered and said, " Thank you XXXX ''. I told her that XXXX impersonated and said he was XXXX. She acted surprised but now I know they all just play games. I filed reports with the Federal Trade Commission - FTC # XXXX and FTC # XXXX which I will be happy to give to whomever investigates this situation and the other many documents that back up my story which I was not able to include here. BarclayXXXX is a disgrace parading as a business. They are criminally negligent in their dealings with consumers. They won't even own up to their mistakes- which are too many to recall here. Instead they sent my disputes to be resolved with the 4 credit bureaus. I locked my card before I realized what had happened and tore up the card - and still because XXXX XXXX XXXX  had sold my information on the dark web - the card number was used to purchase some video thing - which I have no clue about. I disputed this charge but BarclayXXXX  is holding me responsible for this charge also. They would not close the card for me when I asked after I realized I had been double or rebilled. Finally one of the reps- whom are all VERY BACKWARD because of the company = finally closed the card and did a reissue which I have not activated. BarclayXXXX  has no record of when I locked the original card since was destroyed. Further on XX/XX/year>. I called and spoke with XXXX at BarclayXXXX customer service. I asked her about the dispute, and she said XXXX was unable to close it. I said that This is a blessing from XXXX, and told her to never close the dispute because I felt something shifty going on. ( But with BarclayXXXX you never receive a straight answer or the same answer twice in row. BarclayXXXX in their own way is as bad as XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
It is a no-win situation with both companies for consumers. Well, sure enough the two crooked companies rebilled this without my consent and without talking to me. What kind of business does this kind of stuff? There is NO CONFUSION. I knew exactly what they were doing and I did NOT agree to pay {$5200.00}. I have proven this with the information that I have provided After I had petitioned previously for my money to be refunded, Mr. XXXX XXXX called me on XX/XX/year> at XXXX XXXX. My husband XXXX XXXX XXXX and myself were on the call with MrXXXX XXXX. 
Mr. XXXX said he knows that he double-billed me the {$2600.00} plus the accruing interest but he said he would NOT refund my money. How crazy and brazen is this? I would never want to do business with this very crooked company again. I believe that this company is not even located in the United States. The XXXX XXXX XXXX  showing XXXX XXXX, CA, I believe to be a front company. They want to fleece the American public. The feeling I received from Mr. XXXX is that it is his RIGHT to do business in this fraudulent way and not correct the wrong. 
I reminded Mr. XXXX that XXXX XXXX impersonated the ex-employee XXXX XXXX to connive and defraud me of this money and that there are FTC reports noted above in this petition and this is a federal offense. 
Mr. XXXX said he knew that XXXX had done this and that Mr. XXXX was fired because of such = and that was supposed to satisfy me. Wrong! Mr. XXXX maintained that he will NOT refund this ill-begotten, fraudulently-obtained money, that Barclay assisted XXXX to steal from me. I think this is OUTRAGEOUS. Mr. XXXX KNOWS THIS IS WRONG AND WILL NOT CORRECT IT and REFUND MY MONEY. We argued with Mr. XXXX but he is intent on his theft. 
THE CFPB is supposed to protect the American public against such shams and fraudulent acts as this. I beg you all to do the RIGHT and CONSCIENABLE thing and REFUND MY MONEY now of {$2600.00} so this can be cleared from my exemplary credit record FOREVER.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Oportun/webbank XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX UT XXXX XXXX XXXX ) XXXX Subject : Dispute of Charged-Off XXXX Dear, oportun/webbank and the cfpb I am writing to formally dispute the charged-off account referenced above. I have noticed that this account was charged off on XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, and I have not received a Form 1099-C for the discharged debt. 
It is my understanding that, when a debt is charged off and claimed as a loss, the creditor is required to provide a Form 1099-C to the debtor for tax reporting purposes. The absence of this form raises concerns about the accuracy of the reporting of this account and the tax implications related to it.

To resolve this matter, I kindly request the following : Verification of the debt, including details of the original agreement.

A copy of the payment history associated with this account.

An explanation as to why a 1099-C form has not been issued for this charged-off debt.

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I have the right to dispute any inaccuracies in my credit report. Please investigate this matter and respond in writing within 30 days. Credit card

Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Confusing or misleading advertising about the credit card
Consumer complaint narrative:
In late XXXX all four of my Chase XXXX XXXX had an offer of {$100.00} after spending {$500.00} or more booking through Chase travel online. 

I added the offers for all four cards planning to book flights and lodging for a trip next year. The offer was set to expire on XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I used XXXX of the cards with the offers activated to make purchases online through Chase travel of {$500.00} ( XXXX ) and {$530.00} ( prime card XXXX ). Both of these honored the terms laid out on the offer details. 

On Saturday XX/XX/XXXX I did not receive the credit yet and could not see the offer listed any longer on the two cards I used, so I called Chase Customer Service. The representative informed me that she did not see the offer on the cards at all. Fortunately, I screenshotted the offer for the Chase sapphire card to send to a friend and had it in my records. However, she did not see any such offer offered or activated on that card. I explained that I otherwise would not have booked through Chase travel if it were not for this offer. I was then transferred to Chase travel to get a refund for the two purchases totaling {$1000.00}, but they informed me it was too late to cancel without a penalty. 

I researched online and this is not the first instance of this occurring. It turns out other Chase customers have issues receiving credit for offers they have added, and the offers disappear before they are honored. 

Through a post documenting this by another customer, https : XXXX? XXXX I was able to call the XXXX XXXX office phone number. A representative reported that she saw that the offer on my sapphire card ( XXXX ) but that it was not offered or added to my prime Visa card ( XXXX ). I know this is not true because I double and triple checked before I booked that it was there even if I don't have a screenshot to prove it for the prime Visa card. In addition, on my chase online banking platform, both my sapphire card and prime XXXX card did not have the offer visible any longer, but my freedom and freedom unlimited continued to have the offer advertised since I did not use them yet. Why are the offers offered to all four cards I have and gone from the two cards I used the offer on? Of note, I made the huge mistake of being honest with her and telling her that I screenshotted the offer added to my card to a friend to inform him of the offer existing, and did not screenshot the one for my prime Visa card because I did not anticipate needing to do so for proof purposes. This was probably a convenient excuse to say the offer was never added since she knew I did not have proof for my prime card. 

I asked her to honor the credit from these two offers, but she said there was only proof that one was added when I know for a fact it was added to both. 

I believe the offer was a bait and switch to attract customers to book, and as soon as they are out of the window for a refund, the offers are removed from the card and the customer is gaslit into thinking they made a mistake and the offer was not present in the first place.Again, this is not the first time for this to happen ( see XXXX post linked above- as the customer did not screenshot his offer either, but it honored eventually after multiple complaints ). 

I have attached this offer in pictures below. 
These practices are shady for such a big credit card company and I would like them to be held accountable for future transactions. I also bank with XXXX XXXX and they usually send an email immediately after an offer is honored confirming eventual receipt of the credit. Chase has no such policy and it is based on trust which is obviously not warranted as seen in this deceptive situation of removing offers after the customer is already baited to book through their platform. 

Specific offer details are copied and pasted below. 

Earn {$100.00} cash back on your Chase XXXX purchase when you spend {$500.00} or more, including taxes and after any discounts. 

One place to book, so many places to go. Earn and redeem points for hotels, flights, car rentals, activities and more at chasetravel.com. 

Offer expires XX/XX/year>. Offer valid one time only. Offer only valid on purchases made directly at chasetravel.com. Offer valid online only. Offer not valid on purchases made using third-party services or a third-party payment account ( e.g., buy now pay later ). Complete payment for your Chase XXXX purchase must be made by XX/XX/year>. 
This offer is only eligible on bookings made through Chase XXXX. 

Disclaimer Chase is only responsible for posting the statement credit to your account based on the data it receives from its third-party service provider. It is possible that a merchant may split your purchase into multiple transactions. In this case, you may only receive your statement credit on the first transaction amount. If this occurs, please call the number on the back of your card. The statement credit will appear on your statement within 14 business days of Chase 's receipt of this information. 

If you purchase a subscription service, your card may be billed for automatic renewals at recurring periods without further notice from the merchant. This offer will not apply to such renewals once the offer expires or is fully used.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : When reviewing my credit report, I found several accounts listed in my name that do not belong to me. According to the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act 611 ( a ) [ 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ], these disputed items must be investigated or deleted from my credit record within 30 days. The items I am disputing must be removed from my credit report as the mere reporting of items prior to debt validation constitutes collection activity. I have contacted the Federal Trade Commission and filed a police report. I am demanding that you remove all inaccurate accounts from my credit profile in the next five ( 5 ) days or I will have no other recourse but to file an injunction against your agency under 617a1 which makes you financially liable for each inaccurate account. Also, under 616 Section A liability for willful non-compliance, your agency has yet to respond to my questions and statements of the Law.

AFFIDAVITS OF LAW 1. Are you the original creditor?

2. Have you given the debtor the opportunity to review the original contract?

3. Have you validated the home address for the debtor?

4. Have you complied with all FRCA, FDCP and FDCPA laws?

5. Have you reported to the consumer who has reviewed the original contract information with his/her original signature?

6. Have you provided the names of all creditors that have provided the names and addresses of the person who has reviewed consumer relations? 

Accounts : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX If the above has not been completed, please Delete these accounts from my credit report and stop all contact with me. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 U.S.C. Section 805., you are hereby notified to CEASE AND DESIST all further communication with me regarding the referenced debt. Failure to abide by this law will result in a complaint being filed against you with the Federal Trade Commission, the Attorney General of both your state and mine, and also your company management. I also have the right to file suit against you for any future violations of this law.

I have filed an FTC Report and police report

Consumer complaint narrative: I first opened my account with SoFi Bank online on XX/XX/year>. I made a deposit on XX/XX/year> for {$3000.00} to cover my mortgage payment. On XX/XX/year> SoFi bank placed a restriction on my account due to that deposit. I called their security department several time and they finally explained that they needed more information regarding the deposit on XX/XX/year>. The agent said they can not receive " 3rd party funds '' and that is why that deposit was creating a restriction on the account. I explained that I am self employed and that is my company. This is how I pay myself is a ACH payment into my back account. They said they would review it and I would hear back but did not give me a time frame. I explained that money is for my mortgage and my mortgage payment would be late if they do not release it. They released my account on XXXXXXXX XXXX and I was able to resume my banking. I made XXXX more ACH deposits from the same account between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/year>. On XX/XX/year> I made another ACH deposit for {$210.00} and the next day they restricted my account again and after seven calls they told me it was restricted for the exact same issue from XX/XX/XXXX. They said they would escalate my issue but would not give me a time frame that my account would be released. I called several more times with the exact same response. I am unable to withdraw, deposit or transfer my money from this account. I called a representative again today and she said she will escalate the situation. I explained I had called over a dozen times and was given the same response. I said at this point you have money, restricted my account while you continue a review and you are not giving me any time frames or releasing any of my money so I want to close my account. The agent told me I would not be able to close my account until the review is complete. I said I want to speak to your supervisor because this is going on two weeks you have held my money. The agent said " my supervisor will probably tell you the same thing ''. I said " I don't care what you THINK your supervisor will say, I would like to speak to him or her. The agent placed me on hold and came back to me several times saying she is trying to find a supervisor I can speak with. She finally came back on the line and said " her supervisor was a lunch and would call me back. '' This processes of holding peoples money without any resolutions and at anytime in not a fair business practice. I was unable to use my money to buy food or pay a bill and there is still no resolution and no return call from the supervisor at lunch.

Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
Request for Reinvestigation and Removal of Charge-Off Account # [ XXXX ] To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to dispute the accuracy of a charge-off listed on my credit report under the account # [ Account Number ]. I have received a 1099-C form for this account, indicating that the debt was canceled. According to the Internal Revenue Code ( IRC ) 6050P, a 1099-C form is issued when a creditor cancels a debt of {$600.00} or more. This means the debt has been legally forgiven and should no longer be reported as a charge-off. 
Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 611 ( a ), I have the right to dispute any information on my credit report that I believe is inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable. As the debt has been canceled and a 1099-C form has been issued, the reporting of this charge-off is both inaccurate and misleading. 
I request that you conduct a reinvestigation of this matter under FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) and remove the charge-off from my credit report. If the information can not be verified, it must be deleted from my credit file according to FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ). 
Please provide me with written confirmation that this item has been corrected and removed. If you are unable to verify the accuracy of this information, it must be deleted from my credit report as required by law.

I received a Cash App card in the mail on Tuesday, XX/XX/XXXX. I had not applied for an account with Cash App. ( I had never even heard of Cash App before receiving the card. ) On Wednesday morning, XX/XX/XXXX, I called Cash App and asked that the account be closed immediately. I also asked for information about how the account was opened. I spoke with XXXX. I responded to the questions and uploaded photos of the card as instructed. I asked for written confirmation that the account was closed. 

On Thursday, XX/XX/XXXX, I still had not received written confirmation ( or any confirmation ) that the account was closed or why it was opened in the first instance. I then wrote to XXXX XXXX, the XXXX XXXX of Cash App, advising her of what happened and asking for confirmation that the account was closed and why it had ever been opened. I wrote to her at the email address on the California XXXX XXXX public website as I was unable to find an email address for her at Cash App. 

On Friday, XX/XX/XXXX, I sent another email to the Cash App email address asking for confirmation that the account had been closed and any information regarding why this happened. 

As of Saturday morning, XX/XX/XXXX, I have still not received confirmation or any information of why this happened. 

Obviously, I am concerned about identity theft and on Wednesday, XX/XX/XXXX, I checked my credit reports on all three reporting agencies and also submitted a fraud alert. I also checked my bank account. If it is not identity theft that led to the opening of the account and issuance of the card, then perhaps Cash App is just sending cards to people to increase market share.
