Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint and request assistance regarding an alleged debt being pursued by First Credit Services. Despite my repeated requests for validation and proof of the debt, First Credit Services has failed to provide sufficient documentation, and my consumer rights under federal law have been violated. 

Background of the Issue : On XX/XX/year>, I contacted First Credit Services via a written dispute, demanding validation of an alleged debt associated with [ Account Number, if available ]. I explicitly requested that First Credit Services provide documentation proving : That I owe the debt in question. 
That the original creditor had authorization to transfer or communicate the debt to First Credit Services. 
Despite this, First Credit Services has not provided adequate documentation to substantiate their claim and continues to pursue collection efforts and report this disputed debt to credit reporting agencies. This failure to provide sufficient proof violates federal consumer protection laws. 

Applicable Consumer Protection Laws : Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) 15 U.S.C. 1692g Under this law, I have the right to request validation of the debt, and the collection agency must cease all collection activity until they provide sufficient documentation. However, First Credit Services has not fulfilled this obligation by failing to provide adequate proof of the debt.

Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 This law requires data furnishers, like First Credit Services , to report accurate information to credit bureaus. Reporting an alleged debt without providing proper validation, especially after the debt has been disputed, constitutes a violation. The continued reporting of inaccurate information is negatively impacting my credit profile. 

Violations of My Rights : Failure to provide sufficient proof of the debt : First Credit Services has failed to meet the requirements under FDCPA ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) by not providing the necessary validation of the alleged debt. This includes failure to provide sufficient documentation connecting me to the debt or substantiating the amount. 
Improper credit reporting : Despite the disputed status of the alleged debt, it continues to be reported on my credit report. This is a violation of the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ), which mandates that only verified and accurate information be reported.

Failure to cease collection efforts : First Credit Services continues to pursue this debt without sufficient validation, in violation of FDCPA ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) ). 
What a Proper Debt Validation Investigation Entails : A proper debt validation investigation, as required by the FDCPA, includes : Review of Original Creditors Documentation : First Credit Services should have obtained records from the original creditor that prove the existence of the debt, such as a copy of the original agreement, contract, or billing statements. 
Breakdown of the Debt Amount : The collection agency is required to provide a clear, itemized breakdown of the total debt amount, including the original balance, interest, late fees, and other charges that apply.

Proof of Ownership and Transfer of the Debt : The agency must provide documentation proving that the debt was legally transferred or sold to them from the original creditor. This must include any assignment of debt paperwork or agreements showing the agencys right to collect the debt. 
Verification of Consumer Identity : Sufficient documentation should be provided that directly links the alleged debt to me, ensuring that the correct individual is being pursued for the correct amount. 
First Credit Services has failed to provide sufficient proof of the debt, as outlined above, and continues to pursue unlawful collection efforts without validation. 

Action Requested : I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action to enforce compliance with the FDCPA and FCRA. Specifically, I request : That First Credit Services immediately cease all collection efforts until they provide sufficient proof and validation of the alleged debt. 
That they remove any negative information regarding this disputed debt from all credit reporting agencies until adequate validation is provided. 
That the CFPB require First Credit Services to conduct a thorough investigation of the debt, including obtaining proper documentation from the original creditor. This must include any assignment of debt paperwork or agreements showing the agencys right to collect the debt. 
That I be notified of the results of the CFPBs investigation and any actions taken against First Credit Services. 
I have enclosed copies of my prior correspondence with First Credit Services, including my debt validation request from XX/XX/year>. I hope that the CFPB will act swiftly to ensure that my rights as a consumer are upheld and that First Credit Services is held accountable for their violations. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX, CPA

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative: I was aware that the due date for my account was on XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I set up an automatic payment for the " Statement Balance '' so that I would not be charged any interest on my balance. I logged into my account again on XX/XX/XXXX and found out that no automatic payment had not processed prior to the XX/XX/XXXX due date. Upon inquiry to the customer service team I was told " Since your XXXX due date had already been established, the automatic payment would not occur until your XXXX payment. '' This is an unfair business practice that places an undue burden on consumers. Even though I made proper arrangements for my statement balance to be paid in full more than XXXX weeks prior to the due date, I am now responsible for paying interest on that statement balance and possibly a late payment fee. Using an electronic payment system as the company does should not require such an unnecessary delay before payments may be applied. I feel this delay harms consumers who proactively arrange for payments weeks in advance, only to find out that their actions are not effective and they will be charged interest or added fees by the credit card company.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I would like to file a formal complaint against XXXX and Freedom Mortgage Company regarding their refusal to remove an inaccurate mortgage account from my credit report, despite both XXXX and XXXX having already done so. This unresolved issue has caused me significant stress and hardship, and I believe XXXX failure to remove the item is unjust and in violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

The mortgage account in question, Freedom Mortgage, has been disputed for inaccuracy. Following my dispute, both XXXX and XXXX investigated the matter and promptly removed the item from my credit reports after determining it was indeed incorrect. However, despite my repeated requests and providing all necessary documentation, XXXX has yet to take the appropriate action and continues to report this erroneous information. 

This prolonged inaction by XXXX has resulted in undue stress and has negatively impacted my ability to manage my credit. As an individual who has taken great care in maintaining responsible credit practices, the presence of this inaccurate item is unfairly damaging my credit profile. I believe it is only fair and reasonable that XXXX follows the same course of action as XXXX and XXXX and removes this item from my report immediately. 

I am requesting that the CFPB intervene and hold XXXX accountable for failing to resolve this dispute in a timely and fair manner. The resolution I seek is simple : the immediate removal of the Freedom Mortgage item from my XXXX credit report, as has been done by the other two credit reporting agencies. 

I trust that the CFPB will investigate this matter thoroughly and ensure that XXXX complies with their obligations under federal law to provide accurate and fair reporting. Thank you for your time and attention to this important matter.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> purchased a brand new generator for {$1500.00} Approximately XX/XX/year> generator arrived with clear shipping damage, tested generator same day and contacted reseller They refused refunding or replacing citing the generator was powered on despite it not arriving originally in the condition purchased, offered only {$150.00} as credit. This resolution was not acceptable and advised against by manufacturer approved service centers local to me ; who advised that the generator part that was damaged can create a safety risk in operating it and reseller should be able to fix/replace regardless of use.

Opened credit card dispute around XX/XX/year> after still getting an unsatisfactory resolution with Paypal dispute. Paypal policy for refund requires return shipping, received quotes for {$1200.00} to ship generator which makes this unfeasible.

Approximately XX/XX/year> got notification of digital letter from credit card company and noticed reverse charge {$1500.00}. The portal to manage the credit card does not allow digital letters to be viewed as it has not been implemented yet by Paypal. Spoke with credit card customer service who advised a paper copy should also be coming shortly and asked for reasoning of dispute being cancelled. Rep cited that the seller showed proof the generator was sent to us, I advised that the dispute was not for none receipt but for damaged product being sent. Rep apologized and advised to reopen dispute and advised they will make the reasoning more explicit.

Approximately XX/XX/year> dispute was closed again, spoke with customer service rep who advised they can not speak about the reasoning and I should be receiving a paper copy. I advised that I have yet to receive any paper/mailed information of the first dispute cancellation. They advised to be patient and it will arrive for both eventually.

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Few days later, i received an email saying that i can add the card on my XXXX XXXX, so i did that, but i needed to call in to activate the card. So, i called and spoke with the rep, i answered questions to verify my identity to the rep, and even after the rep verified my identity, the rep said " oops no we cant activate the card. '' Another time wasted, i know the call was recorded, go ahead listen to it. Then today i received a letter from you saying you cant verify my identity and i need to mail information that can verify my identity. Wow! Great job whoever is at the backend, i have XXXX credit score, XXXX derogatory marks, never once missed a payment, and XXXX active credit cards. By far, bread cashback is the worst XXXX awful credit card i have experience with. No, i will not mail my identity just to some random address you sent me to whoever incompetent employee at the receiving end that could steal my identity and waste my time again and again. Lets save ourselves times and feel free to cancel the card and close the account. I also would like to complaint because of applying for the credit card, my scores tanked by a several points and it would have been fine if i could use the card, but now not only my scores tanked, i cant even use the card. Businesses like Comenity should be fined by CFPB for wasting consumers times just to teach them a lesson for other institutions not to waste people time.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
Validation of a Debt Request Pursuant to 15 USC 1692g.

BE ADVISED, this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692g stating your claim is disputed and validation is requested.

This is NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to the above-named Title and Section. I respectfully request your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you. 

At this time, I will also inform you that if your offices have reported invalidated information to any of the 3 major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX or XXXX ) this action may constitute fraud under both Federal and State Laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found on any of my credit reports by your company or the company you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against and your client for the following : violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, and Defamation of Character ( per se ). 

If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following Declaration, I will require at least 30 days to investigate this information, during which time all collection activity shall CEASE and Desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with my legal counsel for suit. This includes any listing of information to a credit reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated. 
If your office fails to respond to this validation request within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my credit file, and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately. 

The Following information is required. Please fill out the form below in its entirety.

1. Name and address of Alleged creditor : 2. Name on file of alleged debtor : 3. Alleged Account # : 4. Address on file for alleged debtor : 5. Amount of alleged debt : 6. Date this alleged became payable : 7. Date of original charge off or delinquency : 8. Was this debt assigned to a debt collector or purchased? ____ No ____Yes 9. Amount Paid if debt was purchased : 10. Commission for debt if collection efforts are successful : Please attach copies of the following : Agreement with your client that grants COLLECTION COMPANY NAME the authority to collect this alleged debt.

Signed agreement Debtor has made with Debt Collector, or other verifiable proof Debtor has a contractual obligation to pay Debt collector.

Any agreement that bears the signature of Debtor, wherein agreed to pay Creditor.

All statements while this account was open.

Have any insurance claims been made by any creditor regarding this account?

o Yes o No Have any Judgements been obtained by any creditor regarding this account?

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I arrived at the Capital One at XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX I made several deposits totaling {$2400.00}. The first round of deposits made around XXXX total {$2300.00}. The ATM glitched and only allowed deposits of {$600.00} and {$340.00} totaling {$940.00}. Hence, {$1300.00} was not reflected in my account. I left the ATM and later came back around XXXX to deposit {$160.00}, once again the ATM glitched and the {$160.00} also did not reflect in my account. Totaling {$1500.00} missing, and not reflecting in my account. I then called Capital One and told them about my situation. They asked how much was missing and I told them. Thankfully I had previously written the total on XXXX separate pieces of paper that I put in the XXXX bank, where I extracted the money from. XXXX paper said {$130.00} and the other paper said {$2300.00} totaling {$2400.00} as previously stated. Unfortunately I did not write down the number of notes and amount of each, but I specifically remember the last {$160.00} consisted of XXXX {$20.00} notes as I counted it before I deposited it in the ATM that then glitched. Capital One conducted their investigation and later informed me that they did not see {$1000.00} of the money that I said was missing. So they deducted that money. I called them and they told me to send my " proof '' to the email provided. Unfortunately, the only proof I had was XXXX saying that the ATM could not take deposits after it had swallowed my deposit. I sent them the email, waited. Then I called them to ask what was taking so long, because I had intended to put the money in my savings account, because it was money I had made from my summer job, which I had intended to spend on XXXX XXXX. Capital One is yet to respond, even after I gave them a clear description of the times I showed up, the vehicle I was in and the location I was at. I'm deeply saddened and in financial pain from their decision. I have no reason to lie. Please help me.

First the money transferred was on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX for {$5000.00} and on XX/XX/XXXX again for {$10000.00}. US bank said that they cant do anything because it was wired transfer and wire transfer is irreversible. So i filed again and same thing they told me that it was irreversible. They told me that the only thing i will get a refund is if the receiving bank is willing to return my money back. This is my money and this is total fraud. I didnt authorize these. Weve been with US bank for over 20 years now and its sooo sad that they are not willing to help us on our lowest point. I feel that we arent protected especially our money with them. I feel that they failed us big time for not protecting our money. 

Ps. They closed our old acct and we opened a new acct.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint against XXXX Acura XXXX XXXX, operated by XXXX XXXX, regarding a serious case of fraud and forgery involving an employee named XXXX XXXX. This case involved unauthorized alterations and duplication of a vehicle lease agreement that was fraudulently signed in our names. 

Incident Description : On XX/XX/year>, my wife and I entered into a vehicle lease agreement with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Without our knowledge or consent, a second fraudulent contract was created by XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/year>, which included terms we never agreed to. This fraud was only discovered at the end of the lease term due to additional unexpected fees being charged. 

Discovery and Subsequent Actions : Upon discovering the forgery, we filed a police report with the XXXX, Arizona Police Department, which was forwarded to the XXXX Police in California. However, this case was not pursued due to other ongoing police priorities. We also reported this incident to the XXXX Investigations Department, who confirmed the fraud but did not press charges due to the lack of an eyewitness. 

Additionally, we filed a fraud claim with Acura/Honda Financial , who after their investigation, confirmed the contract was fraudulent and removed the associated credit line from our credit reports. Unfortunately, this action resulted in a significant drop of over XXXX points in my credit score, further compounding the financial damage we have suffered. This significant drop impaired my ability to purchase another vehicle and caused my insurance cost to rise significantly. Importantly, Acura/Honda Financial has declined to refund any payments made under the fraudulent contract. 

Advers Action by Honda/Acura Financial : While we were actively seeking resolution, Acura/Honda Financial proceeded to repossess the vehicle, exacerbating the situation and leaving us without a critical means of transportation since we are a one vehicle household.

We trust the CFPB will take immediate action on this matter, which not only involves financial exploitation but also significant distress and damage to our financial standing. 

We have documents supporting our claims, evidencing the discrepancy between the original contract and the forged documents. The file is large and over XXXX megabites in PDF format. I attempted to upload the files and they will not upload, even when the file size was reduced.

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
Edfinancial services are trying to demand I pay back {$4700.00} plus interest because they " sent a duplicate refund '' by accident a year and a half ago. When I was going to beauty school in XXXX, I had no choice but to take out a loan of {$9000.00} to make tuition, which I paid off by the end of my school year. After I graduated, XXXX XXXX school took out another loan with edfinancial services of {$670.00} without my consent. I filed a dispute with XXXX XXXX XXXX  to which the loan was put on forbearance until XXXX while the investigation was going on. Last year of XXXX, the case was settled and I received forgiveness for that. I also received a letter in the mail stating I would be getting a refund back based on my claim. So at this point I owed nothing and I received a refund in full for what I paid for back when I was going to school thanks to the loan forgiveness and my claim. Today XX/XX/XXXX, I received a call from edfinancial services and an email right after stating I need to check my inbox. Upon signing in, I immediately noticed the late payments and the amount the website was claiming I owed. I called edfinancial services to which they pointed me to the inbox on their website. On XX/XX/XXXX, they have sent me a letter on their website stating that they sent a duplicate refund of {$4700.00} and they want me to pay it back. The charges I have pending on the website add up to {$4900.00} because they have already started charging me for their payment plan plus interest. I had no idea where this came from or why, a year and a half later. I am in disbelief. I have other inbox notifications from them on their website. XX/XX/XXXX, they sent a letter showing I have loans that needs to be paid. It's the same loans that I disputed back when I finished school but they added more money on top of it to add up to {$4700.00}. It also stated that I wouldn't need to make a payment until XXXX and they are putting me on a payment plan of {$50.00} a month. On XX/XX/XXXX, they sent a letter titled " 11 day delinquency notice '' saying that I am XXXX or more days past due on paying back that loan of {$4700.00}. On that same day, XX/XX/XXXX, they sent out another letter showing a billing statement which shows that I am 2 months late for paying them back and I now owe them {$100.00}. Which is weird because in the inbox from their site, I received those 3 letters back to back in one month ; two on the same day. On XXXX XXXX, on their edfinancial website inbox, I received a letter of " delinquency '' stating that I am XXXX or more days past due for paying them back. On that same day, XXXX XXXX, I received another letter on their site with another billing statement showing that I need to make a payment of {$150.00}. Today, XXXX XXXX, I received a call from an unknown number, which I don't answer unknown numbers due to scam likely calls. I received an email from edfinancial services right after saying I need to check my edfinancial account but a warning for possible scam. I decided to put the number that called into XXXX and it turned out to be edfinancial services calling, so I logged into the website. Only once on the phone, the customer service representative told me that I should check my edfinancial inbox. When I did, I noticed a letter which was received that same day, XXXX XXXX, stating the refund error on their part but that I have to send back the refund. The refund that I did not know I had to send back which is also starting to grow interest. I also received no warning for it yet it is showing as a loan and only today was I notified about it being a " duplicate refund '' that needs to be sent back. On my student aid account, I have no pending loans. Everything is paid off and forgiven. Yet on edfinancial services they are insisting a loan needs to be paid back. Now, this was a year and a half ago that I received said refund. I am broke and unemployed, living with my mom. That money was used to help with rent and other living expenses. I do not have the money that they are demanding back with Interest. I also do not appreciate that they are trying to just dump this responsibility on me last minute with no warning. As you can see, they sent me a notice only on their website then right after another stating that I was already past due for said payments, which I don't understand how that's possible. I would like to know if it is possible to investigate this because to me it seems pretty sketchy. This is also not my fault that they made a mistake a year and a half ago. I don't think it's right that I have to be responsible for their mistake. I am broke and unemployed so there is no way that I could afford this right now and it came out of the blue from my knowledge. 
At the end of the call with Edfinancial services, they told me I would need to contact XXXX XXXX XXXX to file a dispute. I talked to 3 Edfinancial Service customer service representatives who did not fully understand my problem and insisted that I had to pay back this " duplicate refund ''. The last representative encouraged me to call XXXX XXXX XXXX to see if I can make a dispute. While on the phone with XXXX XXXX XXXX, the customer service representative was so confused on why I was being charged because it shows on my account that I have no pending loans and everything was paid off or forgiven. The Federal Student Aid customer representative then connected me with a supervisor who was also confused on my situation and insisted that I make a complaint on Federal Student Aid website to make a dispute against what it happening. The supervisor also stated that they have never seen this type of situation before. 
I have made the claim on the Federal Student Aid website and I am also making a claim on CFPB as well to help resolve this sketchy situation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
RE Account Numbers XXXX Mercedes Benz Financial Services, This letter is a formal complaint that you are reporting my nonpublic and personal information without my written consent. Please show me the proof you sent me giving me options on how I could opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and proof showing you gave me the option to not disclose my transaction history each month with a third party. 
The law states a consumer must give written consent to opt out of sharing their nonpublic information to the financial institution. I did this and you stated I did not have that right to opt out. It is a violation to report my transactions or experiences between you and I with a third party or consumer reporting agency without my written consent. It is the policy stated by Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers to insure the security and confidentiality of their customer records and information. This includes protecting against unauthorized access to or use of such records or information which could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to any customer. 

I the consumer should have been given the opportunity, before such information was to be reported which gives me the option to direct you that such information should not be reported. I also should have been explained how I could exercise that nondisclosure option, which I was never advised. I have written multiple times, and you have continued to ignore my written request. 

Your failure to comply with the law and my written request has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Again, I am requesting to opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and for you to remove all my transaction history from all nonaffiliated third parties such as XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX immediately. Otherwise, I will pursue legal actions for every month my nonpublic information has been reported which could be a fine of {$1000.00} per violation. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX, BENEFICIARY Without Recourse, All Rights Reserved

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative:
Signed up for carecredit at the recommendation of my XXXX. My confirmation screenshot shows that I qualified for both interest free if paid for with x months, and reduced APR. 
My total XXXX  bill was for the amount of {$3400.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. But for whatever reason, this was broken out into XXXX payments. 
XXXX payment for {$260.00} for a DEFERRED INTEREST/NO INTEREST plan 2. payment for {$3100.00} for a FIXED PAYMENT REDUCED APR plan The 1. Deferred Interest Plan and the 2. Fixed Payment Reduced APR Plan are both referred to as PROMOTIONAL plans, but they both operate very differently. 
In fact there is nothing PROMOTIONAL about the Fixed Payment Reduced APR Plan. Upon using it, it immediately charges the consumer compounding interest of 18.90 %. Not what someone thinks about when they think about a promotion. 
The alleged promotion here is NOT charging 32.99 % interest. 

Upon reading the statement, and terms of conditions, it appears that there is particular attempt to use language in a way specifically so to make it confusing. Promotional is used to describe multiple different variables, " Promotional Balance '' " Promotional Expiration Date '' " Promotional Purchase '' Also referring to the APR Plan as a " Fixed Payment '' plan, it gives the implication of no interest, despite this not being a fixed payment plan. 

The statement describes the promotional balance of each plan like this " YOU MUST PAY EACH PROMOTIONAL BALANCE IN FULL BY ITS EXPIRATION DATE TO AVOID PAYING DEFERRED INTEREST CHARGES. PLEASE SEE THE PROMOTIONAL PURCHASE SUMMARY SECTION ON THIS STATEMENT FOR FURTHER DETAILS. YOU HAVE A PROMOTION ( XXXX ) EXPIRING ON XX/XX/XXXX. '' When it says 'you must pay each promotiona balance in full by its expiration date ' for the Fixed Payment Reduced APR Plan it is saying you must pay off the entire loan immediately to avoid interest. 

Since initially signing up, i've made multiple efforts to setup autopay on the phone, and have continuously resulted in missed payments, additional fees. The website has required several attempts to finally get on, it seems poorly designed and has limited accessibility.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX, at XXXX XXXX XXXX, I was manipulated into accepting a predatory auto loan from Westlake Financial. The terms of the loan were abusive from the start, with an extortionate XXXX XXXX interest rate. I was coerced into this loan with minimal transparency about the long-term financial harm it would cause. This loan should never have been approved for someone in my financial position at the time. 

Over the course of this loan, I have paid Westlake Financial over {$12000.00}, yet they still repossessed my car and are now demanding an additional {$1500.00} to retrieve it. The car is in poor condition, damaged, and not even worth the amount they are asking for. They are holding the vehicle ransom with absurd charges that far exceed its value, all while exploiting consumers like me with their unethical loan practices. 

Westlake Financial is notorious for taking advantage of vulnerable individuals with predatory interest rates and loan terms designed to trap people in debt. I believe this company is engaging in unethical and potentially illegal lending practices. Their business model seems focused on extracting every possible dollar from customers, regardless of the customers ability to pay or the vehicles actual worth. 

This situation has caused extreme financial XXXX, and I can no longer afford to be held hostage by their outrageous demands. I am filing this complaint in hopes of preventing further exploitation of others and seeking immediate relief from this debt. I request a full investigation into Westlake Financials lending practices and demand that this predatory behavior be stopped.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened a checking and savings account on XX/XX/24 along with a credit card at Chase bank.I paid my credit card bill before even receiving a statement. When I visited the bank for the first time to withdraw funds, I was treated poorly by the teller and denied access to my money. After requesting to speak with a manager, the person I spoke towho I later discovered was actually the managerclaimed the manager wasnt available. Neither the teller nor the manager provided any explanation for why my transaction was denied, even after asking me a series of questions. I went to another branch immediately & successfully withdraw funds from my account without any issues. I also filed a report against that teller that day. 

About 2 weeks later, I found out that my credit card, checking, and savings accounts, including a custodial account for my dependent, had all been closed. When I asked for more information, I was not told the reason for the closure, except for a note from the teller saying I had been rude to her. I asked them to review the camera footage to prove the teller was being dishonest, but I was informed they would not investigate further or reopen my account. I received no assistance, and I still dont know why my account was closed.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX*Introduction and Summary of Complaint** I am filing this complaint against **Zwicker & Associates** , a debt collection firm representing XXXX XXXX, concerning their attempts to collect an alleged debt that I dispute. This debt may stem from **identity theft**, as I have been a victim of fraud **over five times in the past two years**. **Zwicker & Associates** has failed to validate the debt as required under the **Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) **, failed to provide accommodations under the **Americans with Disabilities Act ( ADA ) **, and misrepresented their role in collecting the debt, claiming they are merely representing XXXXXXXX XXXX* and do not own the debt. 

Furthermore, as a law firm representing a creditor, **Zwicker & Associates** must adhere to strict legal standards for proving their right to collect on a debt. They must provide comprehensive, verifiable evidence similar to what would be required in court, including documents that establish their standing to collect, proof of the debts existence, and authorization to act on behalf of XXXX XXXX XXXX 

I demand that **Zwicker & Associates** provide the following **court-required evidence** before any further collection attempts. 

-XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXFactual Background** 1. **Disputed Debt & Identity Theft History** I dispute the debt **Zwicker & Associates** claims I owe to XXXX XXXX. Given my history of **identity theft**, where my personal information has been stolen **five times in the past two years**, it is possible that this alleged debt is fraudulent. **Zwicker & Associates** must provide sufficient documentation to prove that the debt is valid and that they have the legal right to collect it, as required by the **FDCPA**. 

2. **Claimed Mailings & Lack of Proof of Delivery** **Zwicker & Associates** asserts they sent me the **debt verification notice** as mandated by **FDCPA Section 809 ( a ) **. However, I have not received such a notice. I demand that **Zwicker & Associates** provide **certified mail receipts**, **tracking numbers**, or other verifiable proof that they sent the debt verification notice and that I received it. Without this proof, their claims of having sent the notice are invalid. 

3. **Failure to Acknowledge Disability Accommodation Requests** I have made **seven requests** for reasonable accommodations under the **ADA** due to my XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, but **Zwicker & Associates** has failed to provide any accommodations to facilitate communication . This is a clear violation of the **ADA** and prevents me from fully engaging in resolving the alleged debt. 

-- XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX **Legal Violations** 1. **FDCPA Violations** - **Section 809 ( b ) ** : **Zwicker & Associates** has failed to cease collection efforts after I disputed the debt. They are required by law to provide proper verification before continuing any collection attempts.

- **Section 809 ( a ) ** : As part of the **FDCPA**, debt collectors are required to send an initial written notice. **Zwicker & Associates** claims to have sent this notice, but they have failed to provide verifiable proof of receipt.

- **Section 807 ( 2 ) ( A ) ** : Their claim of having mailed the verification notice without providing evidence of delivery is misleading and violates the **FDCPA**. 

XXXX. **ADA Violations** Under the **ADA**, **Zwicker & Associates** is required to provide reasonable accommodations for my XXXX XXXX XXXX*, which they have failed to do, preventing me from understanding and responding to their communications. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXhallenge to Zwicker & Associates ' Defense** **Zwicker & Associates** has defended its actions by asserting they are merely representing XXXX XXXXXXXX and do not own the debt. This argument is legally irrelevant to their responsibilities under the **FDCPA**. Regardless of ownership, the **FDCPA** requires them to provide verification and evidence of the debt 's validity. 

- **FDCPA Responsibility Regardless of Ownership** : The **FDCPA** requires debt collectors, whether they own the debt or are acting as agents, to substantiate their claim that they are authorized to collect and to provide proper documentation proving the debt exists. This includes providing evidence similar to what would be required in court. 

-- XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  **Evidence Zwicker & Associates Must Provide** As a law firm, **Zwicker & Associates** must provide all the following evidence to validate the debt, as if they were preparing for litigation : 1. **Original Creditor Documentation** - A copy of the **original loan agreement** or **credit card agreement** with XXXX XXXX, showing the amount, terms , and signatures ( if applicable ). 
- **Statements** or other documentation showing the debt in question, such as the **transaction history**, and the last payment made. 

2. **Proof of Assignment or Authorization to Collect** - Documentation showing that **Zwicker & Associates** has been **authorized** by XXXX XXXX to collect the debt, including any **assignment agreements** or **agency agreements** that provide them the legal right to collect on the debt. If they are not the creditor, this is crucial. 

3. **Proof of Debt** - **Account statements** from XXXX XXXX or other supporting documents that clearly show the amount of the debt and that the debt belongs to me. This should include a **clear breakdown of the balance** owed, including interest, fees, and principal. 

4. **Proof of Debt Validation** - A **signed affidavit** or **certification** from someone with **personal knowledge** of the account confirming that the debt is mine, the amount is accurate, and that **Zwicker & Associates** has the right to collect. This affidavit must meet the requirements of evidence used in court.

5. **Proof of Debt Verification Mailing** - **Certified mail receipts** or **tracking numbers** proving that the **debt validation notice** was sent to my correct address. If they claim they mailed this notice, they must substantiate that claim with **evidence of receipt** or a **certificate of mailing**. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  **Requested Relief** 1. **Debt Validation** : Direct **Zwicker & Associates** to provide the required documentation proving the debt, including the original loan agreement, transaction history, and proof of their right to collect on behalf of *XXXX XXXX 

2. **Proof of Mail Delivery** : Require **Zwicker & Associates** to provide verifiable proof ( e.g., certified mail receipts or tracking numbers ) that they mailed the debt verification notice and that I received it. 
3. **Cease All Collection Efforts** : Until **Zwicker & Associates** provides valid proof of the debt and verification mailing, I request that all collection efforts cease in compliance with **FDCPA Section 809 ( b ) **.

4. **Reasonable Accommodations** : Direct **Zwicker & Associates** to provide reasonable accommodations for my *XXXX XXXX XXXX  in compliance with the **ADA**. 

5. **Investigation and Enforcement** : Investigate **Zwicker & Associates** for violations of the **FDCPA** and **ADA**, and enforce corrective actions where applicable.

-- - # # # **Conclusion** Given my history of **identity theft** and **Zwicker & Associates'** failure to provide the necessary documentation to substantiate their claim, I request immediate intervention by the **CFPB**. Their defense of merely representing XXXX XXXX does not exempt them from following the **FDCPA** or **ADA** requirements. **Zwicker & Associates** must be held accountable for their actions and ensure full compliance with consumer protection and disability rights laws. I demand that they provide all evidence that would be required in court, including the original debt documentation, proof of assignment, and verification of the debt, before continuing any collection efforts.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB Representative, I am writing to formally submit a complaint against Fifth Third Bank regarding an ATM malfunction that occurred on XXXX XXXX XXXX between XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX I attempted to deposit $ XXXXXXXX XXXX at a Fifth Third ATM located at [ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ]. Unfortunately, the ATM malfunctioned during the transaction, resulting in the loss of my funds without depositing them into my account. 

Specifically, during the deposit process, the ATM made a pop sound, instructed me to remove my card, but did not return my funds. The ATM did not print an error slip either. My friend, who was with me at the time, witnessed the incident and heard me exclaim that the ATM had eaten my money. I waited for the machine to return the funds, but it subsequently shut down and entered maintenance mode. I could hear the sound of my money being shuffled and counted by the machine before it went offline. 

When the ATM came back online, I printed a balance statement, which confirmed that my account did not reflect the deposited funds. I immediately returned to the Fifth Third branch where the ATM was located and reported the incident to the branch manager. The manager called the disputes department on my behalf, and I was issued a temporary credit onXXXX XXXX XXXX  as an investigation was initiated.

On XXXX XXXX XXXX, I noticed that the temporary credit had been reversed. When I contacted Fifth Third Bank, I was informed that the investigation had been closed, and the bank concluded that the ATM did not malfunction. I requested that they review the ATM footage, as it would clearly show me depositing the funds and the machine going into maintenance mode. However, the representative I spoke to refused to reopen the investigation and denied my request to return my funds. 

After a heated exchange, the representative reopened the case but refused to reissue the credit. That same day, I returned to the branch, where the manager contacted the disputes department once again and provided me with a case number. Despite these efforts, it has now been nearly two months, and I have not received my funds or any meaningful assistance from the bank. 

This experience has been extremely frustrating, and Fifth Third Banks lack of responsiveness and accountability has caused significant inconvenience. I am requesting your assistance in resolving this matter. I would appreciate it if you could intervene to ensure that Fifth Third Bank reviews the ATM footage, reopens the investigation in good faith, and returns the funds that were lost during the malfunction. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and resolution.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX  I refinanced my home changing my mortgage company from PennyMac LLC to XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

PennyMac LLC produced a payoff letter XXXX XX/XX/2024 ( XXXX  ). 
XXXX XXXX XXXX paid the payoff amount on XXXX XX/XX/2024 ( XXXX ). 
PennyMac LLC product a Paid-In-Full letter XXXX XX/XX/2024 ( XXXX  ). 

On XXXX XX/XX/2024 PennyMac LLC tried to deduct another payment from my personal account which was rejected by both my financial instituation. 

Starting XX/XX/2024, PennyMac LLC started sending letters to me that I still owed them money although when logged into their account in XXXX, my account shows {$0.00} balance ( XXXX  ). 

Starting XX/XX/2024, PennyMac LLC has now been sending me letters, calling, and have changed my online account to annotate that I now owe them a payment for XX/XX/2024 and XX/XX/2024 even though the loan has been paid. They are furthermore starting to send me notices that my VA eligibility will come into question due to the delinquency of my loan since it was a VA funded loan. They has been over 4 hours of phone conversations with multiple people in their company who all claim that they have no ability to help it but provide no support to connect the appropriate level of supervisor. As of XXXX XX/XX/2024, both myself and my representative from XXXX XXXX XXXX called the company on a recorded conference call which lasted over 90 minutes that 3 different representatives validated that my loan had been appropriately paid, on time, in the full amount and was fully paid off but didn't know why I was still being charged but could not provide support to fix it. Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened a new account with Chase Bank here recently, I opened a checking and savings account. I have had a checking and savings account with XXXX XXXX  for years and closed my accounts with them on XXXX XXXX XXXX to transfer to Chase bank. Whenever I closed my accounts with XXXX XXXX I transferred all of my money that was in those accounts to my Chase checking account before I closed my XXXX XXXX  accounts. I made sure that both of my accounts was at a XXXX balance before they closed and I also made sure that the full amount of the funds I had from my XXXXXXXX XXXX  both checking and savings accounts got deposited into my Chase account before I closed them. I would not have closed my account if any kind of money was not transferred over. It was a total of {$2100.00} that I had. I transferred them between bank accounts, from XXXX XXXX  to Chase Bank, I made XXXX {$1000.00} dollar transaction and XXXX {$500.00} dollar transactions. They were deposited immediately into my Chase checking and I transferred them back into my savings because thats where they came from. But after a few days I seen Chase had put XXXX {$500.00} transaction on hold. They didnt tell me why, it just said it would be available on the XXXX. It was deposited on the XXXX and was in my available balance. When I checked my account this morning it had been returned to XXXX XXXX due to insufficient funds. Even though that bank account is closed and has a {$0.00} balance, its not going to be returned. They had already received the money on the XXXX because it was in my account. Im not sure why after they received it that they would put it on hold and then try and send it back trying to say the money was never in my account because when they tried to pull it it wasnt there. I have no idea why they would try and take it out again knowing that the account it came from it closed but also, they had already received it initially on the XXXX when I made the transfer. I called and spoke to both Chase and XXXX XXXX  for several, several hours today trying to resolve this and nothing got resolved. They told me that the {$500.00} dollar transaction was an ACH transfer so it did not get processed until days later when my accounts was already closed with a XXXX balance, but when I transferred the {$2100.00} to my Chase account it showed up immediately and left my XXXX XXXX account at {$0.00} so I closed my account. My {$2100.00} dollars was in my chase account on the XXXX when I made the final transfers and closed my XXXX XXXX  accounts. Neither Chase or XXXX XXXX is saying anything about giving me my money back they are saying it was never there to begin with but the {$2100.00} is in my account currently, minus the {$500.00} that they are saying was never in there. I asked to speak with managers, and several different departments many times throughout the calls with each bank. Nobody was any help and said that I never had the money to begin with. I dealt with this for about XXXX hours today on the phone back and forth and havent gotten anything resolved. They are not understanding that my account statement literally shows where the deposits were made on the XXXX that equaled {$2100.00} but Chase does not see XXXX of the {$500.00} deposits, they only see a {$1000.00} dollar deposit and XXXX {$500.00} dollar deposit. And I continued to say that there is another {$500.00} deposit that I see on my statement that shows it was in my account and yall dont see that and now thats the transaction that is missing and I dont know what to do because I feel like I am getting screwed out of {$500.00} dollars and that isnt small change, that is a big deal and it would hurt me financially a lot and I dont understand why this has been so difficult or why neither of these banks have been any help at all in giving me back what was rightfully mine to begin with. 

I am attaching a screenshot of the transaction that Chase said they did not see. It was the transfer that said online transfer from XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX with the transaction number. They see the other XXXX transactions for {$1000.00} and {$500.00} but that specific transaction that says online transfer from XXXX XXXX is the one that they dont see and that is missing.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative: I recently was involved in a private legal settlement and deposited the checks from the settlement into my Chase bank account. The funds were deposited into my accounts but now Chase is closing my accounts and is refusing to release the funds because they were unable to verify the checks. I called them everyday for XXXX weeks to try and prevent them from closing my account and they asked me for numbers because the number associated with the checks in their system was not picking up. I provided them several different numbers, but they refused to call any of them and told me none of the numbers provided were verified. I got all the numbers from the company 's lawyer, including the number of the person who signed the checks that I deposited. No one from Chase has called these numbers despite them asking me to find them. They say they are not verified and that unless I can provide a verified number my account will be closed. As of today both my checking and savings are closed and Chase is holding on to the funds. They are calling one number that is associated with the checks in their system through the CA Secretary of State, is what I was told, but it has been nearly XXXX weeks and no one is picking up from that number. They want me to get someone to pick up from that number or get another number. I am stuck because no one at Chase is calling numbers they asked me to get for them in order to verify these checks. The other party in the lawsuit confirmed that the funds left their bank and are in my account, Chase is just not letting me access it and is not giving me a solution. To top it off Chase has been extremely rude and they keep moving the finish line. I have been calling them constantly and I have broken into tears several times. One manager told me over the phone crying was not going to help my case. On Tuesday I went into a branch, they called the other party in the lawsuits lawyer and verified the checks and I was told my accounts would be reopened. However, now my accounts are closed and they are holding on to the funds. Several times I have been told that the lawyers number worked to verify the checks and to call back the next day to check my account is re-open and when I check back in they ask me for another number because now the lawyers number doesnt work. I was also told the number for the man who signed the check would work and when I got that for them, they said it didnt actually work.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint against Self Financial , Inc. ( Self ), regarding inaccurate information reported on my consumer report. I believe these inaccuracies violate my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and potentially relevant state laws. Below are the specific issues : 1. Incorrect Account Opening Date Self Financial has inaccurately reported the opening date of my account as XX/XX/year>. This information is incorrect, and the actual account opening date is different. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), I have the right to accurate information on my consumer report, and any incorrect dates or information should be promptly corrected.

2. Reporting of Late Payments Self Financial has reported that I made late payments on my account. This is inaccurate as I have consistently made timely payments. According to the FCRA 623 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ), furnishers of information to credit reporting agencies are required to report accurate and complete information. The reporting of late payments that were never made is not only misleading but damages my credit standing. 

3. XXXX Payments on Account Despite High Balance Self Financial is reporting a high balance on my account but is simultaneously showing XXXX payments made. This is inconsistent and inaccurate. Under FCRA 623, furnishers must ensure that the information provided is correct, and reporting both a high balance and zero payments when payments were made does not comply with this requirement. This erroneous information could mislead creditors and negatively impact my creditworthiness. 

Violations of Federal and State Laws Under the FCRA, consumers have the right to dispute inaccurate information, and companies must investigate and correct any errors in a timely manner. Self Financial 's failure to accurately report my account details not only violates the FCRA but may also be in violation of state laws that protect consumers from unfair and deceptive trade practices. If applicable, I request the CFPB 's assistance in determining any state-specific consumer protection laws that might provide further recourse.

Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to formally file a complaint regarding a debt that has been incorrectly attributed to me and is being improperly reported on my credit report by J J MARSHALL ASSOCIATES. This complaint concerns a case of identity theft and the failure of J J MARSHALL ASSOCIATES to properly verify the ownership of the debt before reporting it. The key facts of the situation are as follows : The debt in question was originally held by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, which they charged off and subsequently closed. Afterward, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX sold the debt to J J MARSHALL ASSOCIATES, a debt buyer. Despite the fact that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX had charged off and closed the account, J J MARSHALL ASSOCIATES is now reporting the debt as open and active on my credit report. I requested debt validation from J J MARSHALL ASSOCIATES, and they failed to provide any sufficient proof that this debt belongs to me. It appears that J J MARSHALL ASSOCIATES simply relied on information provided by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX without conducting a proper investigation to verify my identity or my involvement with this debt. After careful review, I believe this debt has been incorrectly assigned to me due to identity theft, as I have no knowledge or record of this account. As a result, J J MARSHALL ASSOCIATES is reporting this debt on my credit report, which has caused significant damage to my credit score and has led to undue stress. I have made multiple attempts to resolve this matter directly with them, but they have not provided adequate evidence that I am the rightful owner of this debt. In light of the above, I respectfully request the following : The immediate cessation of all collection activities related to this debt by J J MARSHALL ASSOCIATES, as required under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) when a debt is disputed and identity theft is alleged. A thorough investigation into the validity of this debt, ensuring that J J MARSHALL ASSOCIATES follows the proper procedures to validate the debt before reporting it on my credit report. Assistance in correcting my credit report, ensuring that the wrongful information reported by J J MARSHALL ASSOCIATES is removed. I have attached relevant documentation, including my request for debt validation, correspondence with.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XX/XX/year> **U.S. Department of Education** Office of Federal Student Aid XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject XXXX Request for Loan Dismissal Due to Fraudulent Practices by XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXXmproper Loan Servicing by MOHELA Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally request the dismissal of my federal student loans serviced by MOHELA, which were issued in connection with my attendance at XXXX XXXX XXXX. I believe I am entitled to a loan discharge due to fraudulent and deceptive practices by XXXX XXXX XXXX, as well as improper loan processing and servicing by MOHELA. 

Background of Fraudulent Practices at XXXX XXXX XXXX : I attended XXXX XXXX XXXX during XXXX, a period in which the school engaged in widespread fraudulent practices that misled students, including myself, about program accreditatiXXXX, job placement rates, and the overall value of the education provided. The school falsely advertised its programs, failed to deliver on the promises made to students, and engaged in high-pressure recruiting tactics that targeted vulnerable individuals. 

Furthermore, there have been numerous reports and findings by federal and state agencies confirming that XXXX XXXX XXXX engaged in systemic fraud that left many students with substantial debt and no viable career prospects. As a result of these actions, I believe I am eligible for a " Borrower Defense to Repayment '' discharge. 

Issues with Loan Processing and Servicing by MOHELA : In addition to the fraudulent practices of XXXX XXXX XXXX, there were irregularities in the loan processing and servicing by MOHELA, which has compounded the financial harm caused by my enrollment at XXXX XXXX. Specifically, I believe there were discrepancies in how my loans were processed, and I have experienced difficulty in receiving accurate information and assistance from MOHELA regarding my repayment options and loan management. 

These issues have added further hardship to an already difficult situation, and I believe that these factors, combined with the fraudulent practices of the school, provide grounds for a full discharge of my loan obligations. 

Request for Loan Discharge : In light of the circumstances outlined above, I am requesting the complete dismissal of my federal student loans issued in connection with my attendance at XXXX XXXX XXXX, due to the following reasons : 1. Product: Credit card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Card was charged for something you did not purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Im filing a complaint against the Kohls Department store and their Credit Card issuer Capital One, N.A. 

On my Kohls XXXX 2024 statement a charge described as ADJUSTMENT-PURCHASES {$150.00} was added to my account. I notified Kohls-Capital One customer services that I have no record of this charge. Please provide me proof of sale that shows a purchase receipt identifying the purchase and a copy of my signature, which is required for all Kohls purchase. A letter dated XX/XX/year> was sent to me by Kohls customer service stating that they would investigate On XX/XX/year> I received a letter from Kohls customer service stating, After a review of the purchase in question, we have determined the charges were not fraudulent based on your account history and activity. Therefore, the charges will remain on your Kohls credit card account. THE REQUESTED PROOF OF SALE RECEIPT WAS NOT PROVIDED. 

In XXXX, after they put the ADJUSTMENT-PURCHASES {$150.00} back on my statement, I called Kohls customer service again explaining that they have not provided me the proof of purchase receipt. They agreed again to investigate as documented by their letter to me dated XX/XX/year>. 

On my XXXX statement they ADJUSTMENT-PURCHASE {$150.00} was put back to me without any letter describing why the charge was put back on my account and why they did not provide proof of sale purchase receipt. I CONTACTED KOHLS CUSTOMER SERVICE AGAIN ON XX/XX/year> THAT THEY CONTINUE TO NOT PROVIDE THE PROOF OF RECEIPT ON A CHARGE THAT I HAVE NO RECORD OF. They said they would take the charge off my statement and investigate further. 

Unfortunately on my XXXX statement the charge was put back on my account with no letter why they continued to put a charge on my account that I have no record of and they can not provide a proof of sale receipt showing what was purchased and my signature, now subject to 31.24 % interest. 

I have had my Kohls account for years that has made all payments promptly. To be treated in this way by Kohls is a form of elders abuse. Im a XXXX XXXX trying to get by and having to deal with a company that I felt secure with now seems to be a BULLY. PLEASE HELP.

I called the bank on the XXXX to ensure that this payment would be charged back and for them to check my payment history. Again, they told me to call XXXX XXXX. I called XXXX XXXX  and requested a charge back. They said this would take about 7-10 business days. I requested that they do not charge again. They stated they wouldnt. I called the bank and they did additional checks and balances to see if other devices had logged into the account. There was an XXXX  but she said that could have been my own XXXX  if I updated the software. We went Through the account to ensure there were no more transaction that were not dated correctly. On XXXX XXXX at XXXX I found another transaction that was dated for XXXX XXXX XXXX double transactions and I canceled it. I called NFCU fraud department and filed a complaint. She said there were no devices but my own that signed in. I explained that I changed my password for the XXXX and the Bank Login in hopes this would prevent someone from using my device to change transactions.This type of activity is in violation of 15 ISC 6923 part of rhe Graham Leach Bliley Act. Focusing on fraudulent access to financial information it includes provisions, making it illegal for individuals to access or disc Information from financial institutions under false pretenses. Additionally, the electron fund transfer act is designed to protect consumers who use electronic methods to transfer money. Banks must have clear procedures for unauthorized access to bank info and data modification.

Applied for a HE Loan. Representative was amazing and this is not about her. Provided all information required ( e-submission ). and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

XXXX XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX Trans Union LLC Consumer Dispute Center XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX RE : XXXX : XXXX To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally notify you of the unlawful reporting of fraudulent accounts on my consumer report, arising from identity theft, which you failed to verify as mandated by law.

15 USC 1681b ( c ) - Furnishing reports in connection with credit or insurance transactions not initiated by the consumer : ( 3 ) Information regarding inquiries : Except as provided in section 1681g ( a ) ( 5 ) of this title, a consumer reporting agency shall not furnish to any person a record of inquiries in connection with a credit or insurance transaction that is not initiated by a consumer. 
The following inquiries, which are a result of identity theft and were not initiated by me, must be deleted immediately : Inquiry : Company Name, Date of Inquiry My identity has been stolen, and I am placing you on formal notice. 
Aggravated Identity Theft pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 1028A : ( 1 ) In general : Whoever, during and in relation to any felony violation enumerated in subsection ( c ), knowingly transfers, possesses, or uses, without lawful authority, a means of identification of another person shall, in addition to the punishment provided for such felony, be sentenced to a term of imprisonment of 2 years. 
15 USC 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports : ( a ) IN GENERAL : Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report only under the following circumstances : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

15 USC 1681- Fair Credit Reporting Act : ( a ) Accuracy and fairness of credit reports : ( 4 ) There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. 
List of Fraudulent Accounts XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1681c2 - Block of information resulting from identity theft : A consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information resulting from alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt by such agency of : ( 1 ) Appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer ; ( 2 ) A copy of an identity theft report ; ( 3 ) The identification of such information by the consumer ; and ( 4 ) A statement by the consumer that the information is not related to any transaction by the consumer. 
Enclosed are all relevant documents pursuant to the above section of the law. I demand that all the aforementioned fraudulent accounts be deleted immediately. Additionally, I demand an updated copy of my consumer file reflecting these changes, as stated by 15 USC 1681c-1 ( 2 ) - Access to free reports.

15 USC 1681c-1 ( 2 ) - Access to free reports : In any case in which a consumer reporting agency includes a fraud alert in the file of a consumer pursuant to this subsection, the consumer reporting agency shall : ( A ) Disclose to the consumer that they may request a free copy of their file pursuant to section 1681j ( d ) of this title. 
Be advised that I will CC : The Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection ( CFPB ) The Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX The Attorney General 's Office in your state and mine Thank you, XXXX XXXX Enclosures : Copy of ID Utility bill showing proof of address Copy of Social Security Card FTC Identity Theft Report

Consumer complaint narrative: I went to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX in XXXX of XXXX to have a XXXX done. After assessing my XXXX, the XXXX told me that I would have to have my XXXX XXXX XXXX in full XXXX due to my XXXX relation. I later found out that this is a tactic he uses often to inflate medical pricing and gouge customers and insurance. However, I was not aware of that at the time. We began the process which included a lot of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX that he said was necessary. He placed a XXXX XXXX. During that time, he submitted information to my insurance in an attempt to get insurance to pay for the extensive treatment he said I needed. I was not made aware by his office but my insurance refused to pay for it. I had also made payments towards the upcoming procedures. In XXXX of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX told me that I had too extensive of a XXXX XXXX for the treatment plan to work and he placed another XXXX XXXX that would hold up longer according to him. I was also told that I had about {$1800.00} on my account because I had over paid so I opted to use part of that for XXXX XXXX. His office offered to reimburse me for the cost of the XXXX XXXX because he was not able to render the services he had previously said he would do. I told them that wasnt necessary. I was not aware that they had charged me for individual XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  and XXXX XXXX XXXX  and charged for repetitive and unnecessary XXXX throughout the process. I have not been back to his office since XXXX of XXXX and at that one I was told I still had a credit on my account of about {$600.00} because I had over paid and they would be mailing me a check. The last payment I made which was over what was owed was in XXXX of XXXX. In XXXX of XXXX, they filed claims with my new insurance carrier for procedures they had not done and I had not been to their office in six months. XXXX of XXXX they also filed more claims with my insurance company that they did not provide services for. I spoke with his office in XXXX of XXXX because I received a statement that showed a large balance and I didnt understand how I had gone from having a credit the last time I was in their office in XXXX to owing {$1400.00}. They acted as if they never told me that I had a credit or was paid in full and had excess funds which led me to using those funds to get the whitening done in XXXX. They continued to bill me and then sent the balance to a collection agency, TekCollect XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX. XXXX has reported it on my credit and changed the date of the debt to XX/XX/XXXX, re-aging the debt. I do not owe this but even if I did the statute of limitations for them to collect in the state of Oklahoma is three years on a verbal contract, which we did not have because I didnt agree to services they say they rendered and the did not and the last payment I have made to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX and the last time I was in their office was XXXX of XXXX. So, even if we had a written contract ( we do not ) they are past the statute of limitations because its five years in Oklahoma. I filed a dispute with XXXX regarding this debt that I never incurred. XXXX says they investigated but they didnt change the status of the account, Tek Collect sent me another statement from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX which shows in detail that they charged for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and that they also charged my new insurance 6 and 8 months after I had last been in their office and over a year from the XXXX XXXX that I did not receive. The XXXX XXXX committing fraud against a consumer but also insurance fraud and violating the fsir credit reporting act which is a federal law. TekCollect is also in violation of the fair credit reporting act by trying to re-age the bogus debt and use the date of XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX is in violation of the fair credit reporting act by not investigating appropriately and making sure that the debts they report are valid and not misleading with fraudulent information and dates.

I am not held responsible for this account they are not doing their job be advised this is not refusal to pay but a notice of pursuant to the fair debt collection practices fcra 15usc 1692g But this is the request of validation that I open this account I respectfully ask your company to send me proof that I have any legal obligation to pay you for account. I did not open I keep disputing this because my sister XXXX open this account phone number email banks account payments were all made by her using other peoples money. I am so sick and tired of having to dispute this. At this time. I will also inform you. If your office report invalid information to any XXXX credit bureaus XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX this action may constitute fraud under both federal and state law due to these facts if any negative marks is found on any of my credit reports by your company after submitting all proof that I did not open this account, I will not hesitate to bring legal action for legal action by the fair credit act violation if your office can prove that I open this account within 30 days and if you fail to provide proof, this account needs to be deleted from all three credit bureaus I have sent numerous proof of me not opening this account I am not held responsible to make payments on something I did not open or gave permission. To my sister to open this account has a balance of {$2000.00} with the over limit that I keep telling you guys I did not open and you guys want me to make payments on an account I did not open

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: My mortgage servicer is XXXX XXXX. The previous servicer was Mr. Cooper, which is still the point of contact for the servicing of my mortgage. I set up auto-pay with XXXX XXXX to send my mortgage payments to XXXX. The payment due on XX/XX/year>2024 went through but the payment due on XX/XX/year>2024 didn't. Mr. Cooper claimed in XX/XX/year> that it did receive my mortgage payment that should have been delivered by XX/XX/year>2024. To avoid late payment, on XX/XX/year>2024, I authorized a mortgage payment on Mr. Cooper 's website, requesting XXXX XXXX  to pay the mortgage amount and placed a Stop Order on the mortgage payment that was supposed to be delivered by XXXX2024. I also cancelled the monthly auto-pay to Mr Cooper on XXXX XXXX XXXX website. However, the monthly auto-pay I cancelled on XXXX XXXX XXXX website shows a payment activity but the payment was cancelled at the same time on XX/XX/year>2024. On XXXX XXXX XXXX record, it indicates there was a mortgage payment, a reversal payment of that amount and an Insufficient Funds fee for {$15.00} on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. There should not be a charge of {$15.00} for Insufficient fund because 1 ) i cancelled such auto payment to begin with and 2 ) I actually had sufficient funds in the account as I left enough money purposefully in the account for the next mortgage payment. XXXX XXXX  erroneously charged me a fee of {$15.00} for Insufficient fund, which was not justified. Thank you.
