Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I signed up for Business Checking account promotion for {$400.00}. 


As of XXXX, terms are still available at this link - firsthorizon.comXXXX XXXX The requirements for the promotion were as follows, Requirement1. Deposit {$5000.00} into the XXXX  XXXX  Checking account within 15 days of the account opening. 
XXXX  : Opened account. 
XXXX  : $ XXXX deposited to the account. 


Requirement2. Maintain at least a {$5000.00} collected daily balance for the first 3 full statement cycles. 
XXXX  : Maintained more than $ XXXX up until now. 

Requirement3. Conduct 20 qualifying transactions within the first 3 full statement cycles. 
XXXX : I made 22 debit card transactions within a month of opening the account. 


As per the banker, the first two requirements were met successfully and they are claiming that third requirement was not met. 


I made a total of 22 debit card transactions within a month of opening the account. 9 transactions in the 1st statement cycle and 13 transactions in 2nd statement cycle. 
They are claiming that the first statement cycle is not considered and only 2nd, 3rd and 4th statement cycle are considered for bonus eligibility evaluation. 


I read the terms in detail and there is no mention of what defines a " Full statement cycle ''. Since I made the transactions within the first 3 statements, I should be eligible for the bonus and have been wrongly categorized as not eligible.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
CFPB Dispute Submission : Unauthorized Account Reporting Complainant Information : Name : XXXX XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, AZ XXXX Email : XXXX Phone : ( XXXX ) XXXX Disputed Account Information : Account Number : XXXX Credit Card Issuer : JPMCB Card Credit Bureaus Involved : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX Type of Account : Revolving Credit ( Credit Card ) Account Status : Closed Nature of Dispute and Request for Removal : Account Ownership : I have never opened or authorized the creation of this account, nor am I aware of its existence. This account has been erroneously attributed to me. 
Request : Immediate removal of this account from my credit report due to it being unauthorized and inaccurate.

Credit Bureau Code : Authorized User : I have never been an authorized user on this account. Any reference to me being associated as such is false.

Request : Remove this account from my credit report as I am not affiliated with it. 
Account Status : Closed : The account is reported as closed, yet I have no knowledge or ownership of this account, making this information irrelevant and inaccurate. 
Request : Remove this erroneous account from my credit file immediately. 
High Credit and Balance Discrepancies : XXXX reports a high credit of {$2000.00}, while XXXX reports {$800.00}. Both of these amounts are unrecognized and do not pertain to me. 
Request : Remove this account due to inaccurate reporting of balances and unauthorized account ownership. 
Credit Limit Discrepancies : XXXX lists a credit limit of {$800.00}, while XXXX lists {$0.00}. I have no connection to this account, and both figures are inaccurate. 
Request : Remove this account from my credit report. 
Date of Last Payment Discrepancies : XXXX reports a last payment date of XX/XX/XXXX, while XXXX reports XX/XX/XXXX. Since I have never made any payments on this account, these dates are false. 
Request : Remove this account due to inaccuracies in payment reporting. 
Payment Status : Late 120 Days : The account is incorrectly reported as being late for 120 days. I am not responsible for any payments on this account as it is not mine.

Request : Immediate removal of this account from my credit report due to this inaccurate payment status. 
Inconsistencies in Payment History : The payment history across reporting agencies contains discrepancies, further proving that this account is inaccurately associated with me. 
Request : Remove this account from my credit report due to inconsistent and inaccurate payment history. 
Legal Grounds for Dispute : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 : Credit reporting agencies are required by law to ensure that the information reported is accurate. Reporting an account that does not belong to me is a direct violation of the FCRA. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX Cir. XXXX ) : This case established that credit reporting agencies must conduct a reasonable investigation when a consumer disputes the accuracy of information. As the information provided by this account is inaccurate, I request immediate removal. 

I kindly request that this unauthorized and inaccurate account be removed from my credit report as soon as possible. Please confirm the results of your investigation and provide me with documentation of the removal. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Debt collection
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Equifax is reporting old, outdated, and incorrect information on my report and I have reached out multiple times in the last year about all of these with no luck. My next steps will be a lawsuit on Equifax. All incorrect information is below. 

My name should appear as XXXX XXXX XXXX only. Other two names need to be removed Address for XXXX XXXX is incorrect and I never lived there. Needs to be removed XXXX XXXX Bank account - paid in collection as pay to delete. needs removed XXXX XXXX XXXX are incorrect and paid to delete through XXXX XXXX XXXX and they said they were not reporting any longer. Account needs removed XXXX XXXX - account is almost 7 years old and they are reporting the comments and information inaccurately. Asking to remove XXXX XXXX - status should be reported as paid XXXX XXXX account - this account was paid to delete and should be removed XXXX accounts- 11 accounts were discharged and forgiven as part of a lawsuit and should be removed immediately from my report XXXX XXXX 3 accounts were also part of the lawsuit and should be removed immediately. 
XXXX XXXX account- is incorrect balance should not read {$910.00} XXXX- this account is connected with XXXX and was paid to delete. needs to be removed XXXX bank - XXXX bought by XXXX funding and I am paying this, but should not be reporting twice since it was bought by XXXX. Please delete XXXX - paid to delete in collections. Take off report XXXX XXXX XXXX - account is way too old over 9 years, delete from report XXXX - paid to delete take off report All other credit bureaus have either followed suit for most of these and have accurate information or I am in the works of updating the accounts with them.

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
Upon information and belief on or about the dates of XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX approximately XXXX fraudulent student loans were taken out in my name and disbursements were made to XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  in XXXX XXXX West Virginia. In as much as these loans have been in my name for an extended period of time, I was never aware that these loans were actually fraudulent and the recipient was XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX There is a substantial amount of money due on these loans and I have never attended, taken classes or been a student at XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. Upon reaching out to XXXX XXXX XXXX  I was denied contact with anyone in the records department and they refused to provide me with any information in regard to these fraudulent loans. That being said, I later received an email from XXXX advising me that I needed to provide them with a plethora of information and personal records, to verify these loans were not mine. I am wondering if this university obtain these same records when these loans were taken out in my name by the person that utilized these loans distributions. XXXX has refused to give me any student account numbers, records or any other documentation in regard to these loans. Upon being made aware to two other fraudulent loans to another institution the representative made me aware of these loans to XXXX that is when I reached out to the. I have been advised by a number of staff members that I am not allowed to speak with anyone by phone but that I need to speak email all documents that they have requested to the email from which it came. I am not giving these people my birth certificate, drivers license, high school diploma or any other documents. I have no idea if these documents will be used for nefarious purposes or if they will then say that they have my records on file and these are my student loans. I have never sent this institution any records at any point prior to them asking for them now because I have never attended or taken classes through them and definitely over a five year span. Thes loans are over a span of 5 years. There are no records to show and I have no academic records there and no benefit of these fraudulent loans ever. I have listed out the loan amount but original and current, and the dates that the loans were obtained. I have no loan numbers or student information to provide other than what I was given from AidAdvantage when I reached out to them. I have contacted the United States Department of Education on a number of occasions and they have also refused to give me any information I was advised that I need to contact the servicer of the loans and or access my student loan account in the system. I have advised them on a number of occasions that I am not able to access my federal student loan account because I do not remember my password and to reset it goes to an old phone number for which I no longer have and no longer have access to. The representative from the United States Department of Education that I spoke with last time could not help and told me I needed to contact the United States Department of Education. Upon questioning her as to was she with this department she advised she was but she could not help me to call back the same number I called and speak with another representative however she was not sure that they could help me either. It is very infuriating that employees for any and all businesses are not properly trained and take XXXX pride in their jobs anymore. What I know is if I did my job like 90 % of the people I deal with on a daily basis my employer would fire me. The bottom line is these are not my loans, I did not use these loans, I did not benefit from these loans and I took not classes through APU and I have never been a student there. All I have been told is that this is not an uncommon occurrence and it is up to the person whose name the fraudulent loans have been taken out in their name to get these records straight and not up to the servicer to verify they are valid in fact they have advised me that they are on the grantor of the loan and they are responsible for collecting the loans if it goes into default. Thats it and they can not help with any additional correction of the fraud and they will not assist in getting them corrected. Its a same that it takes days and months out of XXXX persons life to get straight identity theft and fraud. The information on the loans is as follows. 
XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX loan in the amount of {$6000.00} now {$12000.00} XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX loan in the amount of {$3500.00} now {$5900.00} XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX loan in the amount of {$4500.00} now {$6500.00} XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX loan in the amount of {$6000.00} now {$6000.00} XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX loan in the amount of {$1700.00} now {$2500.00} XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX loan in the amount of {$1600.00} now {$2900.00} XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX loan in the amount of {$1500.00} now {$2600.00} XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX loan in the amount of {$1700.00} now {$2200.00} These loans now total approximately {$41000.00} and are now if forbearance because they were reported as in default and my credit score has decrease XXXX by these inaccurate credit bureau reportings. I am in the process of filing a police report for identity theft and fraud, and have reached out to a consumer law firm. They are willing to take my case and have these loans deleted from my records and name, and take these creditors to federal court if I can not rectify this situation myself. I filed a XXXX XXXX in XXXX and it was XXXX in XXXX. I also reopened the XXXX  XXXX in XXXX and it was dismissed as a not asset distribution in XX/XX/XXXX. Had I known at the time of filing or reopening the XXXX XXXX that these loans were fraudulent I would have filed a motion to have the judge order these loans be refunded and returned to the Department of Education. I have obtained a court date for the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX on XX/XX/XXXX @ XXXX XXXX. to file a motion to reopen the cause once again and at that time will file a motion for sanction and a motion to rule for show cause and now that I have determined that these loans are fraud also include that in the motions. These fraudulent loans need to removed from my name, deleted from by credit reports and funds returned back to United States Department of Education. I am not accepting responsibility for these loans and I am not oppose to taking this matter to court in it means retaining an attorney and having it filed in the circuit court as well as all other courts. My goal in this matter is to have the fraudulent loans addressed, refunded and returned to the United States Department of Education, and removed and deleted from my name. I will not pay these loans.

Sub-issue: Loan sold or transferred to another company
Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX XXXX XXXX informed me that my mortgage was being transferred effective XX/XX/year>, and they could not accept any more payments after that date. I made my XXXX payment to XXXX prior to that date, it was received and processed by XXXX which left my account paid up to date. My next payment should have been due in XXXX. I contacted XXXX several times asking how and where to make my upcoming payments. They advised me that the new mortgage company would contact me with that information, that it was common for delays during mortgage transfers, and that I would have an extended grace period because of that. On XX/XX/year> I received the first communication from Shellpoint Mortgage. It was a packet containing a regulatory notice, claiming that I was behind on my payments by {$2500.00}. My monthly payment is {$1200.00}. So I have no idea where they came up with that number. It contained intimidating verbiage about foreclosure and Shellpoints rights to foreclose. It contained no information about how to make a payment, and no confirmation of the terms of the loan, which they can not legally change anyways. I believe they are intentionally trying to create a late payment status by manipulating my ability to make a timely payment on my mortgage account. The fact that I didnt receive any type of communication from Shellpoint until 18 days after my payment is normally due, and I still dont know how to make a payment because they have not provided that information, is what I believe to be mortgage servicing abuse. Now XXXX has closed my account so XXXX cant even ask them for assistance.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am submitting this new complaint regarding an unresolved issue with PayPals handling of a {$7100.00} payment I made on XX/XX/year>, toward my PayPal XXXX Mastercard balance. This issue was previously addressed in my original complaint, CFPB Case Number XXXX, but has yet to be fully resolved Subject : Rebuttal to PayPals Response and Request for Clarification on Payment Discrepancy and Bank Response XXXX CFPB Case Number : XXXX Dear CFPB, I am submitting this rebuttal in response to PayPals explanation regarding the {$7100.00} payment I made on XX/XX/year>, and its subsequent return. I believe PayPals response does not fully address the discrepancies in the payment process, nor does it explain the issues I encountered with both PayPal and my bank. Below are several key points that need further clarification and documentation. 

Discrepancy in Payment Records : On XX/XX/year>, I made a payment of {$7100.00}, which my PayPal credit card statement shows as accepted. However, PayPal later claimed that the payment was returned, but there is no such return reflected anywhere on my credit card statement. Instead, the statement includes an Adjustment-Payments entry, which is not clearly labeled as an ACH return or payment reversal. I am requesting clarification from PayPal on what this adjustment specifically refers to and why there is no clear record of the payment return. 

Payment Should Have Been Processed on XX/XX/XXXX : It is important to note that I had sufficient funds ( {$10000.00} ) in my bank account at the time of the payment on XX/XX/year>. Under normal circumstances, the payment of {$7100.00} should have been processed successfully on that date. The fact that this payment was not processed, despite having enough funds, suggests that an error occurred either on PayPals end or with my bank.

Given that my PayPal statement initially showed the payment as completed, and there was no clear reversal or adjustment labeled as an XXXX return, I am requesting further clarification on why the payment was not processed correctly. 

Available Funds and Banks Role : At the time of the payment, I had {$10000.00} in my bank account, more than sufficient to cover the payment. Despite this, my bank has indicated that they did not send the funds to PayPal, citing insufficient funds as the reason. However, my transaction history with the bank shows the payment as completed, creating a significant discrepancy between what my records show and what the bank claims. 

In a conversation with my banks representative, they could not provide the specific time when the payment was processed, claiming it was never sent. Yet, the payment is marked as completed on my account, which further adds to the confusion. 

The bank also mentioned that several smaller payments were made to PayPal around the same time, but this does not explain why the {$7100.00} payment wasnt processed, especially since sufficient funds were available.

Notification of Returned Payment : PayPal claims that I was notified of the returned payment on XX/XX/year>, and that my financial institution also notified me. However, I did not receive clear notification from PayPal, and the explanation from my bank has been inconsistent. I ask that PayPal provide evidence of this notification and any communication sent to me regarding the returned payment. Additionally, I would like further clarification on how they claim my bank notified me. 

Inaccurate Venmo Credit Card Banner : PayPal admits that I received a notice regarding the returned payment with a Venmo Credit Card banner, even though I do not have a Venmo credit card. While they state this was an error, it contributed to the overall confusion regarding my account and the returned payment. I ask that PayPal ensure no future errors like this occur and clarify why this mistake happened.

Fees and Payment History : PayPal mentioned a payment of {$100.00} made on XX/XX/year>, which was below the minimum required payment, resulting in fees. Given the larger payment I made later that month ( which was allegedly returned ), I request that PayPal review these fees and whether they were applied fairly given the subsequent payment.

Lack of Address Update : PayPal claims that I did not update my mailing address during calls on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/year>. However, I made efforts to update my contact information during these conversations and in past several calls over the years since moving to my new location in XXXX. This may have contributed to delays in communication, and I request that PayPal confirm that all account information is fully updated.

Banks Role and Lack of ACH Documentation : My bank has indicated that the payment was never sent, despite PayPals claim that it was returned. This discrepancy remains unresolved, and I ask that PayPal provide detailed evidence of the XXXX return process, including communications with my bank, to clarify why the payment did not go through. 

I have repeatedly requested a detailed explanation from my bank regarding why the funds were not sent, yet they have not provided this information. I will be filing a separate complaint with the CFPB regarding my banks failure to provide the requested information. 

Request for Documentation : I am requesting that PayPal provide documentation and proof of the following : 1. The exact date and time they claim to have received the {$7100.00} payment.

2. The date and reason for the return of the funds, along with any records from my bank indicating why the payment was returned.

Request for Further Review : I respectfully request that PayPal be required to provide more detailed documentation on : The exact reason for the returned payment.

Clear documentation showing why the funds were not processed.

Proper communication between PayPal and my bank.

How can PayPal claim I paid in full and report this to two credit agencies if the funds were never sent?

How can PayPal return funds that were never sent?

Attachments : I have attached the following documents for further evidence : 1. Conversation with my bank : Documenting my efforts to clarify why the funds were not sent.

2. Tracking information : Proof of my formal letter to the bank requesting a detailed explanation of the returned funds.

3. Monthly statement : Showing the unclear Adjustment-Payments entry instead of a clear ACH return or reversal.

The failure to process this payment and the subsequent return is either an error on PayPals part or my banks. I request further investigation into why this payment failed, despite having more than sufficient funds in my account at the time.

Request for Resolution : I am seeking assistance in obtaining a clear and accurate resolution to this issue. PayPals inconsistent handling of the payment, along with my banks lack of response, has caused significant confusion and financial stress. I would like this matter to be resolved with transparency from both parties.

Attached are my credit card statements showing the payment as accepted, a transcript of my conversation with my bank, and letter tracking number screenshots of my request for information from my bank. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to further clarification and resolution.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
COMPLAINT Plaintiff, XXXX XXXX XXXX, by and through the undersigned attorney, hereby files this Complaint against Defendant Bank of America, and alleges as follows : JURISDICTION AND VENUE This action arises under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), 15 U.S.C. 1601 et seq., and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq..

This Court has jurisdiction pursuant to 28 U.S.C. 1331.

Venue is proper in this judicial district pursuant to 28 U.S.C. 1391 ( b ), as the Defendant conducts business in this district and a substantial part of the events giving rise to the claims occurred within this district. 
PARTIES Plaintiff : XXXX XXXX XXXX, a consumer residing at XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, NM XXXX, born XX/XX/XXXX. 
Defendant : Bank of America is a financial institution providing consumer credit and loans located at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX On or about XX/XX/XXXX, Plaintiff entered into a credit transaction with Defendant for the purpose of obtaining financing for [ purpose of loan, e.g., secured credit card or mortgage ]. The loan was governed by 15 U.S.C. 1635 ( TILA ).

Defendant failed to provide Plaintiff with the required disclosures under TILA, including information about Plaintiffs right to rescind the transaction. 
On or about XX/XX/XXXX, Plaintiff sent written notice to Defendant, seeking to rescind the transaction pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1635 ( a ).

Despite receiving timely notice of rescission, Defendant refused to honor the rescission, in violation of TILA.

As a result of Defendants failure to comply, Plaintiff is entitled to rescind the transaction and seeks declaratory relief and damages for Defendants non-compliance with TILA.

INACCURATE REPORTING Defendant inaccurately reported Plaintiffs payment history to credit reporting agencies, including [ specific reporting agencies, e.g., XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ], reflecting charge-offs and delinquencies that did not accurately represent Plaintiffs payment history. 
Plaintiff disputed the inaccurate reporting with the credit reporting agencies, and despite these disputes, Defendant failed to correct the inaccuracies, in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681.

As a result of Defendants inaccurate reporting, Plaintiff has suffered harm, including damage to her credit score, financial loss, and emotional distress.

CLAIMS FOR RELIEF COUNT 1 : VIOLATION OF THE TRUTH IN LENDING ACT ( TILA ), 15 U.S.C. 1635 Plaintiff realleges and incorporates by reference the preceding paragraphs.

Defendant failed to provide the required disclosures under TILA, specifically regarding Plaintiffs right to rescind the transaction.

Plaintiff exercised the right to rescind by sending written notice within the statutory time period.

Defendants refusal to honor the rescission constitutes a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1635.

Plaintiff seeks rescission of the loan and return of all payments made, along with statutory damages, attorneys fees, and costs.

COUNT 2 : VIOLATION OF THE FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 Plaintiff realleges and incorporates by reference the preceding paragraphs. 
Defendant reported inaccurate payment information to credit reporting agencies, causing harm to Plaintiffs credit score and financial standing.

Despite Plaintiffs dispute of these inaccuracies, Defendant failed to conduct a reasonable investigation or correct the reported information, in violation of FCRA, specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i.

Plaintiff seeks damages for harm caused by the inaccurate reporting, including compensation for emotional distress, lost opportunities, and attorneys fees.

PRAYER FOR RELIEF WHEREFORE, Plaintiff prays for judgment against Defendant as follows : Rescission of the credit transaction under 15 U.S.C. 1635 ; Statutory damages and costs under TILA and FCRA ; An order requiring Defendant to correct the inaccurate information reported to credit reporting agencies ; Compensation for Plaintiffs emotional distress and financial damages ; Attorneys fees and costs ; Any other relief the Court deems just and proper.

The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) provides for actual damages, statutory damages for willful or intentional conduct that violates the FCRA, and punitive damages for malicious conduct harming a consumers credit or reputation for creditworthiness.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint againstXX/XX/XXXXXX/XX/XXXX account number begging with XXXX opened under my name on XX/XX/year>. I believe XX/XX/XXXX has violated the truth in the lending act, codified in 15 USC 1601, by failing to provide accurate and transparent disclosures related to the loan terms and payments.

specifically, I have identified the following issues : 1.failure to disclose proper terms : the loan documentation provided to me did not clearly explain the interest rat, finance charges, or repayment terms in a manner that was understandable and compliant with the required disclosures under 15 USC 1601.

2.unclear finance charges : the amounts charged in connection with my loan appear to have been inflated, and I was not provided clear, itemized statements of the finance charges as required under the truth in Lending Act.

3.erroneous billing and statements : I have received statements with incorrect amounts, andXX/XX/XXXX has failed to rectify the despite multiple attempts to resolve the issue. The past due amounts listed are not consistent with what was initially agreed upon. 

in light of these violations, I am requesting a full investigation into the handling of my auto loan and that the CFBP ensures that XX/XX/XXXX complies with 15 USC 1601 and corrects these issues. Additionally, I am requesting that any incorrect information reported to the credit bureaus in relation to this account be removed immediately.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Last XXXX SSN : XXXX TODAYS DATE : XX/XX/XXXX Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX NOTICE OF PENDING LITIGATION SEEKING RELIEF AND MONETARY COMPENSATION UNDER FCRA

15 U.S. Code 1681n Civil liability for willful noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1681o Civil liability for negligent noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1692k civil liability. Please accept this final written OFFER OF SETTLEMEN
T BEFORE LITIGATION as my attempt to amicably resolve your continued violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act regarding your refusal to delete INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated information from my consumer file. I intend to pursue litigation in accordance with the FCRA to seek relief and recover all monetary damages that I may be entitled to under Section 616 and Section 617 if the INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated items listed below are not deleted immediately. A copy of this letter as well as INACCURATE ERRONEOUS ITEMS sent to you previously will also become part of a formal complaint to the Federal Trade Commission and shall be used as evidence in pending litigation provided you fail to comply with this offer of settlement. 
YOU ARE IN DIRECT VIOLATION OF THE FCRA, the unverified items listed below still remain on my credit report in violation of Federal Law. You are required under the FCRA to have a copy of the original creditors documentation on file to verify that this information is mine and is correct. In the results of your investigations, you stated in writing that you verified that these items are being reported correctly Who verified these accounts? You have NOT provided me a copy of ANY original documentation ( a consumer contract with my signature on it ) as required under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Furthermore, you have failed to provide the method of verification as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 7 ). Please be advised that under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to ... promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified. 
Its very obvious that your agency doesnt know what the FCRA is, because from the looks of my credit report and all the errors I see, heres my breakdown : 1.The Fair Credit Reporting Act is the primary federal law that governs the collection and reporting of credit information about consumers. Its rules cover how a consumer 's credit information is obtained, how long it is kept, and how it is shared with othersincluding consumers themselves. 
XXXX. What is a FCRA violation? 
Creditors give reporting agencies inaccurate financial information about you. Reporting agencies mixing up XXXX person 's information with another 's because of similar ( or same ) last name or social security number. Agencies fail to follow guidelines for handling disputes. 
XXXX. My rights under the fair credit reporting act : Verify the accuracy of my report when it is required for employment purposes. 
Receive notification if information in my file has been used against me in applying for credit or other transactions. 
Disputeand have the bureaus correct and deleteinformation in my report that is incomplete, inaccurate, and unverifiable.

Remove outdated, negative information ( after seven years in most cases, 10 in the case of bankruptcy ). 
I demand these items be deleted immediately. I entered the items and the outcome I desire below because you are in violation and these items are not 100 % accurate. 
They are either INACCURATE, Unverifiable and Invalidated. I recently applied for extended credit and was denied I am in distress because of your mistakes. 
The law is very clear as to the Civil liability and the remedy available to me ( Section 616 & 617 ) if you fail to comply with Federal Law. I am a litigious consumer and fully intend on pursuing litigation in this matter to enforce my rights under the FCRA. 
1. Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) this account in violation not reporting 100 % accurate. 

XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Your improper procedures are highly damaging to my credit score. Please immediately DELETE VIOLATION OF 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance ( a ) In general Any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00} ; or ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ; ( 2 ) such amount of punitive damages as the court may allow ; and ( 3 ) in the case of any successful action to enforce any liability under this section, the costs of the action together with reasonable attorneys fees as determined by the court. 
( b ) Civil liability for knowing noncompliance Any person who obtains a consumer report from a consumer reporting agency under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose shall be liable to the consumer reporting agency for actual damages sustained by the consumer reporting agency or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater. 
* Please remove all non-account holding inquiries Please note that you have 30 days to complete this investigation, as per the Fair Credit Reporting Act Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested as well, to be provided within ( 5 ) days of the completion of your re-investigation and I am keeping a careful record of your actions, including your Method of Verification. I do not consent to e-Oscar or any means of automated verification. 
Failure to respond satisfactorily within 30 days of receipt of this certified letter may result in a small claims action against your company, seeking {$5000.00} per violation for : 1. ) Defamation 2. ) Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3. ) Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act 4. ) Financial Injury P.S. Please be aware that dependent upon your response, I may be detailing any potential issues with your company via an online public press release, including documentation of any potential small claims action. I am also including a copy of my complaint to the organizations below : CC : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX Assistant Director of Enforcement Consumer Financial Protection XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau CC : Attorney Generals Office CC : XXXX XXXX XXXX CC : State Senate CC : Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation CC : Comptroller Of The Currency CC : Federal Reserve System CC : Credit and insurance CC : Federal Trade Commission CC : State Regulatory agency CC : California Regulatory agency Division of consumer complaints Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against Equifax for their failure to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) in relation to the removal of inaccurate personal information from my credit report, as well as their failure to respond within the legally mandated 30-day timeframe. 

Details of the Complaint : Dispute of Inaccurate Personal Information : On XX/XX/year>, I submitted a formal dispute to Equifax ( Dispute ID : XXXX ), clearly stating that my one and only legal name is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and my correct address is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX. Additionally, I confirmed my correct phone number as XXXX. 

Despite this, Equifax continues to report numerous incorrect names, addresses, and phone numbers on my credit report, including : Inaccurate Names : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and others. 
Inaccurate Addresses : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and several more incorrect addresses that I have never lived at.

This failure to correct the errors violates FCRA 607 ( b ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ), which requires credit reporting agencies to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy in consumer reports. 

Failure to Respond within 30 Days : It has been over 30 days since Equifax received my dispute, and I have yet to receive any formal response or resolution. Under FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), credit reporting agencies are required to respond to disputes within 30 days, and this failure constitutes a clear violation of the law.

Resolution Sought : I request that the CFPB take the following actions to ensure Equifax complies with the FCRA : Immediately delete all inaccurate personal information from my credit report, including all incorrect names, addresses, and phone numbers that are not my own.

Ensure that Equifax provides an updated and accurate credit report reflecting these corrections.

Investigate Equifaxs failure to respond within the 30-day period as mandated by law, and take appropriate enforcement action for this violation. 
Enclosed are copies of my original dispute letter sent to Equifax and proof of receipt, as well as my credit report showing the inaccurate personal information still being reported. 

I trust the CFPB will take prompt action to resolve this matter and ensure Equifax 's compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX BALANCE {$16000.00} XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX BALANCE {$18.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX BALANCE {$0.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX BALANCE {$41000.00} RE : Late Payment Improperly Reported- I XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX have a RIGHT TO PRIVACY under 15 USC 1681A ( 4 ) as a federally protected consumer and I know my rights presented under the Fair Credit Reporting Act clearly outlined within 15 USC 1681. The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. So, whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft. This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n and 15 USC 1681o, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent. I was reviewing my consumer reports and noticed XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on my credit report that need be immediately updated to paid as agreed. My Consumer rights have been violated by XXXX, XXXX, Equifax. XXXX, XXXX, Equifax, has violated my consumer rights and violated federal law. This is now multiple attempts to notify you of this erroneous error on the part of your agency. This erroneous late payment is affecting my ability to obtain a loan to save my business from crumbling and also blocking me from the housing that I so desperately need for myself and my family. Please change this to paid as agreed immediately so that I may proceed with my life, or I may be forced to seek legal damages against your agency as I already have sought legal counsel in this more than important matter. Thank you.

Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Request for Validation of Debt - XXXX XXXXXXXX I am writing in response to an alleged debt associated with account number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX I am requesting validation of this debt as per my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 USC 1692g. I dispute the validity of this debt and am immediately requesting that you provide the following information : 1. The original contract binding me to this so-called debt. 2. The PAYMENT HISTORY with the original creditor and balance. 3. Copy of PROOF OF DEBT ASSIGNMENT. 4. Proof that I legally owe this debt to YOUR agency. 5. Proof that you are licensed and able to collect on this debt in my state. 6. The original PURCHASE AGREEMENT. A. THIS IS NOT ANY DEBT THAT I ORIGINATED MYSELF. I HAVE NO IDEA WHERE THIS DEBT ORIGINATED FROM. This inaccurate information needs to be re-investigated immediately by both the Credit reporting agencies and the furnishers of this information that is appearing on my consumer report. NOTE : As you can see within the screenshots that I have attached, Equifax removed this account 45 days ago. Please complete this file. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681e ( b ), A credit reporting agency must maintain accurate records at all times within the files of consumers. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681i, please perform an internal re-investigation on the validity of this account in question that is showing up on your consumer report under my name and notify me of your results within 30 days of your receipt of this letter and update my credit report accordingly to your findings. If you are unable to provide proof of my requests, then the erroneous information MUST be DELETED within 30 days of your receipt of this letter from my credit report as this erroneous account is very misleading and not mine. This account is causing me great mental anguish and I am unable to obtain a mortgage at this present time due to this inaccurate information on my credit report. Debt Collectors and Debt Buyers must furnish 100 % accurate information on consumers at all times. 15 USC 168s-2 Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION ( 1 ) PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors a person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. Please note that until the validity of this debt is verified, I demand that you CEASE all collection activities and CEASE REPORTING TO CREDIT BUREAUS IMMEDIATELY until complete and verified. Also, it is the duties of credit reporting agencies to uphold their grave responsibilities to supply 100 % accurate information ONLY on all consumer credit reports as the banking system itself hinges on accurate information. DELETE THIS ERRONEOUS INFORMATION from ALL credit bureaus immediately if the information can not be verified/validated. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Since XXXX, I have been dealing with XXXX XXXX XXXX including XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I remain XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, fraudulent accounts were opened in my name. Due to my health, I was unaware of these activities until my condition improved, at which point I began submitting disputes with both the creditors and credit bureaus. The creditors have investigated and confirmed the accounts were fraudulent, issuing deletion letters. Several creditors also confirmed that the transaction records are no longer available due to the age of the accounts and transfers to multiple parties. In other cases, creditors deleted the accounts without requiring further investigation based on the strength of the evidence. 

However, XXXX continues to report these fraudulent accounts. Despite having provided the FTC Identity Theft Report, proof of identity, and creditor deletion letters multiple times, XXXX refuses to delete these accounts, citing that I may have benefited from the transactions a baseless claim, especially since no transaction records have been provided to me, nor do the original creditors possess them. I have requested these transaction records from both XXXX and the creditors for over a year to no avail. 

XXXX 's implication that I benefited from these transactions, without providing any proof, is deeply harmful and unsupported by any evidence. Their failure to produce the transaction records or provide a detailed investigation contradicts their obligations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Furthermore, I understand that credit reporting bureaus do not generally maintain transaction records ; however, since XXXX is referring to these transactions, I suspect they may have more access to this data than they are disclosing. 

Additionally, I am not interested in providing more evidence as I have already submitted more than is legally required. Every prior complaint includes the FTC Identity Theft Report, hospice certification, and the creditor deletion letters. I am also documenting all communication for a future lawsuit, as my health currently prevents me from pursuing litigation. The stress from these ongoing false accusations has XXXX my condition, resulting in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, which I have documented.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to address the lack of response to my previous notice, dated XX/XX/year>, regarding the request for a copy of the 1099-C filed for the charged-off debt. XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX failure to provide a response leaves me no choice but to assume that you have neglected to comply with FEDERAL law by not filing a 1099-C as mandated. Consequently, I am compelled to inform you that I will report XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX to the IRS for potential tax fraud using Form 3949-A if prompt action is not taken. 

Furthermore, it is imperative that you notify XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax to delete this information from my credit report immediately. The account in question is detailed as follows : XXXX XXXX  As per IRS regulations, a canceled debt of {$600.00} or more necessitates the filing of a 1099-C form by federal or government agencies, or applicable financial entities. Failure to comply with this requirement constitutes tax fraud, a serious offense that I will not hesitate to report to the IRS. 

It is essential to understand that a canceled debt is considered ordinary income by the IRS. Consequently, any failure to file a 1099-C form, or any attempt to conceal such actions, constitutes inaccurate reporting. Income is not to be included on a credit report, and any such inclusion violates consumer laws and regulations. 

Your company 's actions are in clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 USC 1681s-2, which outlines the responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies. Under this statute, it is prohibited to furnish inaccurate information knowingly or with reasonable cause to believe it is inaccurate. 

It is evident from my previous communication and this notice that there is reasonable cause to believe the information provided is inaccurate. Therefore, it is imperative that you take immediate steps to rectify this situation by deleting the inaccurate information from all consumer reporting agencies. 

Failure to comply will result in legal action being pursued, including holding the XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, accountable for willful noncompliance under 15 USC 1681n ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). This statute stipulates that any person who willfully fails to comply with FCRA requirements may be liable for damages sustained by the consumer. 

I am currently in the process of securing housing, and the inaccurate information on my credit report is hindering my progress. I urge you to act swiftly and cease reporting this item to avoid further complications. 

I am currently in the process of securing housing, and the inaccurate information on my credit report is hindering my progress. I urge you to act swiftly and cease reporting this item to avoid further complications. Kindly delete this off my report immediately.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Request for Validation of Debt - XXXX  XXXX I am writing in response to an alleged debt associated with account number XXXX  XXXX I am requesting validation of this debt as per my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 USC 1692g . I dispute the validity of this debt and am immediately requesting that you provide the following information : 1. The original contract binding me to this so-called debt. 2. The PAYMENT HISTORY with the original creditor and balance. 3. Copy of PROOF OF DEBT ASSIGNMENT. 4. Proof that I legally owe this debt to YOUR agency. 5. Proof that you are licensed and able to collect on this debt in my state. 6. The original PURCHASE AGREEMENT. A. THIS IS NOT ANY DEBT THAT I ORIGINATED MYSELF. I HAVE NO IDEA WHERE THIS DEBT ORIGINATED FROM. This inaccurate information needs to be re-investigated immediately by both the Credit reporting agencies and the furnishers of this information that is appearing on my consumer report. NOTE : As you can see within the screenshots that I have attached, Equifax removed this account 45 days ago. Please complete this file. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681e ( b ), A credit reporting agency must maintain accurate records at all times within the files of consumers. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681i, please perform an internal re-investigation on the validity of this account in question that is showing up on your consumer report under my name and notify me of your results within 30 days of your receipt of this letter and update my credit report accordingly to your findings. If you are unable to provide proof of my requests, then the erroneous information MUST be DELETED within 30 days of your receipt of this letter from my credit report as this erroneous account is very misleading and not mine. This account is causing me great mental anguish and I am unable to obtain a mortgage at this present time due to this inaccurate information on my credit report. Debt Collectors and Debt Buyers must furnish 100 % accurate information on consumers at all times. 15 USC 168s-2 Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information to Consumer Reporting Agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION ( 1 ) PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors a person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. Please note that until the validity of this debt is verified, I demand that you CEASE all collection activities and CEASE REPORTING TO CREDIT BUREAUS IMMEDIATELY until complete and verified. Also, it is the duties of credit reporting agencies to uphold their grave responsibilities to supply 100 % accurate information ONLY on all consumer credit reports as the banking system itself hinges on accurate information. DELETE THIS ERRONEOUS INFORMATION from ALL credit bureaus immediately if the information can not be verified/validated. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
RE Account Numbers XXXX Affirm, This letter is a formal complaint that you are reporting my nonpublic and personal information without my written consent. Please show me the proof you sent me giving me options on how I could opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and proof showing you gave me the option to not disclose my transaction history each month with a third party. 
The law states a consumer must give written consent to opt out of sharing their nonpublic information to the financial institution. I did this and you stated I did not have that right to opt out. It is a violation to report my transactions or experiences between you and I with a third party or consumer reporting agency without my written consent. It is the policy stated by Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers to insure the security and confidentiality of their customer records and information. This includes protecting against unauthorized access to or use of such records or information which could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to any customer. 

I the consumer should have been given the opportunity, before such information was to be reported which gives me the option to direct you that such information should not be reported. I also should have been explained how I could exercise that nondisclosure option, which I was never advised. I have written multiple times, and you have continued to ignore my written request. 

Your failure to comply with the law and my written request has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Again, I am requesting to opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and for you to remove all my transaction history from all nonaffiliated third parties such as XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX immediately. Otherwise, I will pursue legal actions for every month my nonpublic information has been reported which could be a fine of {$1000.00} per violation. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, VA XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX Washington , DC XXXX Subject : Complaint Against TransUnion for Violating FCRA Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally file a complaint against TransUnion for violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). My complaint is based on their failure to report accurate information in my consumer report. 

On XX/XX/year>, I mailed my dispute to TransUnion regarding inaccurate reporting of my car loan with XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX  ). As of today, XX/XX/year>, it has been over 30 days, and I have yet to receive a satisfactory resolution. This inaccurate information has been present in my consumer report for over a year. 

I have maintained communication with XXXX  about the status of this account and possess all supporting documentation to substantiate my claims. Additionally, I have a transcript of my conversation with XXXX  confirming that my account was never reported as a charge-off. 

I would like to draw your attention to the following provisions of the FCRA that support my request : - **15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ** states that A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 
- **15 U.S. Code 1681e** mandates that Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. 

It is my belief that TransUnion and other credit bureaus are not maintaining reasonable procedures as required by law. 

I kindly request your assistance in ensuring that this inaccurate account is removed from my consumer report. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely,

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act, the list of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

Accounts XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

I looked at my TransUnion credit on XXXX XXXX XXXX and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ). And according to 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ) they're suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information. ( A ) In general, If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall- ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. And according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they're suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that information is inaccurate.

Only to find out XX/XX/XXXX both the XXXX XXXX duplicate charge and the partial credit were denied. The duplicate charge for a second time because they spoke with the hotel and they said they refunded the charge. And im not guaranteed hot water when I booked the room. And im disgusted. 
# 1 ) the hotel can not refund the payment to a deactivated card and closed account. Well they could but they didn't. But I can't dispute it with XXXX. I have to pay it.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card

Consumer complaint narrative:
Discrimination Case Against Barclays Bank Background : On XX/XX/year>, I attempted to make a reservation for a family vacation for nine adults traveling from XXXX, FL, to XXXX, XXXX. There was a special deal with XXXX XXXX listed on the XXXX website for round-trip tickets from XX/XX/year>, to XX/XX/year>, priced at approximately {$1100.00} each. As a long-time holder of a JetBlue credit card issued by Barclays Bank , I had a total credit balance of {$15000.00}, with over {$12000.00} available, along with approximately {$4000.00} in cash in my XXXX bank account. 
Incident : 1. Initial Purchase Attempt : I attempted to purchase three tickets but was prevented by XXXX 's system from using my cash funds for a flight involving another carrier. Consequently, I tried to purchase the tickets using my credit card for a total of {$3300.00}, but my transactions were rejected twice by Barclays.

2. Customer Service Experience : Frustrated, I called Barclays customer service. The representative was rude, particularly after learning my name ( XXXX XXXX XXXX and that I was calling from XXXX, XXXX. Despite verifying my identity, he insisted on a phone verification that I could not complete while on the line, then blocked my credit card account and hung up. 
3. Subsequent Calls : After calling back, I spoke with another representative who initially seemed helpful and sent me a verification code, which I confirmed. However, after a brief distraction while talking to his manager, he became rude and informed me that my credit card would remain blocked and I would lose access to my online account. He requested that I fax several documents, despite my overseas location.

4. Document Submission : I arranged for my daughter in the XXXX to prepare and fax the required documents. After several unsuccessful attempts due to claims of unclear faxes, I had her send the documents by mail, causing further delays. 
5. Continued Rejections : Two weeks later, a representative confirmed receipt of the documents but rejected my Social Security card because it lacked a stamp. I explained that this was the original document and could not be stamped, but she remained unhelpful and insisted that my account would remain blocked. 
6. Payment Issues : On XX/XX/year>, I was informed my account was overdue, even though I had mailed my payment on XX/XX/year>, which had already been cashed. My attempts to resolve the issue were met with repeated disconnections during calls. 
7. Ongoing Frustration : By XX/XX/year>, after multiple calls and failed attempts to resolve my account issues, I felt at a dead end. The rejection of my Social Security card and the overall treatment I received appeared discriminatory, particularly given my identity as an XXXX and XXXX. 
Consequences : 1. Due to Barclays ' overly stringent security measures specially against me, I was forced to purchase separate tickets for my family, resulting in a loss of {$6400.00} compared to the original fare. 
2. I lost between XXXX to XXXX frequent flyer miles. 
3. My credit card was locked, preventing access to nearly {$12000.00} in available credit. 
4. This XXXX XXXX issued by Barclays incurs an annual fee of {$99.00}, along with late fees and high interest rates, further complicating access to my account and statements. 
5. Barclays prevented me to let have an access on my account and refused to mail my statements to assist with my income tax. 
6. The block on my online account led to late payments, harming my credit score.

7. The verification process seemed discriminatory, particularly after the representative learned my name and location.

8. Barclays issued a false statement claiming I was late on my XXXX payments for more than 30 days, which was untrue because I had proven that it cash my check on XX/XX/XXXX which been mailed on XX/XX/XXXX for the due date of XX/XX/XXXX and harmed my payment history and credit score. 
9. Barclays decreased my line of credit from {$15000.00} to {$3700.00}. 
10. These actions affected my credit score by more than XXXX points in XXXX months, resulting in financial losses from other creditors. 
11. Barclays took these significant actions over a simple transaction with XXXX XXXX, which was confirmed twice and not a fraud or misleading transaction. 
12. Barclays asked for my driver license ID, a recent utility bill, and my social security card, which I fax twice and then mailed, and after received it decline my social security card. 
13. If Barclays does not accept valid U.S. documents from its citizens, it raises concerns about their ability to operate in the XXXX market. 
14. This situation has persisted for over five months, causing significant financial and emotional distress and real loses of {$70000.00} of line of credit and over {$10000.00} in cash due to misappropriation and discrimination 15. I believe XXXX XXXX would be concerned about the impact on their business due to this issue. 
Conclusion : The treatment I received from Barclays Bank appears discriminatory and has caused significant financial harm. I am seeking legal counsel to address these grievances and hold Barclays accountable for their actions.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
VIA FIRST CLASS MAIL, CERTIFIED MAIL, RETURN RECEIPT REQUESTED No. ______________________ [ XX/XX/XXXX ] Newrez LLC. dba Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, SC XXXX Re : Transaction between Homeowner and Bank/Servicer/Trust Company , Commencing with XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX Loan # XXXX XXXX to the present Loan # XXXX involving note and security deed which is secured by residential property located at [ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX Fl. XXXX ] To Whom It May Concern : I am Pro Se / Homeowner concerned with potential fraudulent and deceptive practices by unscrupulous mortgage brokers and more specifically, the loan transaction entered into with the above mentioned Bank , Loan Servicing / & Trust Company ( s ), herein referred to as ( " the transaction '' ). I submitted a Qualified Qualified Written Request on Wednesday, XX/XX/XXXX. Requesting that they provide me with an itemization of all of the Requested items to include, The loan disbursements, the loan charges, the current principal balance, and all payments received from me, as well as any and all other requested documents as per the " RESPA QUALIFIED WRITTEN REQUEST, COMPLAINT, DISPUTE OF DEBTH & VALIDATION OF DEBT LETTER AND TILA REQUEST, so that we may determine the exact amount needed for tender. 

I the Homeowner has a present right to rescind the transaction for at least the following reason : 1. As I was not provided with the type of notice of my right of rescission under the Truth in Lending Act ( " TILA '' ), 15 U.S.C. 1601 et seq., that is required by the Federal Regulation. 
2. Under The Real-estate Settlement Procedures Act, codifies as Title 12 2605 ( e ) ( 1 ) ( B ) ( e ) and Reg. X 3500.21 ( f ) 2 of the United States Code 3. As well as a request under Truth in Lending Act [ TILA ] 15 U.S.C. 1601, et seq. 
4. Please note RESPA provides substantial penalties and fines for non-compliance or failure to answer my questions within twenty one ( 21 ) days of its receipt. Moreover, I was kind enough to extend an additional 15 days as per your request. 
5. No response was ever received, rendering me unable to independently validate this debt, by conducting a complete exam, audit, review and accounting of their so called mortgage loan, from its inception through the present date. 
XXXX A. The Rescission model forms in Regulation Z Appendices XXXX to XXXX are shorter and safer, simply providing : I WISH TO CANCEL Newrez LLC. dba Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing XXXX XXXX  Loan Number : - XXXX Property Address : - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Fl. XXXX Homeowners XXXX XXXX XXXX. See discussion in XXXX. Revised : XX/XX/XXXX Reserve Board for a refinancing with the same lender. 
Homeowner reserves all rights to raise additional or alternative grounds for rescission under state or federal law. 

I am a Pro Se Homeowner, authorized to rescind the transaction and hereby exercise that right pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1635, and Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. 1026.23. This rescission is effective as to all aspects of " the transaction ''. You were given twenty days after receipt of this " RESPA QUALIFIED WRITTEN REQUEST, COMPLAINT, DISPUTE OF DEBTH & VALIDATION OF DEBT LETTER AND TILA REQUEST '' letter received by you on Tuesday, XX/XX/XXXX. Whereby I requested you respond by including any an all " requested documents '' as allowed by congress, signed in connection therewith, or it would automatically and immediately places the parties in the status quo ante, i.e., in their pre-contractual positions, before the transaction was entered into, with no cloud on the dead and title of the property located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX. 

You were hereby given twenty days after to return all monies paid by me in the transaction and to take any action necessary to reflect the termination of any security interest created under the transaction, as you are clouding the title to my primary residence. Please be advised that if you do not cancel the security interest and return all consideration paid by me within twenty days of receipt of this letter, you will be responsible for actual and statutory damages pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1640 ( a ). 

If you wish to contact me regarding this matter, I can be reached at XXXX Sincerely, XXXX XXXX cc. CFPB & Florida Attorney General

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Goldman Sachs due to their policy limitations with the Apple Card, which have caused significant negative impacts on my credit score and financial standing. I believe Goldman Sachs should take responsibility for these issues and provide a satisfactory resolution. 

When XXXX first launched, I created an XXXX XXXX using my personal email address for my XXXX  purchases. Later, when XXXX introduced the XXXX, XXXX was launched as a way to sync all your devices, I subscribed and was given a XXXX email, which became a second XXXXXXXX XXXX that was required to sync my devices. Over time, XXXX transitioned from XXXX to XXXX, making XXXX a free service for the public. Throughout these platform changes, I continued using the XXXX XXXX XXXX as my main account, while my purchases remained tied to my original XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX 

Unfortunately, XXXX has never provided a solution to merge these multiple XXXX XXXX, which has left me in a difficult position. Recently, I subscribed to XXXX XXXX XXXX to share services with my elderly parents, which highlighted the long-standing conflict between my XXXX XXXX XXXX. After extensive time on the phone with XXXX XXXX and multiple visits to the XXXX XXXX, it became clear that merging these accounts was not possible. Therefore, I manually transferred data from my XXXX  account to my original XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  in order to preserve my purchases from the past 21 years. 

In order to consolidate everything to XXXX XXXX XXXX, the last step was to transfer my Apple Card from my XXXX XXXX XXXX to my XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX However, I was informed by Goldman Sachs Apple Card Support that it was not possible due to fraud protection policies. As a result, I was left with two unacceptable options : either I could retain my Apple Card under the XXXX XXXX XXXX and lose access to the purchases I had made since 2003, or I could close my Apple Card account and apply for a new one under my XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. 

Unfortunately, I was forced to choose the latter option in order to put everything, once and for all, under XXXX XXXX XXXX, which resulted in a negative impact on my credit score. According to XXXX, my score dropped from XXXX to XXXX, and according to XXXX, it dropped from XXXX to XXXX. Moreover, my credit limit was reduced from {$22000.00} to {$10000.00} as an introductory limit on the new card, despite my excellent payment history with the previous card, where I consistently paid off my balance early every month and never had a late payment. This decline in my credit score is the direct result of closing the Apple Card account, a decision I had no control over due to the policy limitations imposed by Goldman Sachs. 

In light of this situation, I believe Goldman Sachs must take responsibility for the negative impact their policy has had on me. A satisfactory resolution to this issue would include the following steps : 1. Goldman Sachs should provide a letter to each of the three major credit bureausXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXinforming them that their policy failure forced me to close my Apple Card account against my will and reopen another card which automatically gave me a lesser limit through no fault of my own which caused an unnecessary hit to my credit score and request the restoration of my credit score.

2. Goldman Sachs should provide me with copies of these letters so that I may follow up directly with the credit agencies. 

3. Goldman Sachs should restore my credit limit to the previous {$22000.00}, which was the limit on my original card.

4. Goldman Sachs should make a concerted effort to change their policy so that this issue does not affect other customers in the future. 

I trust that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will take this matter seriously and assist in ensuring a fair resolution. I place a high level of importance on maintaining my credit score, and I am deeply concerned that a company would implement a policy that negatively impacts its customers ' credit standing. Such a policy raises serious concerns about the fairness of its practices and the long-term effects on consumer credit health. 

Thank you for your attention to this important matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against Security Credit Services , LLC, for engaging in deceptive and misleading practices in violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Over the course of my interactions with them, Security Credit Services has demonstrated multiple failures and violations that have caused significant harm and confusion regarding a disputed debt account under my name.

Here are the key issues Ive faced : 1. Failure to Report Dispute Status to Credit Bureaus ( Violation of FCRA ) : Despite Security Credit Services claim in their correspondence that they reported my account as disputed to the credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ), I have confirmed through my XXXX credit report that no such update was made. 
This is a violation of the FCRA as they are required to report accurate information, including dispute statuses, to the credit bureaus. The failure to do so is misleading and harms my credit standing. 

2. Misleading and Conflicting Contact Information ( Violation of FDCPA ) : Security Credit Services has repeatedly provided inconsistent and conflicting addresses, making it impossible to communicate effectively with them regarding this debt. 
Here are the addresses Ive received : An initial invalid address : ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX ), which resulted in returned certified mail ( evidence available ). 
A second address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX. 
A third address : po box XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX. 
These conflicting addresses are not only confusing but also suggest that Security Credit Services is deliberately avoiding transparency and making it difficult for me, as the consumer, to resolve the matter. This behavior violates the FDCPA, which requires debt collectors to provide accurate contact information and act in good faith.

3. Failure to Properly Investigate My Identity Theft Claim ( Violation of FDCPA ) : I reported this debt as fraudulent due to identity theft, providing Security Credit Services with my FTC Identity Theft Report, police report, and bank notice of a data breach ( related to the theft of my personal information ).

Despite this, Security Credit Services has failed to properly investigate my claim, instead repeatedly asking for unnecessary documents ( such as a notarized affidavit ), which I have already provided through other means. This delay and failure to act promptly further violate their obligations under the FDCPA. 

4. Deceptive Practices in Requesting Additional Documentation : Security Credit Services continues to demand more personal information, such as a State Issued ID and notarized Affidavit of Forgery. Given that I am a victim of identity theft, I am extremely hesitant to provide further sensitive information to a company that has already demonstrated a lack of professionalism and good faith. 
Their insistence on this additional documentation, despite having sufficient proof of the fraudulent nature of the debt, further illustrates their bad-faith approach to this matter. 

Supporting Evidence : I have attached the following documents to support my complaint : Letters from Security Credit Services showing multiple conflicting addresses. 
Return receipts and proof of failed communication attempts due to their invalid contact information. 
FTC Identity Theft Report and XXXX Bank XXXX XXXX Notice of Data Breach, show my personal information was compromised.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
RE Account Numbers XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Citi, This letter is a formal complaint that you are reporting my nonpublic and personal information without my written consent. Please show me the proof you sent me giving me options on how I could opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and proof showing you gave me the option to not disclose my transaction history each month with a third party.

The law states a consumer must give written consent to opt out of sharing their nonpublic information to the financial institution. I did this and you stated I did not have that right to opt out. It is a violation to report my transactions or experiences between you and I with a third party or consumer reporting agency without my written consent. It is the policy stated by Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers to insure the security and confidentiality of their customer records and information. This includes protecting against unauthorized access to or use of such records or information which could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to any customer.

I the consumer should have been given the opportunity, before such information was to be reported which gives me the option to direct you that such information should not be reported. I also should have been explained how I could exercise that nondisclosure option, which I was never advised. I have written multiple times, and you have continued to ignore my written request.

Your failure to comply with the law and my written request has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Again, I am requesting to opt out of sharing my nonpublic information and for you to remove all my transaction history from all nonaffiliated
third parties such as XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX immediately. Otherwise, I will pursue legal actions for every month my nonpublic information has been reported which could be a fine of {$1000.00} per violation.

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX, BENEFICIARY Without Recourse, All Rights Reserved
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
