Debt collection
Checking or savings account
Issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> I arrived at XXXX XXXX place in XXXX, Massachusetts for union conference. When I arrived there I was told I had to put a credit card for incidental fees which was around {$400.00}. I was resistant but I gave it to them. At that time I was told I had another charge because of a no-show day before. I told him that can not be because I never said I was going to stay at their hotel on Saturday and had no knowledge. In fact, I stayed at another hotel that day and have proof and that I was not going to pay for that fee and was adamant about that. The person did not charge me for the fee and instead charging for the incidental which I got returned to me. Around a month later I looked at my bank statement and I was charged for that fee. I asked why I was charged to that fee. They told me because it was a no-show feat. I told him I never made a reservation or said I was going to stay at their hotel Saturday which they replied XXXX did who was in charge of booking hotel for our Union Branch that we're going to this national trip. I told them XXXX had no permission to use my card, and I didn't even know she booked the hotel for me that night. it was a back and forth with the hotel and eventually they admit it via email that it was between XXXX and a hotel and my card shouldn't have been involved. I called my bank and they issued me a credit while they were investigating this. A month later XX/XX/XXXX I see I got charged again and that the bank decided to rule in favor of the hotel even though I provided proof somebody else told the company to use my card who had no authorization to use my card and that another person made the bookings that wasn't me. Chase refused to take my evidence into consideration and instead told me I had to go though XXXX and/or the hotel. XXXX told me she never told the hotel to change the reservation. I talked to the hotel and they were issuing me a refund 3 to 5 days, but my account is negative now and chase refused to issue me a credit because according to them the hotel provided " proof '' that I booked the room. The hotel changed the actual reservation I never called to make a reservation to that hotel.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I did not authorize or open SELFHELP, this account is a fraud. This is a clear case of identity theft, and you do not have my consent to use my personal information, including my SSN. The lack of a signed contract or agreement further proves that this collection is fraudulent. Under 15 U.S.C. 1666b, 15 U.S.C. 1692g, and 15 U.S.C. 1692k, I demand that this account be removed from my credit report immediately. 


**SBNASELFLNDR** Status : Closed, Paid Original balance : {$720.00} Late Payments : XX/XX/2022 ( 30 days ), XX/XX/2022 ( 60 days ) Violation : The reporting of late payments violates 15 USC 1681e ( b ) and 15 USC 1681c-2 . There is no proof provided that payments were made. Please remove late payments immediately. DELETE THE ACCOUNT OR REMOVE LATE PAYMENTS I DO NOT WANT THIS ACCOUNT TO REPORT IF YOUR COMPANY IS GOING TO CONTINUE TO VIOLATE MY RIGHTS WITH INACCURACIES.

Violations of Consumer Rights : False Reporting and Misrepresentation : Your agency has inaccurately reported this account under my name without providing any validation or authorization from my side. This constitutes a violation of 15 USC 1692e ( 5 ), as false representation and deceptive practices are being used to collect an illegitimate debt.

Unauthorized Use of My Social Security Number : You have reported and attempted to collect this debt using my Social Security Number ( SSN ) without my consent, which is a serious violation of my privacy and identity.

Failure to Validate the Debt : Under 15 USC 1692g, I have not received any valid proof of this debt, and your failure to provide appropriate documentation to verify this debt constitutes a violation of FDCPA guidelines.

Identity Theft and Fraud : This account was opened fraudulently, without my knowledge or consent, and is a clear instance of identity theft. As such, this is also a violation of the FCRA and FDCPA. Under these laws, you are required to investigate and delete fraudulent accounts immediately.

5. Refusal to Remove and Update Failure to comply with my demands for removal, deletion, and updates of these fraudulent accounts will result in arbitration and potential legal action. By refusing to update my credit report accurately, you are further violating 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 5 ). The ongoing inaccurate reporting of these accounts will lead to statutory damages and claims for false reporting under the FCRA.

6. Potential for Arbitration and Damages If my demands are not met within 30 days, I will seek arbitration for statutory damages due to false reporting and violations of the FCRA and FDCPA. The damages resulting from inaccurate information will be sought to the fullest extent of the law.

7. Authorization and Verification I am the only debtor who can verify the legitimacy of any accounts under my name. I hereby demand that you delete all the negative items, unverifiable accounts, and inaccurate reports associated with my credit profile. Cease and desist all further communication and collection attempts immediately.

Product: Debt collection
Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was on vacation in XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/year>. I had a man ask me into his store, XXXX, when I was walking through a shopping plaza. I said no was on my way back to the hotel where my husband was waiting. He said no problem I just want to give you coupon to the store we are opening in XXXX Florida where I am from. Just take a minute. I was there over XXXX hours just trying to get back to my husband. It was one product after another. I had kept saying no and then decided the best way to get out was to just get the product and I could return it or cancel it. Now that I think back it was very strange how they made you fill out a shipping label for each item individually. Then after filling out the shipping label, they would hand it back saying they just needed the signature to verify it was the correct address. As I said this went on over XXXX hours. The people were just talking about their families to me and showing me pictures of their children. I was in like a dental chair laying back with him standing beside me while all this was going on. I honestly could not wait to get out of there. I even told him I would never use the products ; I one point I said get this off me they made me XXXX 
Finally, I gave in and said fine just let me get this done to get back to my husband. I guess they know to just keep badgering older women, XXXX, on their own until they give in. 
Got back to the hotel and told my husband what I had just gone through. I was going to go home and call them to cancel it. 
We got home the XXXX of XXXX which was a Saturday and just before XXXX XXXX. 
Once at home I went to check on the company and see if other people had had the same issues as I had had. Oh, yes many said the same thing. Then I checked further and found the equipment was dangerous to use if you were taking medicines that would not let you in the sun for extended periods of time, which I am on. 
On Tuesday, XX/XX/XXXX after the holiday weekend, I called the company telling them I wanted to cancel the orders and that also I was unable to use all their products. She said no problem will we swap them all out for one of their products that was safe to use. I said why would I want all of them the same when each was supposed to do different things. I said no I want them all cancelled. Then that is when she said, " Well you can't get refunds ''. I said I don't want them it will not be a refund you still have them I don't have any of your products. She said sorry they have already been shipped to you. I said then I will refuse them. I actually was not at my home the first time they tried to deliver them, then I left to take my daughter, son-in-law and granddaughter for XXXX weeks to XXXX. I was out of the country the second time they tried to deliver. As it turned out I never did refuse the delivery. It also was very odd that the order was placed to be shipped by the company the day before I called, which was Monday XXXX XXXX. 
Now I have no products and have paid a total of {$9200.00}. 
I put in a request to have this charge removed from my account. They refuse because XXXX says I signed the no refunds shipping page, I called and was told NO refunds, and I refused the order. They are in the right said Comenity Bank when they sent me the letter on XX/XX/year>. On XX/XX/year>, I wrote a rebuttal letter and mailed it certified mail. They responded to by telling me to submit a billing dispute. That was a great reply since I was doing a rebuttal to the response of my dispute. On XX/XX/year> I again tried reaching out to Comenity Bank asking for a refund since I don't have anything to show for over {$9.00} XXXX dollars. They responded 2 days later on the XXXX of XXXX to tell me this claim was already closed and that a letter had been sent to me on XX/XX/year>. 
In my opinion XXXX has fought this battle many times and knows just what the credit cards want to see to justify the charges. 
I believe in my heart this is an elaborate scam to scam old ladies out of what money they do have, and the credit card company goes right along with it. It seems like a polite, legal way to steal from people, or should I say scam. 
I do not want the products, but do not have any products from them. I just want my {$9200.00} back.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Problem with the payoff process at the end of the loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX, I had a loan with opp loans that was about to be completely paid off. I went to refinance it and was offered more money. When I signed up to receive another loan, this loan had processed to someone else 's bank account that was not mine and was a completely different bank. Opp attempted to collect this money back from unknow bank account and they were not successful and ended up sticking me with the mistake they made. I am being held liable for money that I did not borrow and was not a mistake I made. I respectfully request the fair debt collection practices act To Whom It May Concern : This letter is being sent to you in response to notices sent to me from your company and more importantly, due to your erroneous reporting to the Credit Bureaus, the highly negative impact on my personal credit report. Please be advised that this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692g Sec.809 ( b ) that your claim is disputed and validation is requested. 
This is NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to the above-named Title and Section. I respectfully request that your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you regarding the following account numbers : Please provide me with : 1. What the money you say I owe is for.

2. A detailed explanation of how you calculated what you say I owe.

3. Copies of any and all papers that prove I agreed to pay what you say I owe 3. Copies of any and all papers that prove I agreed to pay what you say I owe.

4. A verification or copy of any judgment, if applicable.

5. The identity, name, and address of the original creditor.

6. Proof that the Statute of Limitations has not expired on this account.

7. Proof that you are licensed to collect in my state.

8. Your license numbers and Registered Agent or Agent of Service. 
At this time, I will also inform you that if your offices have reported invalidated information to any of the 3 major Credit Bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX or XXXX ) this action might constitute fraud under both Federal and State Laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found on any of my credit reports by your company or the company that you represent, I will not hesitate to bring legal action against you for the following : 1. Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act 2. Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act 3. Defamation of Character If your offices can provide proper documentation as requested in the following Declaration, I will require at least 30 days to investigate this information and during such time all collection activity must cease and desist. 
Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with my legal counsel for suit. This includes listing any information with a credit reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated or verifying an account as accurate, when in fact there is no provided proof that it is accurate. If your company fails to respond to this validation request within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my credit report and a copy of such deletion ( to any/all of the 3 major credit reporting bureaus : XXXX, XXXX and XXXX ) request shall be sent to me immediately. I would also like to request, in writing, that no telephone contact be made by your company to my home or my place of employment. If your offices attempt telephone communication with me, including but not limited to computer generated calls and calls or correspondence sent to or with any third parties, it will be considered harassment and I will have no choice but to file suit. All future communications with me MUST be done in writing and sent to the address noted in this letter by XXXX.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Re : Chase Mortgage Complaint To Whom It May Concern : My name is XXXX XXXX, I have had a mortgage on my property at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, NJ XXXX since XXXX from JP Morgan Chase. Loan Mortgage # XXXX. I believe that they have been charging me for insurance that I have never needed since its inception in XXXX. I dispute this alleged debt, as well as any ownership or responsibility for it still today. Furthermore, the data furnisher was back then reporting inaccurate and mismatched data across all 3 of my consumer credit reports. This original request was sent in late XXXX. In XXXX of XXXX, I was still receiving numerous calls and contacts by them attempting to collect an alleged debt that i am not responsible for, and that they could not properly validate, and i sent a second CEASE AND DESIST LETTER to the debt collector. This letter was mailed via certified mail and delivery confirmed. Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
My mortgage was sold to a new loan servicer. At my previous servicer, I would make 1-2 payments throughout the month when I got paid, and then at the end of the month, submitted a final payment for whatever was remaining. Not only was this easier for my finances, but it allowed me to get a bit ahead on the interest accrual for that month by making some earlier payments.

Making partial payments in advance is " simply not allowed '' at XXXX / LoanCare. 
How is this legal? I am forced to barrow money to own a home, and when I would like to pay a portion of it back, I'm barred from doing so - just so the lender can maximize the interest they collect? 

I signed a contract with XXXX XXXX, whom allowed partial/early payments. I did not consent to be transferred to LoanCare ( I know this is common practice in the mortgage industry, but still ) however the new servicer DOES NOT offer all the same services that I desired when I entered into contract with Rocket.

How is this not deceptive to the consumer?

Consumer complaint narrative:
Discover appplication number XXXX I was notified by Discover that I qualified for the balance transfer special through their Discover IT card. I submitted an application and the application was denied. I asked the representative why the application was denied when I was notified I was pre approved and the representative stated " I am not sure ma'am you will receive a letter in the mail regarding the reason your application was denied. I waited for the letter to come in the mail and letter cites the following reasons : High balance on all revolving accounts, number of open revolving accounts with hig utilization and high balance on newest installment loans. 
I would like to highlight that I currently hold a credit card with Discover. Therefore, Discover is aware of my utilization rates, credit accounts, and my credit score. I assume that is the reason I was screened " pre-qualified ''. However, being denied for a card I was told I was pre-qualified for, is misleading. 
Please keep in mind that I have not missed a payment on any of my credit accounts and I have received a pay increase with my employer. I applied for the card because I was told I " prequalified ''. Also, with a balance transfer, I am not creating any new debt. A balance transfer would allow me to consolidate existing debt and place me, in better financial standing. 

In addition to the balance transfer application being denied, I logged into my Discover account and received an advertisement stating I have been " pre approved '' for a consolidation loan. I am notifying the regulatory agency because the company has failed to rectify the matter and continue deceptive practices. As a consumer, I find Discover 's practices to be distasteful because of the heavy penalty I now have to pay. As a result, my credit score has decreased.
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute a derogatory mark on my credit report related to a timeshare debt is now owned by a collections agency. This debt is invalid due to the coercive and unethical practices involved in obtaining the original contract, as well as my status as a XXXX-XXXX  veteran with confirmed XXXX XXXX XXXX. Below, I will outline the circumstances surrounding the agreement and why I believe this derogatory mark should be removed from my credit report. 
Background : Date of Visit to XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/year> Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX Current Creditor : Monterey Financial Services, LLC Disputed Amount : {$14.00}, XXXX Details of the Incident : Upon my arrival at the airport in XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/year>, I was approached by someone who claimed to be my shuttle service but instead led me to a promotional setup for XXXX XXXX. They enticed me with offers of free drinks and a massage, which persuaded me to agree to visit the resort the next day. 

On the day of the visit, I was transported to XXXX XXXX, where I was served brunch, accompanied by mimosas, followed by a tour of the resorts private residences. During the sales presentation, I was pressured into making a significant deposit on my credit card and signing a contract for a timeshare that I do not recall consenting to fully or understanding. I was under the influence of alcohol throughout this process. 

Subsequent Charges and Impact : Following this agreement, I began receiving charges of over {$200.00} per month from XXXX XXXX, which I was unaware I had agreed to. I have not returned to XXXX since this visit and have never used any of the services associated with the timeshare for which I am being billed. 

My credit score has been negatively impacted within the past month due to this issue, even though I have never agreed to make any payments on this debt, as I do not consider it mine. Over the past year, I have received multiple collections notices, and these financial and legal issues have caused me significant distress, especially after my separation from my partner. 

Despite my attempts to contact XXXX to discuss the debt, my efforts were ignored. I also contacted the XXXX XXXX XXXX  to seek assistance, but they were unable to help due to the time passed and the status of the account being transferred to collections. 

I requested a copy of the contract from XXXX XXXX, as I do not recall signing it and have limited memory of the event due to my mental health conditions and the intoxication I was under at the time. 

My XXXX-XXXX  Status, XXXX XXXX and XXXX  : I am a XXXX XXXX  XXXX veteran diagnosed with XXXX  XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. At the time of my visit to XXXX XXXX, I was heavily XXXX  for these conditions, which severely affected my ability to make sound decisions in situations of stress or under the influence of alcohol. My partner later inquired about the agreement, and I had no memory of the contract or the terms involved due to both my XXXX XXXX conditions and the XXXX  state I was in during the signing of the agreement. 

As a XXXX veteran protected under the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ( XXXX ), I believe the circumstances under which this contract was signed were not only unethical but also invalid. No proper accommodations were made to ensure I fully understood the terms of the agreement, and my vulnerability due to XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX  conditions were exploited in this high-pressure sales environment.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I contacted XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) with NEXA Mortgage ( NMLS XXXX ) on a home purchase in XXXX. We were working on a " piggyback '' purchase with a conventional 1st mortgage ( through XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) and a XXXX XXXX option. XXXX sent me initial disclosures on a rate of 4.875 % on XX/XX/year>. I used the interest rate, payment, and XXXX loan amount assured to me by XXXX to make an offer on a property ( which was accepted ) and set a close date for XX/XX/year>. Originally, I was told ( and provided numbers on an initial disclosure ) that I would be able to temporarily buy down the interest rate on my loan ( a XXXX buydown option ), have a XXXX loan at ~ $ XXXX, and bring approximately $ XXXX to closing ). Between then and today, several things have gone off the rails. 

XXXX has deliberately mislead and misstated loan terms and statuses in an effort to just " get the deal done. '' Originally XXXX told me that he could find a XXXX loan program that would lend on my property in Missouri for an interest rate " between 8 and 9 %. '' He send me numbers from one 2nd lender that quoted me out at 9 %, but proceeded to process my application through another lender ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) which priced me at 9.875 % ( and provided me a conditional approval letter on XX/XX/XXXX for a loan amount of ~ $ XXXX ). That loan was based on a purchase price of $ XXXX, when, in fact, the sale price of the property, as reflected on the sales contract which had been provided, was $ XXXX. I raised this to XXXX 's attention and he said " It's no problem, they just have the wrong purchase amount, no big deal, they'll fix it. '' Throughout the process, I have routinely asked XXXX for updates on my loans and have either been ignored or provided answers like " I've been working on this all day '' or " you're almost through underwriting, I should have docs today. '' On Friday XX/XX/XXXX, I asked XXXX when I should lock in my rate. XXXX ignored my question and did not provide any answers on when that should occur. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX provided me another set of initial disclosures without explaining why the loan was redisclosed, despite my question. This disclosure still had an interest rate at 4.875 %. No answers were provided on why the new disclosures were needed. 

At approximately XXXX CT on Friday, XX/XX/XXXX ( less than a week before closing and after normal business hours, which limited my ability to escalate the issue, I believe intentionally ), XXXX called to inform me that the first loan was about to be redisclosed AGAIN, but at an interest rate of 5.5 %. And that the XXXX loan would only be approved at ~ $ XXXX and would require me to bring an ADDITIONAL $ XXXX to closing. This change was due to the fact that the XXXX mortgage lender mistakenly believed the purchase price to be $ XXXX ( rather than $ XXXX ) and the house appraised for more than $ XXXX, but less than $ XXXX, causing the XXXX lender to reduce the loan amount accordingly. 

I raised several concerns with XXXX about the differences in terms. His response was just sign the LE so we can get the XXXX tomorrow or else your loan wont close on time. He repeatedly told me to just sign the documents and everything would work out like it needed to on Monday, but threatened me that if I didnt, my closing would get pushed back and I might even lose the house. He repeatedly used my wifes pregnant condition ( she is due a couple of weeks after closing ) as an abusive technique to force me to sign unfavorable terms. 

XXXX has not only engaged in deceptive ( changing loan terms at the last minute ) and abusive ( just sign the documents or else ) practices, but has also exercised gross negligence in the processing of my loan packet from day one. We have emails back until the beginning of this application where he outright stated untrue claims. We also have emails documenting that our questions were either ignored or brushed aside. We also have text messages documenting similar statements. 

At this point, I do not know if I will be able to purchase this home because of Jasons and NEXAs actions ( or lack of actions ). My original purchase contract had me closing on XX/XX/XXXX and taking possession on XX/XX/XXXX. I am not only at risk for missing closing, but also losing the house, my $ XXXX XXXX money deposit, my fees for the inspection and appraisal. Additionally, my wife is almost 9 months pregnant and is due on XX/XX/XXXX. Because of XXXX and XXXX, I am at risk of being homeless when we give birth to this baby ( we have been staying in temporary housing in XXXX  XXXX until we close on this house ).

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
According to my credit report, WILLIAM & FUDGE INC is reporting misleading and deceptive information. WILLIAM & FUDGE INC is alleging I owe them {$10000.00}. WILLIAM & FUDGE INC has abused and deceived me into believing that I was obligated to pay this alleged debt. This alleged debt has been charged off via 1099 C cancellation of debt to the Internal Revenue Service by the original company. Now WILLIAM & FUDGE INC requires me to pay them. Furthermore WILLIAM & FUDGE INC then shares my nonpublic personal information, transactions and experiences with XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX without my consent furnishing inaccurate and deceptive information while tarnishing my character and general reputation. 

WILLIAM & FUDGE INC is in violation of Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 U.S.C. 1692l ( d ), 1692o ; Title X of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act ( Dodd-Frank Act ).

It is illegal for WILLIAM & FUDGE INC to add this misleading and inaccurate account on my credit report. WILLIAM & FUDGE INC has been notified of ; the misleading and inaccurate information, my right to refuse to pay such alleged debt and to cease any further communication regarding the inaccurate information. WILLIAM &
FUDGE INC must cease ANY and ALL collection attempts in
regards to the alleged debts mentioned within.

Congress finds there is abundant evidence of the use of abusive, deceptive and unfair debt collection practices pursuant to 15 U.S.Code 1692. WILLIAM & FUDGE INC has strict liability and must comply with all statutes and regulations set forth. XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX  ) - Proof of Claim

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative: My former student loan servicer was Great Lakes. I have only federal loans. The servicer are switched from Great Lakes to Nelnet. I submitted an income driven repayment, plan application as well as a public student loan forgiveness application with great lakes. They never processed the application nor did they forward that to Nelnet. I was not able to access my account to check on this during the transition. But I am now seeing that the applications Were pending and Nelnet is saying they never received them from Great Lakes. I have to start all over and Ive been in public service for XXXX years. I have an interest rate that is now higher than what I originally agreed to. Im looking at {$130000.00} in student loan debt. I recently submitted my student loan forgiveness application through the federal student aid website which went through. That is how I found out great lakes did not process my applications or share them with Nelnet. Nelnet is saying I never submitted these, but it is clear I did on the federal website. I am unable to access my account at Nelnet. They are saying no username or account created. Every time I try to call them to get my account fixed, they say they dont have record of it and that I am in default. It has been extremely difficult to navigate having my loan provider switch and interest rates change. In addition to that, I have no recourse and, getting access to Nelnet.
